Toussaint was born November 2, 1969, and he's married to Rémilokou, a seamstress. The couple has four children, three of whom they are supporting. Some of the children are in school. Toussaint lives with his wife and children and mostly assumes the family's expenses on his own, although he is sometimes assisted by his wife.

Toussaint quit high school and thereafter learned the sewing business, which he has been doing for twenty years and which allows him to feed his family. At the same time, he sells charcoal from his home. 

In order to better satisfy his clientele and to upgrade his sewing workshop through the purchase of an embroidery machine, Toussaint is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé for the second time.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and sewing notions.

loans.name: Khov

texts.en:
Khov is twenty years old and a resident of the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province. She has a single child and a life partner in her husband who is a meatball seller in the mobile place.

Since 2009 Khov has been planting rice and a few types of fruit to sell. She also sells some vegetables in the market for extra income. She is able to earn a profit of around $2 a day to use for her family’s expenses such as food, utilities and other necessary expenditures.

Khov would like a loan to purchase more vegetables to sell and additional meatballs for her husband’s business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell and additional meatballs for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Laura Azucena

texts.es:
La Señora Laura es socia del banco comunal El Control, vive en la comunidad de Punta Corral en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por su belleza natural y colonial, su gente es amable, cordial y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora Laura tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene 2 niñas de 9 y 6 años de edad que estudian en una escuelita de la comunidad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico industrial, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su papá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
Doña Laura trabaja como empleada domestica desde muy joven, labora de lunes a sábados todo el día. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes, pollos y patos a los que los vende en su propia comunidad.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales para la construcción de su casa como: cemento, ladrillos, arena, ripio, hierro, etc.

Su meta es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Laura is a member of the communal bank "El Control."  She lives in the community of Punta Corral in the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for its natural beauty and colonial heritage; its people are friendly and maintain their culture and traditions.

Laura is 34 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 9 and 6 who study in a school in the community.  Her husband is an industrial mechanic.  They do not have their own house, so they live with her father and share the household expenses with him.

Laura has worked as a domestic since she was very young.  She works all day from Monday through Saturday.  At her house, she also raises guinea pigs, chickens and ducks that she sells in her community.

This is her second loan with her communal bank, and she will invest the proceeds in construction materials for her house, such as: cement, bricks, sand, gravel, steel, etc.

Her goal is to finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, gravel, steel, etc.

loans.name: Nancy Yaneth

texts.es: Nancy Yaneth D. veintinueve años D. edad vive con sus hijos los cuales asisten a una escuela cercana a donD. residen. Ella posee una venta D. empanadas y ha empezado la venta D. pupusas tiene mucha clientela pues lo que prepara lo hace con un sabor exquisito muy aseado y a precio accesible. Para Nancy luchar por un futuro mejor y alcanzar el triunfo es su más granD. meta es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materiales como plátanos, frijoles, leche, azúcar, maíz, queso, chicharrón, D. esta manera  ella podrá seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades D. sus clientes y estará más cerca D. cumplir su meta. Nancy tiene la confianza que todo su esfuerzo le permitirá darle a su familia una vida plena y una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Nancy Yaneth is 29 years old, and she lives with her children.  The children go to a school that is close to where they live.

She sells empanadas, and she has started selling “pupusas” (corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, beans, and pork, then grilled).  She has lots of customers.  The food she prepares has an exquisite flavor, is sumptuous, and has an accessible price. 

Nancy’s biggest goal is to fight for a better future and to triumph.  That is why she is requesting a loan from Intergral.  The loan will allow her to buy food like bananas, beans, milk, sugar, corn, cheese, and “chicharrón” (fried pork rinds).  That way she will be able to continue meeting her customers’ needs, and she will be closer to achieving her goal.

Nancy is confident that all of her efforts will allow her to give her family a fulfilling life and financial stability.

loans.use: to buy bananas, beans, milk, sugar, corn, cheese, and “chicharrón” (fried pork rinds).

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years. She does small-scale farming and sells her produce at the local market. She is 43 years old and married to Mwangi. They have two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of her friends, and this will be her fourth loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Mary hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Soledad le esta haciendo falta el techo y un cuarto al frente de la casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es cemento, block, varilla y madera para poder realizar la mejorar que es el techo de concreto y empezar la construcción de un cuarto.
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y que le patrimonio de sus dos hijo este en mejores condiciones.
Doña Soledad planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como enfermera de una clínica  de salud, ya que su esposo se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que tiene de su trabajo.
texts.en: Soledad’s house still needs a roof and a room in front.  She is asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies: cement, concrete block, iron rods and lumber to do the improvement which will be a concrete roof and begin to build the room.  She wants to improve her family’s quality of life and that her two children’s estate will be in better conditions.  Soledad plans to repay the loan with the salary she earns working as a Nurse at a health clinic since her husband will take care of family expenses with income he earns at his job.

loans.use: to buy concrete roofing tiles and to enlarge the house.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 52 years old. She lives in the village of Chkhari, West Georgia. Marine is married and lives with her husband Zurab, two adult sons (28 and 25 years old), her daughter-in-law and 4-year-old granddaughter. 

Marine heads up the agricultural activities of the family. They have three cows and sell on average 60 kg of cheese per month on the local open market. Also they have 0.75 hectares of land, where maize and grapes are grown. Harvested maize is used in the farm for feeding the cows; grapes, harvested from 1000 grape vines are sold locally. Marine’s sons assist her in the farm. Zurab has a truck and provides transportation services to the local population and businesses. He earns approximately 500 Laris per month. Total average monthly income of the family is 1300 Laris. 

With the requested credit Marine’s family will purchase a mini-bus. It will be equipped with liquid gas tanks and used as mobile gas station – filling the empty gas tanks of the villagers in the district. The new business initiative will be led by Marine’s sons. It will significantly increase the income of the family. Increased income will allow them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus for their business selling liquid gas from tanks.

loans.name: Fredric

texts.en:
Fredric is a father of seven children, the eldest of whom is 25 years old. He has been doing this farming for the past three years.
He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Jean Edmond

texts.fr:
Client de 51 ans , célibataire avec 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 2 et 25 ans, a l’arrêt de ses études en classe de 3eme, son père qui était menuisier le place  dans son propre atelier pour apprentissage  et a la fin de son apprentissage il a toujours travaille avec son père, mais quand celui-ci meurt il hérite de l’atelier et étend l’atelier dans la fabrication de meubles, des cercueils et fait des charpente et toitures des maisons.
Ses recettes sont de 150.000 frs a 600.000 frs par semaine, quand les activités marchent.
Avec le prêt, il veut premièrement augmenter sa capacité de fabrication  en  achetant des bastings, du bois blancs des lattes, des contres plaques , des chevrons. 
Il a pour ambition d'agrandir son atelier et d'acheter une tour a bois.
texts.en:
This client is 51 years old, single, with 4 children aged between 2 and 25. 

When he finished his studies at the third level, his father, a cabinet maker, took him on in his workshop as an apprentice. At the end of his apprenticeship, he continued to work with his father and after his father's death, he inherited the workshop. Now, he has expanded to include furniture and coffins. He also makes house frames and roofs. 

When business is good, his weekly revenue is between 150,000 and 600,000 francs. With this loan, he wants to primarily increase his production capacity by buying molding, white wood and slats, plywood and herringbone wood. His ambition is to expand his workshop and to buy a lathe.

loans.use: to buy wood such as herringbone planks, molding, slats, white wood and red wood.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Lucila es socia del banco comunal Nuevas amigas del distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos y solo uno está a su cargo, su esposo trabaja en construcción civil.
Se dedica a la venta y confección de blusas,  lleva un año trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, estos préstamos le sirven para comprar el material que necesita para confeccionar sus prendas.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 kilos de algodón llano, 10 kilos de algodón matizados, 15 aplicaciones, hilos, 1 rollo de elástico, 2 metros de blonda.

Con este negocio puede ayudar con los gastos del hogar a su esposo que  no gana mucho pero les alcanza para poder pagar los gastos básicos del hogar.
texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the “Nuevas Amigas” (New Girlfriends) communal bank in Callería District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 44 years old, married and has five children but only one is still in her care.  Her husband works in civil construction.

She sells and makes blouses.  She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for a year.  These loans help her buy the materials she needs to make her garments.

She will use her new, 1000 new sol, loan to buy 5 kilos of bleached cotton, ten kilos of dyed cotton, 15 appliqués, thread, a roll of elastic and two meters of lace trim.

With this business she’s able to help cover household expenses.  Her husband doesn’t earn much but it’s enough to be able to pay basic household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and cotton.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth vive con su familia y tiene 56 años y su microempresa es una soda en dicha ciudad. Tiene más de 10 años de tener este negocio trabaja con sus 2 hijas teniendo así un negocio familiar, por este medio generan un ingreso para 3 familias. La inversión a realizar es para la compra de mercadería como gaseosas, galletas, materia prima para la preparación de almuerzos  y otros.
El horario del local es de 7 de la mañana a 8 de la noche, ya que también atiende la escuela nocturna, además los Sábados trabaja de 8 de la mañana a 3 de la tarde, ya que la escuela también trabaja con estudiantes a distancia.
Su familia  es  el principal apoyo del negocio, sus hijas trabajan con ella y generan los ingresos para mantener a sus hijos (nietos de la solicitante) y la confianza que tiene Elizabeth en ellas hacen que el negocio camine mejor.
Su principal clientela son los estudiantes de primaria y el personal docente y administrativo, quienes que se deleitan con los deliciosos almuerzos  preparados por ella y además disfrutan de una golosina para el postre. Los ingresos de la actividad son fijos, por lo que el pago de este préstamo es viable. Además este es el tercer crédito que la clienta solicita a Kiva, por medio de Fundación Mujer, demostró tener una excelente conducta de pago con este, cancelándolo en la fecha establecida. Además es una clienta de amplia trayectoria.
texts.en:
Elizabeth lives with her family.  She is 56 years old, and her micro-business is a snack business in the aforementioned city.  The investment she is making is for the purchase of merchandise such as sodas, cookies, and raw ingredients for the preparation of lunches and other food.

Her schedule for her premises is from 7 in the morning until 8 in the evening, as she also serves the evening-classes at the school.  In addition, on Saturdays she works from 8 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon, as the school also works with students who come from a distance.

Her family are her main support for the business, as her daughters work with her and earn income to support their children (the requester's grandchildren).  The trust that Elizabeth has in her daughters makes the business work more smoothly.

Her main customers are the primary school students and the teachers and administrative staff, who delight in the delicious meals she prepares and who also enjoy something sweet for dessert.  Her income from this activity is fixed, which is why repayment of this loan is viable.  Also, this is the third loan that this client is requesting from Kiva through Fundación Mujer.  She has demonstrated excellent repayment behavior, repaying the loan on the established schedule.  She is also a client who is on a growth trajectory.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (ice-cream, candy, soda and other things) and raw ingredients for making lunches and fast food.

loans.name: Cinthia Carolina

texts.es: Doña Cinthia Carolina es una mujer de 22 años es madre de dos menores de edad, una mujer muy trabajadora, esforzada, luchadora,  hace 3 años maneja el negocio de la venta de ropa empezó con pocos productos ahora tiene una gran  clientela. Con este crédito comprara productos como pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes entre otros productos. Ella se levanta temprano todos los días y abre el negocio a las 8 de la mañana y cierra a las 7 de la noche.
texts.en: Cinthia Carolina is a 22-year-old woman and the mother of two minors.  She’s a very hardworking, dedicated, tenacious woman.  She’s been selling clothes for the last three years.  She started out with just a few items but now has a large clientele.  She will use this loan to buy products like pants, shirts, skirts and outfits, among others.  She rises early every day and opens her business at 8am closing at 7pm.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 29-year-old single man. James operates a vegetable kiosk and sells his goods at the market. His primary customers are neighbors and local residents. He describes his greatest business challenge to be low demand during the rainy season and his highest monthly expenses are food and other household items. He rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

James will use the 5,000 Kenya shilling (KES) loan to purchase vegetables in bulk. James aspires to see the business grow enough to open more stalls in the future. He joined Yehu because of their favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en: Zahra is a 21-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents and two siblings. She is a fresh student seeking graduation. Because of her parent’s unsatisfactory revenue, she decided to start her career in 2010 working as a hostess in a local company in order to become the main one responsible for paying her educational fees. But since her income is barely sufficient, she is asking today to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for her courses at the university. She is studying Accounting and this is her fourth year. In the future, she plans to take another Kiva loan to pursue her MBA.

loans.use: To pay for her courses at the university

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
53-year-old Corazon earns a living buying and selling fresh fruits and vegetables. She is from Baclayon, Bohol. Corazon also manages a rice farm. Corazon sells her produce at her town's market. Each month, Corazon earns 10000 PHP with her business.

Corazon has requested a loan to purchase seeds and more fruits to sell. Corazon hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and more fruits to sell

loans.name: Maiva

texts.en:
Maiva is 40 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past ten years, Maiva has been working hard to manage her hardware store, which sells building supplies like piping.

To help expand her business, Maiva has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more construction supplies for resale, and it will help Maiva to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Maiva hopes that in the future she will be able to establish another business. 

Maiva is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Maiva who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more construction supplies for resale.

loans.name: Jose Delson

texts.en:
Jose is 28 years old and resides in Cofradía. He's been in a committed relationship for eight years and has a nine year old daughter. His wife Nelly works in a factory in the area. 

Jose and his wife both contribute their incomes to cover household expenses. 

Jose used to work in a grocery store, but about eight months ago he decided to open his own pulpería. His sister, who is also a merchant, inspired him to do so. He used his savings to get the shop up and running and has continued investing his profits into the store. Jose offers a variety of products that you would likely find in any corner store. He sells everything from rice, baked goods like semitas and magdalenas, lard, canned vegetables, toilet paper, spices, cleaning products, meat, and candy. He attends clients from seven AM to eight PM daily. 

Jose plans to use this 8000 Lempira (HNL) loan to increase his inventory and purchase dairy products and other groceries. His goal is to grow his business and offer his clients a greater variety of products.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products and other groceries.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 51 years old, married and has two children.  He owns a posho mill where he sells maize flour.  He has been in the business for 11 years.  He has employed two people in the business.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access financial resources easily.  This has helped him to improve his business. 

Geoffrey hopes to open other outlets of his business in five years.  He has requested a loan for 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sacks of maize.

loans.use: buy maize

loans.name: Lizardo Baudillo

texts.es:
Lizardo Baudillo  tiene 46 años de estado civil Casado, vive con esposa y los 8 hijos, en el Cantón Chillanes provincia  de Bolívar.

La ventanilla LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Josè de Guayabal, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz fréjol ,arveja, compra venta de ganado, chanchos, pollos, cuyes. 

Lizardo Baudillo  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arveja, y ala crianza de pollos chanchos, ganados. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Chillanes.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz, fréjol, arveja y  para la compra de comida adecuada para sus animales. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es incrementar los sembríos de maíz y poder construir algún día su casita, para tener mejores ingresos y así un mejor estilo de vida.
 Le gusta jugar volé  y  que llegue el carnaval.
texts.en:
Lizardo Baudillo is 46 years old, married, and lives with his wife and eight children in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolívar.

The loan group Luz y Progreso [Light and Progress] is located in the San José de Guayabal area, in the Chillanes canton. This loan group is devoted to short term agricultural work; i.e. cultivating corn, beans, and peas, as well as buying and selling cattle, pigs, chicken, and guinea pigs.

Lizardo Baudillo is a farmer who cultivates corn, beans, and peas, and also raises chicken, pigs, and cattle. He buys and sells his livestock in Chillanes.

He is requesting the loan to purchase manure, urea, and liquid fertilizers for use in cultivating corn, beans, and peas, and also to purchase adequate feed for his livestock. The loan has helped him to increase his revenue to provide for his family and also to invest. His dream is to increase his corn fields, and also to be able to build a house some day. He also hopes to have greater income, as well as a better quality of life.

He likes to play volleyball, and is looking forward to the arrival of the Carnival festival.

loans.use: to purchase manure, urea, and liquid fertilizers for use in cultivating corn, beans, and peas.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is a thirty-eight-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He has been a farmer for ten years and he is still reaping tangible benefits from this work.  His major hardship is the current inflation rate.  His dream is to become a reknowned farmer in the region with over forty acres of farm land.  Solomon needs this loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael, 45, is a father of 12 children, with the youngest aged 2 and oldest aged 25. Like about a third of farmers in the Maya Mountain Cacao network, Rafael lives in the village of San Jose, in the district of Toledo, where he’s been farming 4 acres of cacao for twenty years. 

Cacao is the sole source of income for Rafael's family, and his favorite crop because it has a market. “The problem is you cannot do a lot, because poor farmers don’t have finance to invest [in their farms]. That’s why we’re looking for loans,” he told Maya Mountain Cacao. Rafael's first loan will go towards cleaning, which for cacao farmers means removing the underbrush in order to plant new seedlings, prepare for pruning or harvesting by opening pathways and access to the trees. 

Rafael recently expanded the scope of his cacao farm by transplanting – moving seedlings from bags into the ground – 300 trees. Planting new seedlings is a long-term investment, as cacao trees take 3-5 years to start producing pods. 

Investment in the farm facilitated by loans translates to investment in his children, 5 of whom are currently enrolled in school. Besides taking the kids away from helping around the farm, school in Belize has annual tuition costs that are prohibitive for many Maya farmers in Toledo. Rafel's older kids followed his example by taking up cacao farming themselves.

loans.use: To hire help with cleaning his farm of almost 1,000 cacao trees.

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe TERIYA ont en moyenne 41ans, 4enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de la boisson,des céréales, des habits, du savon et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe TERIYA sont à leur 6ème prêt solidaire. MARGUERITE, 2ème femme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 casiers COCACOLA, 6 casiers de FANTA,  8 casiers de BEER, 10Kgs de Sel, 10Kgs d’oignon, 3 paquets de Cube Maggi, 20Litres d’huile et 3Kgs de piment. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.

loans.use: Achat de la boisson, des condiments

loans.name: Rufiji Group

texts.en:
Asia, who is in 20', she is married with one little child. She has been running a food vending smallrestaurant for 2 years now. She works from 8 am day to 9 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  
  
This will be Asia’ 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the food stock for her restaurant and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. 

She used the profit to repay her loans and to take care of her family. She will use this loan to buy the out of stock cooking materials for her restaurant. She dreams of opening a new restaurant at the city centre.

 Asia will share this loan with her group "RUFIJI" which consist of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the out of stock cooking materials for her restaurant

loans.name: Astou

texts.en:
This loan request has been submitted by the thirty members of the women’s tontine Soppanté Takku Liggéey, represented by Astou T..  Based in the traditional fishing village of Yoff, the group is well known locally for their manufacture of quality juices, syrups and marmalades from such typical African produce as bissap (dried and preserved flowers of the bissap plant), lemon, “monkey bread” (pulp from the seed pods of the baobab tree), made (a round tree fruit whose sour seeds are used in cooking), and tamarind.  The women of Soppanté Takku Liggéey also engage in other activities such as fruit and vegetable gardening, production of traditional hand-dyed cloth, and the provision of literacy training in the local language, Wolof.  The $900 loan requested by the group will be used to expand and commercialize their juice- and marmalade-production business, including the purchase of ingredients such as bissap flowers, tamarind, sugar, “monkey bread”, lemon, ginger, and made fruits; equipment including pots, a puree mill, and a supply of water and cooking gas; and transportation of the finished products to market.  Repayments will be made on a monthly basis throughout the term of the loan, which has been agreed at twelve months from the date funds are received by the group.

 

 

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group.  Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines.  Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities.  Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members.  However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income.  This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities.  Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Juice and Marmalade Production

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en:
Bahar has been engaged in this business for 5 years. She is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region, settled in Sumgait city. She is 40, has 2 children. She has his own mini shop. This 40-year-old woman is the only breadwinner in family. Having borrowed the loan amount of $500 from Normicro she rented the grocery store and bought foodstuffs: sugar, tea, rice and etc. 
Now Bahar wants loan amount of  $1500 to increase the range of goods and to buy the refrigerator.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods and to buy the refrigerator

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo lives in a rented house on Jaimes Freyre Avenue in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz. She occupies two rooms, for which the monthly rent is 200 Bolivanos (the equivalent of approximately US $25.00). She is 25 years old and is a single mother. She works making cakes with her mother and her sister. She has been an IMPRO client since 2004, and with the financing that has been provided to her she has bought an oven and to date has been increasing her work materials by buying cake molds and other tools she needs. Because of her past good credit, it is entirely feasible to grant her a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

.Consuelo vive en alquiler en la Av. Jaimes Freyre de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, ocupa dos habitaciones cuyo alquiler mensual es de Bs.200.-(equivalente a $us.25.- aproximadamente) Tiene 25 años de edad es madre soltera y se dedica a la elaboración de tortas junto con su mamá y hermana. Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2004, y con el financiamiento que se le ha dado ella se compró en un principio el horno y hasta la fecha va aumentando su material de trabajo comprando moldes, y otras herramientas que requiere para su trabajo. Por el antecedente histórico se considera factible otorgarle un nuevo crédito

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sayaad Khanam

texts.en: Sayaad Khanam lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with her family. She wants to help her husband support the family. She is an embroiderer who has good experience. She took her first cycle group loan and bought new machines and made a good income. Now she wants to take anther loan to rent a shop and make a good business to support her family with her husband. She is happy that she can expand her business with this loan.

loans.use: To rent a shop

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim S. is forty-eight years old and runs a fish wholesale business in Magburaka town. He has been running the business for a long time. Ibrahim is married with four children. He normally distributes the fish to his customers (retailers) in various villages and collects the payments every week.

Ibrahim has many customers who have asked him to supply fish but he could not meet all their demands. He needs to raise more funds to increase his outreach and is requesting a loan of $200.

Ibrahim said, “I did not have a chance for education, and the best thing I can give my children for their future is education.” Ibrahim is determined to educate his children. He plans to build a family house, too. He has acquired land.

loans.use: Meet customers' demands by having more fish to sell wholesale

loans.name: Fetu

texts.en: Fetu, 22 is a young mother of two children.  She joined the Program last year when she needed help for her business.  She runs a canteen at the village’s primary school. She earns $100.00-$150.00 a week and uses that money to support her family.

loans.use: To buy supplies and stock for her canteen

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is a 43-year-old widow. She lives with her three children (2 in school) in Nyamasaria Kisumu Kenya. She lost her husband due to HIV-related illness. Pamela, who is living positively, is a symbol of hope to many. With support from KMET, Pamela was able to acquire a popcorn fryer. She uses this to make popcorn, which she sells to the community, schools and also during events. Due to high demand, especially in schools, she plans to purchase another fryer with US $700 she has applied for.

loans.use: Buy a popcorn fryer.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Hường is 33 years old. She is married and has 4 children who are still attending school. They live in Nghi Lộc, Nghệ An (north central province of Vietnam). Ms Hường is a TYM member since 200. Her first loan was 50 USD which was invested in raising pigs & poultry. After 5 years, she has acquired lots of experience so the production has raised as well. She decided to borrow more money to invest in her business. Her investment was well managed, her revenue is now 125 USD a month. She's requesting a new loan of 575 USD to buy chickens, pigs and feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hường, 33 tuổi, Nghi Lộc, Nghệ An tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2001. Gia đình chị gồm hai vợ chồng và 4 đứa con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Với mức vay đầu tiên là 50USD chị đã đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Qua 5 năm số vốn và kinh nghiệm sản xuất tích lũy tăng dần, chị chủ động nâng mức vốn mở rộng dự án chăn nuôi của gia đình. Sử dụng những đồng vốn rất có hiệu quả với mức thu nhập 125USD/tháng, dự định chị sẽ xin vay 575USD để mua thêm lợn, gà cùng thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs, chickens and feed.

loans.name: Natalia Helena

texts.pt:
Natalia Helena A. is married and has three children, two of them school-age. They live in the neighborhood of Chalembe 2, in Mozambique, and both her and her husband work for the Police Department in the province of Inhambane. Natalia just joined the credit program with the intent of buying some kitchen appliances for her home. She plans to start a business in the near future, since, as their children grow, her and her husband's salaries alone aren't enough to take care of all the household and school expenses.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva volunteer.

Natalia e casada e mae de 3 filhos. Natalia e policia e o seu marido tambem. Ambos estao afectos ao Comando da Policia na Provincia de Inhambane. O casal tem 3 filhos. Os dois mais velhos estao a estudar mas o mais novo ainda nao estuda porque nao tem idade para se matricular numa escola. Natalia esta entrando pela primeira vez no Programa de Cr]edito. Ela pretende comprar electrodomesticos para a sua casa. Mas no futuro pensa em abrir um negocio, ois que o seu salario e o do seu marido nao sao suficientes para prover todas as necessidades familiares a medida que os filhos vao crescendo.

loans.use: To buy kitchen appliances for her home

loans.name: Ashurhol

texts.ru:
Ashurhol I. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 52 years old, is married and has 6 children. He has a university diploma. Ashurhol is a teacher and works in school number 45 of Yavan. He also sells farm animals. He buys young calves, feeds them for 40-45 days and then sells them at the markets. This business is a decent source of income for the client. Moreover, Ashurhol sells calves to butchers who provide the city's markets with valuable fresh meat at affordable prices. The client plans to use the loan in order to purchase another calf. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Иброгимов Ашурхол Юсупович проживает в городе Яван.Возраст 52 года,женат ,имеет 6 детей. Образование высшее. По специальности учитель.Работает в средней школе № 45 города Явана. Занимается торговлей крупнорогатого скота. Скупает бычков молодых, откармливает около 40-45 дней , а затем продает на тех же рынках. Данный бизнес является неплохим источником дохода для семьи клиента. кроме того он продает бычков мясникам , которые обеспечивают рынки города полноценным и свежим мясом , к тому же по доступным ценам. Клиент планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить дополнительно еще одного бычка. погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Yenku

texts.en: Yenku has overcome significant obstacles to get where he is today.  In particular, Yenku is a double-amputee who lost both his hands during the brutal civil war in Sierra Leone.  A 30-year-old father of three, he runs a small grocery stall in Kundibaya village, which is 15 miles from Kabala town.  Before he received a loan from SMT, Yenku survived by begging in the street of Kabala town and, as one might imagine, life was extremely hard for him and his family.  Through lengthy discussions with SMT staff, SMT recognized that Yenku has strong business skills.  Consequently, SMT provided him with a loan of $100 to start a business with a solidarity group comprised of four other war amputees.  Today, Yenku is off the street and is managing his business in the village.  He sells cotton clothes, cosmetics, etc.  Assisted by his wife, the family has built a small mud house and has a small farm.  Yanku’s plan is to build a bright future for his children and his wife, and he would like to expand his business.  He is requesting a loan of Le. 1,000,000.

loans.use: To continue to overcome obstacles by expanding his grocery stall in order to provide for his family

loans.name: Jesus Ignacia

texts.es:
The client Jesus Ignacia is soliciting the refinancing of her third loan to invest in building her room. She lives in the 7th zone of Nueva Guinea and is a teacher at the Francisco Aaron School. She has a 2-year-old boy and is pregnant with her second child. Her partner works in construction and helps with the family expenses. With the first loans she received, Jesus was able to buy a lot. Her dream was to build a room and a kitchen on the lot so she could live in her own place since she lives with relatives and her family is growing and needs a bigger place live.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

La Clienta Jesus Ignacia esta soliictando refinanciamiento de su tercer credito para invertirlo en construir su cuarto , ella vive en la zona numero 7 de Nueva Guinea, es Docente de la Escuela Francisco Aaron, tiene un niño de 2 años y actualmente esta embarazada , su compañero quien trabaja en la cosntruccion como ayudante de albañil apoyando a su compañera con los gastos familiares, Doña Jesus con los primeros creditos logro comprar un solar en el que su sueño ha sido construir un cuarto y su cocina para pasarse a vivir a su propio hogar ya que actualmente vive con sus familiaresy la familia ya esta creciendo necesitando de su propio lugar.

loans.use: To improve her home.

loans.name: Abiola

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abiola A. was born on April 10, 1963; she is married and the mother of three (03) children. After she left her studies, fifteen years ago, she launched herself in the sale of jewelry and cosmetics. This business is booming but she lacks the financial means to meet her customers’ demand.

She is requesting a financial support of $1,000 to enhance her display and to acquire a wider variety of jewelry. This loan will allow her to satisfy the market’s demand, to provide for her needs, and to take care of her family.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née le 10 Avril 1963 à Lomé, Madame A. Abiola est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Après avoir abandonné ses études, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des bijoux et des produits de beauté il y a 15 ans. Ce commerce est très florissant mais elle manque de moyens pour satisfaire sa clientèle.

Elle sollicite un appui financier de $1000 pour augmenter son étalage et acquérir d’autres variétés de bijoux. Ce crédit lui permettra de satisfaire la demande sur le marché, de subvenir à ses besoins et prendre soin de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase and sale of jewelry

Achat et vente de bijoux

loans.name: Alice Abebi

texts.fr:
Alice Abebi O. was born in 1962 in the city of Pobe in the Plateau department. She is married to Jean-Marie Zinsoule and has 4 children 3 of which are still dependent on her. At her house, located in Kpakpakanmè, she resells various items such as lanterns, soap and sugar. She also delivers and sells shoes to local retailers. She also sells shoes retail herself. Considering how many retailers are comming to her to purchase shoes for sale, she is asking for a third loan to be able to satisfy the demand.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Née vers les années 1962 à POBE dans le département du Plateau, dame O. Alice Abebi est mariée à Monsieur ZINSOULE Jean-Marie et mère de 4 enfants dont 3 sont encore à sa charge. A son domicile, situé à Kpakpakanmè, elle revend divers articles tels que les lanternes, du savon, du sucre. Aussi, vend-t-elle des chaussures qu'elle livre à des détaillants. Elle aussi vend en délails les chaussures. Compte tenu de l'augmentation du nombre de détaillants qui viennent s'approvisionner auprès d'elle, elle sollicite son troisième crédit afin de satisfaire leur sattentes.

loans.use: Purchase 60 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila is an industrious mother who recently started selling food at the same premises where her husband sells beer; so they work together all day long. Nevertheless, if this business is duly set up it can provide them with a very good income as it is located on the local square where there is a lot of people. Therefore, Lucila and her husband need to adjust and improve the appearance of the premises with adornments and furniture to make them more comfortable to the customers. They need a loan of 1100 soles to help improve the look of their premises as the food is very delicious and of good quality.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Lucila es emprendedora madre que inició su negocio de venta de comida recientemente en el mismo local donde su esposo vende cerveza, juntos trabajan todo el día. Sin embargo, si este negocio es debidamente implementado puede dejarles muy buenos ingresos, ya que está ubicado en la plaza de su localidad donde hay mucha concurrencia de personas. Por ello, Lucila y su esposo quiere ambientar y mejorar la apariencia de su local con diversos adornos y muebles que sean acogedores para sus clientes. Para esto requieren de la suma de 1100 soles, dinero que le ayudaría a mejorar el aspecto de su local, ya que su comida es muy rica y de buena calidad.

loans.use: Purchase adornments and furniture to improve appearance of a restaurant.

loans.name: Soraida Del Socorro

texts.es:
Soraida is 36 years old, and is married. She and her husband have 3 children (a girl of 6, and two boys, 16 & 17), whom they support.. She lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood.

Her husband's business is to peddle wood from a large cart, and they now have 10 years experience with his business, but they began by selling fruit alone. They expect to diversify their product offering in the future to meet the demands of the market.

She plans on using this loan to purchase building materials in order to add a room to their house. They hope to give each child their own room so they can be more comfortable and have more independence.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Soraida tiene 36 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casada, su esposo se dedica a la venta ambulante en un carretón de leña. Tiene 3 hijos, una niña de 6 años y dos varones de 16 y 17 años, quienes a sus padres en las actividades que realizan. Tiene 10 años de tener su negocio y empezó vendiendo frutas solamente, espera en un futuro poder diversificar los productos que ofrece para obtener nuevos segmentos de mercado. El uso del crédito será para la compra de materiales de construcción y hacer un anexo a una habitación, ya que sus planes son poder dar a cada hijo una habitación para que estos puedan estar más cómodos y tener más independencia

loans.use: To purchase construction materials so she can add a room onto her house. (Hacer un anexo a una habitación de su vivienda)

loans.name: Flora Del Socorro

texts.es: Flora C. tiene dos hijos  y un nieto, los que son sostenidos en todos sus gastos por ella, aunque tiene su marido que la apoya, ella con la ganancia de su negocio colabora en los gastos del hogar; Flora es comerciante tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación y también se dedica a la venta de opa usada, estos dos negocios le generan los ingresoso para la manutención de su familia. El credito solicitado es para el mejoramiento del negocio con adquisicion de materiales y productos, como granos básicos y asi mostrar una mejor presentacion y calidad del servicio que brinda.
texts.en:
Flora C. has two children and a grandson whose living expenses are entirely supported by her. Although she has a husband who helps her, she contributes to houshold expenses with the earnings from her business. Flora is a shopkeeper who has a small convenience store in her house and she also sells used clothing. These two businesses generate income to maintain the family. The loan she requests it so improve the business by buying supplies and products such as basic grains, and in this way to show that she offers better goods and quality of service.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic goods for her business

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana María pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Auroras en Acción, tiene 46 años y vive en la calle Espelucín Manzana 2 Lote 4 del pueblo joven Aurora Díaz, distrito Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Cursó hasta el tercer año de secundaria y ya no siguió estudiando porque se comprometió y formó una familia, tuvo 4 hijos y ahora tiene un segundo compromiso con el señor Luis Ramírez Luján y tienen una hija que aún es una niña.
Ana María tuvo que trabajar mucho para mantener a  sus hijos, gracias a su madre ella aprendió el negocio de la venta de comida y es así como se inicia como microempresaria vendiendo comida a señores que abastecen combustible. Incursionó  en la venta de combustible para las embarcaciones.
Una parte de su negocio lo tiene en su casa y la otra en la Avenida Petroperú.
Su primer crédito fue de 300 soles que se devolvieron en 4 meses y pudo implementar su negocio.
Con este crédito de 1700 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, piensa invertir en combustible.
Sueña con poner un gran restaurant.
texts.en:
Ana Maria belongs to the Las Auroras en Accion community bank. She is 46 years old and lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She finished three years of high school but left to get married and start a family. She had 4 children and later married her second husband, Luis Ramirez Lujan, with whom she has a young daughter. Ana Maria had to work very hard to provide for her children. Thanks to her mother, she learned about food sales and that's how she started her small business selling food to women who supply fuel. She then charged into the sale of fuel for boats. One part of her business is located in her house and the other part on the Avenida Petroperu. Her first loan was for 300 soles which she repaid in 4 months and used to start her business. With this loan of 1700 soles, to be repaid in 6 installments, she plans to invest in fuel. She dreams of setting up a nice restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in fuel for resale.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhorn P. is a villager in Ang Tapouk village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is 29 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others two are too young to work or study. Mrs. Sokhorn P. works as a duck breeder. Her husband, Mr. Eim Vuth, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Unfortunately, the fertility of his fields is low and he does not have enough money to hire laborers to fertilize and work his fields to improve his crops.

In order to deal these problems, Mrs. Sokhorn P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and hire labors to support her husband’s fields and make them more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers.

loans.name: I Gede Gama

texts.id: I Gede Gama memiliki lahan seluas 1 hektar. Seluruh lahan yang dimilikinya ditanami padi, karena pengairan didaerahnya cukup memadai sepanjang tahun. Namun, selama masa tanam 1 tahun, lahan tersebut ditanami secara bergantian antara padi, jagung dan kedelai. Hal itu dilakukan untuk mempertahankan kesuburan tanah dan hal itu tergantung pada cuaca. Saat ini sedang musim hujan, musim yang tepat untuk menanam padi. Untuk mengolah lahan seluas itu, I Gede Gama memerlukan tambahan dana untuk meningkatkan hasil yang ingin didapatnya. Sebelumnya ia hanya mengandalkan bibit padi biasa sehingga hasil yang didapatnya tidak maksimal karena padinya mudah terserang penyakit. Selain untuk membeli bibit kwalitas unggul, pinjaman tersebut dipergunakan untuk menyewa tenaga kerja saat pengolahan tanah dan membeli anti hama. Menggunakan bibit unggul adalah hal yang pertama kali bagi I Gede Gama dan ia yakin usahanya akan sukses sehingga ia bisa meningkatkan pendapatannya untuk kesejahteraan keluarganya.
texts.en:
I Gede Gama owned a 1-hectare land. The entire land owned is planted with paddy, as there is adequate irrigation all year round in the area. Thus in the growing period of a year, the mentioned land can be planted on a rotational basis with paddy, corn and soy. This rotational planting is to preserve richness of the land and also dependent on the weather. Currently the rainy season, the appropriate season for planting paddy. For cultivating the land of this size, I Gede Gama required additional funds to increase the expected yield. Previously he only rely on the regular paddy seedlings so resulting in less than maximum yield as paddy is easily infested by disease. Apart from purchasing superior quality paddy seedlings, the mentioned loan will also be used to hire labor during the cultivating period and purchase pesticide. This is the first time I Gede Gama is using superior seedlings and he is assured his effort will be successful so increases his income for the family’s welfare.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase superior quality paddy seedlings, pesticide and hire labor (Membeli bibit padi kwalitas unggul, anti hama dan menyewa tenaga kerja)

loans.name: Uputaua

texts.en:
Uputaua M., 36, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in the flea market business. She sells to the general public and tourists 6 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (~333 USD).

SPBD loans are Uputaua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase bracelets, Samoan handbags, shoes, lavalava (traditional Samoan wrap-around waist cloths), and Samoan oil.

loans.use: purchase Samoan handbags, bracelets, lavalava, earrings, shoes, and Samoan oil

loans.name: Dul

texts.en: Dul S., 28, is married and lives with three of her children in Siem Reap province. She and her husband work catching and selling fish in the market to earn a combined income of around US$ 8 every day. Mrs. Dul S. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to replace their old motor for their boat and purchase more fishing implements to catch more fish.

loans.use: To replace their old motor and purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en: Mrs. Sophat S. is a farmer in the Boeung Tranh Village in the Takeo Province. She is 43 years old and the mother of eight children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory; another is a vegetable seller in the local market; three are enrolled in the local school; and the remaining two are too young to work or study. Mrs. Sophat S. owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. With this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile which has badly affected her crops. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, and she would use the rest of money to buy a cow for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Sam Chay, is laborer who has been hired the other villagers to pump the water into their field. He is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and to buy a cow

loans.name: Silvio Antonio

texts.es: Silvio Antonio M. A. tiene 36 años de edad, su estado civil es casado. Don Silvio tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Don Silvio es una joyería. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a esta actividad ya que dio inicio a este negocio a la edad de 9 años por que su Papa le enseño y con el apoyo de los créditos ha logrado mejorar su negocio. Los propósitos de Don Silvio son de  mejorar las condiciones de su local ya que es muy pequeño. El financiamiento que el solicita es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que comprar suficiente material para la elaboración de prendas. Sus deseos son de comprar un local propio y no pagar la renta del local que posee actualmente. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 7.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Silvio Antonio M. A. is 36 years of age and married. Mr. Silvio has two children who currently study. Mr. Silvio's economic activity is a jewelry store. He has worked in this job for more than 16 years and he started this business at the age of 9 when his dad taught him. With the support of the loans he has been able to improve his business. Mr. Silvio's goals are to improve the conditions of his premises since it is very small. The loan he requests is for supplies for work since he has to buy sufficient materials to make jewelry. He desires to buy his own location and not have to pay to rent the one he is currently using. The amount he requests is 7,000 Cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for work

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
La Sra Rosalina B. tiene 46 años de edad. Está casada con el señor Bernardo Ojeda de 57 años de edad y las dos personas se dedican a trabajar en una despensa que funciona en su domicilio. El señor tambien suele hacer trabajos temporales para una maderera conocida de la cuidad, con lo cual ayuda a solventar los gastos de la casa.

Tienen dos hijos menores que todavia estan estudiando y otra mayor que ya esta casada y vive al lado de ellos en un predio dentro de un asentamiento. La señora Rosalina siempre se dedico a la despensa. Anteriormente, su negocio lo tenia en otra parte hasta que lograron comprar un terreno donde construyeron para su casa. 

El prestamo quiere para poder surtir de mercaderias su despensa como ser la compra de azucar,harina,pan, fideos y articulos de primera necesidad,la cual tiene mucha demanda porque es uno de los pocos que funciona en la zona.
texts.en:
Señora Rosalina B. is 46 and is married to señor Bernardo Ojeda, who is 57. Both of them work at a grocery store that they have in their house. Bernardo also does temporary jobs at a lumber yard in their city, which helps them pay for their home's expenses. They have two young children who are in school and an older one who is married and lives in a settlement on a piece of land next to them. Señora Rosalina has always worked in her grocery store. She used to have her business in another area until they were able to buy some land where they built their house. She would like this loan to be able to stock her store with merchandise such as sugar, flour, bread, noodles, and basic goods. She has a lot of demand for these items because hers is one of the only grocery stores in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, noodles, flour, and oil

loans.name: Akoua Abléwa

texts.fr: Cette dame a appris le métier de la couture mais elle ne gagnait pas suffisament d'argent elle a préféré se lancer dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, actuellement ce commerce marche bien pour elle. Voulant agrandir son stock elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter des produits d’alimentation générale et divers autres produits. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, le revenu qu’elle gagne de son commerce lui permet de contribuer aux charges de sa famille
texts.en:
This lady learned to be a seamstress, but she didn't earn enough money in that trade, so she preferred to get into selling groceries, and presently, this business is going well. Wishing to increase her stock of goods, she has asked WAGES for her first loan to buy groceries and other general merchandise for her store. She is married and the mother of 2 children. The income she makes from her business allows her to contribute to covering the family's expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary F., born in the year 1959,  is happily married with eight children. Being a very hard working woman with a large family she has faced some challenges in life such as the death of her son. She lives in  in Bamenda, Cameroon.
Mary has seen GHAPE as a source of relief since the year 2000. In that same year Mary received her first loan of 15,000 FRS and the repayment was done promptly. With her current loan (her eighth) she plans to buy two types of firewood to split and pack in her compound and to sell.
She will start repayment three months from the day of disbursement. The success of the business is guaranteed because she is experienced in the business and she has a ready market for dry firewood. Mary plans to use the profit from the business to pay school fees for her children, give good medical attention to her family and also provide balance diet to her family members.
Mary is a member in GHAPE, and  she has been taught how to manage the loan from GHAPE. The method of repayment is comfortable.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: buying, transporting, splitting and selling of fire wood

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace sells provisions to make a living. She is 40 years old and married with four children.

She hopes to receive a loan in the amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell.

She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Hiathm

texts.en:
Hiathm is 36 years old, married, and has two children. He runs a blacksmith's shop where he makes wrought-iron gates, railings, and chairs.

Hiathm wants to expand his business in order to serve more customers. He wants to buy new machinery that would make him capable of diversifying his output; therefore, he is asking to borrow $2,200. 

With your help he will succeed.

loans.use: To buy new machinery

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
B. Hasan is 45 years old. He is married and has three children. He has a great passion for dairy farming and he and his wife (who appears in the photo) have been in this business together for 15 years. Hasan would like to expand his business by adding more cattle to the ones he has, because recently he acquired orders from outside town to supply milk. He is requesting a loan of $800 USD. With additional income Hasan will be better able to meet his family's financial obligations, especially the education of his children.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa O., 44, has been an entrepreneur since she married Ulysses, 50, her lifetime partner and business partner  (he appears with Nerissa in the photograph). Their marriage gave them 5 children. The eldest has just finished college, another child is currently enrolled in a nearby university, two children are in high school and the youngest is in grade school.

Nerissa and Ulysses own and manage a grocery store located just in front of their house in San Isidro Labrador, Area-G, Dasmarinas, Cavite. Recently, they opened a branch at the Kadiwa Public Market. Ulysses supervises their new branch. These two grocery stores give Nerissa and Ulysses an assured monthly income of at least P50,000.00 which they use to sustain the business operations, to supply for their daily needs, and for the education of their children.

Nerissa needs a loan of P50,000.00 to build up inventories for their branch in Kadiwa Public Market. Nerissa looks forward to owning a truck that they could use to transport their items from the suppliers.

CCT is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered on the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for their branch in the Kadiwa Market

loans.name: Karibu View Group

texts.en:
Maua R., age 32, is married with three children, 13, 10 and 8 years.   She stays with her mother. She has a beauty salon. She started this business in 2006.  She works daily from 8am until 7pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $226.

This will be Maua’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy a dryer and has paid back the loan successfully. She hopes for a new loan to start selling rice, which she intends to collect from upcountry.
 	
Maua will share this loan with her loan group,  Karibu View, which totals 18 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Maua is second from the right in the front row.

loans.use: To start a new business selling rice.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan K., age 60, is married and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, he rents spare rooms of his house to the other people, earning approximately US $10 per day. This amount of income is the primary source of income of the family. The family is also assisted by the two children: one of them is a grocery seller, and another one works as a soldier to serve the country.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, K. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, K. is seeking to increase his income. He is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase construction materials to build more rent house for his customers. By doing so, he hopes he will be able to generate more income to raise a good standard of living for his family.

loans.use: buy construction materials

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora MARIA DEL CARMEN A. D., tiene 51 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA , provincia de TRUJILLO, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EN ACCION.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria.
MARIA DEL CARMEN está casada y tiene 5 hijos todos mayores y ninguno depende económicamente de ella, ella recibe el apoyo de sus hijos.
MARIA DEL CARMEN   se dedica a la venta ceviche, papa a la huancaína, ají de gallina, tallarines (comidas típicas) en el puesto del mercado cercano a su casa.
Ella se dedica a cocinar y su hija la ayuda a atender a los consumidores.
Su primer crédito de 200 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de mas ollas, platos y utensilios de cocina.
Este crédito de 200 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar productos alimenticios al por mayor como: tallarín, papas, escabeches, aceite, etc
MARIA DEL CARMEN   sueña con tener un restaurante en su casa y así poder generar mayores ingresos..
texts.en:
Señora MARIA DEL CARMEN A. D. is 51 years old, and lives in the La Esperanza district, Trujillo province, La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres en Accion," (Women in Action). This businesswoman has 5 years of education. Maria del Carmen is married and has 5 children, all of whom are adults and are not dependent on her; she receives some support from her children.

Maria del Carmen sells Peruvian specialties including ceviche (a citrus-marinated seafood dish), papa a la huancaína (a dish of sliced potatoes in spicy cheese sauce), ají de gallina (chicken in a spicy sauce), and pasta dishes from a market stand close to her house.

She cooks the food, and her daughter helps her to serve the customers. Her first loan of 200 nuevos soles was used to purchase more pots, plates and cooking utensils. This loan of 200 nuevos soles will be used to purchase food products at wholesale such as: pasta, potatoes, pickles, cooking oil, etc.

Maria del Carmen dreams of having a restaurant in her house, with which she could generate increased earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food products at wholesale such as: pasta, potatoes, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Enid Nerima‘S Group

texts.en:
Enid, age 52, is the single mother of eight chidren, aged between 10 and 24 years. Four of her chidren go to school and the rest are working. Enid also takes care of additional family members. Enid and her family reside in a rented two-roomed house, which they share with two other people. There is electricity in the home but no piped water. Enid ensures that the family gets three meals a day. 

Enid resides and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala, and she works seven days a week. Enid owns a grocery shop in Kawala, selling soap, sugar, tea leaves, and other merchandise. She buys this merchandise from Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in the city of Kampala. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. The major challenges she faces in her business are seasonality and the increasing prices of merchandise as well as high transport costs and defaulters. Enid has been in this business for ten years. 

She and her group mate have been with MCDT for five years and are now requesting their tenth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise for her grocery shop. Enid dreams of seeing her business grow bigger and eventually owning a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her grocery shop

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena owns and manages a village store for already six years now. For its further development, she needs additional capital of PHP9,000. With this amount, she could already make her small store filled with more grocery items.  She hopes to avail her request because it will be very beneficial to the survival and maintenance of her variety store. Aside from her retail business, Rowena is also indulged in hog raising business. Before opening her store, she makes sure that her pigpen is already cleansed and her hogs are already ate their food. She plans to budget her loan in making both of her businessess improved. 

Rowena  is a 31 years old businesswoman who is married to Ellbert A.. They are blessed with one child in the person of John Carlo who is now five years old. Rowena hopes to sustain all the growing needs of her child especially now that he is already studying.  She hopes that by the time her children increases, she would be able to make her business more stable.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for the maintenance of her store

loans.name: Laura Tomasa

texts.en:
Laura Tomasa S. P. is 42 years old and lives in the Isla Trinitaria area of Guayaquil. Ms. S. owns a pharmacy, where she sells vitamins, medicine, aspirin, and school supplies. Business has been tough recently due to the recession and an increase in local competitors.  As a result, Ms. S. would like to diversify her inventory. 

Ms. S. is requesting a loan to purchase pre-paid phone cards, holiday decorations, Christmas gifts, a compressor, and beauty supplies. In the future, the Sorianos would like to secure the cane portions of their home with cement.  Ms. S. and her husband dedicate a portion of their incomes to support their only son who is finishing college.  She is grateful for any assistance we can provide for her business so that her family may prosper!

loans.use: to expand her inventory

loans.name: Cristina Isabel

texts.es:
la señora Cristina Ssabel S. F. tiene 56 años de edad es soltera y tiene dos hijos que ya estan casados, ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio desde hace 40 años, este negocio le ha 
dado para mejorar su casa. 
ella vende desayunos, pescado frito, curiles, sopa marinera la cual es su especialidad.
 
atiende a todo los visitantes que vienen del interior del pais, el lugar en donde tiene su negocio es turistico ya que es en Coyolito, de este lugar es que se toman las lanchas para ir a la isla de Amapala.
ya que se aproxima la navidad desea tener su negocio bien equipado para llamarla atencion de los clientes 
 
su deseo es que la crisis politica de su pais se mejore.
texts.en:
Cristina Isabel S. F., 56, is single and has two married children. She has been a merchant for over 40 years. This work has allowed her to improve her home. She sells prepared breakfasts, fried fish, curiles {a local clam with a dark, iron-rich blood served raw in their blood mixed with chismol (salsa) and lime juice}, and seafood stew which is her specialty. She takes care of all visitors from the interior of the country; her establishment is located in the tourist town of Coyolito, which is the place where one takes the boats to Amapala island. Since the Christmas season is fast approaching, she wants to have her business well stocked to attract the attention of customers. Her wish is that the political crisis in her country improves.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seafood, vegetables, condiments, cocoanut milk, firewood, gas, etc.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es una socia dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 44 años, es madre de cuatro hijos, de los cuales dos son mayores de edad. Lidia se dedica a la venta de menús, su esposo la apoya en su negocio, él es vigilante.  Lidia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final” desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en la compra de una olla arrocera.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 800 soles, que será utilizado para comprar mesas y utensilios para vender jugos por las mañanas. La meta de Lidia es tener un restaurante ya que por ahora vende en la vereda de su casa en forma ambulatoria.
texts.en:
Lidia is a dynamic and collaborative member of her community bank, and she lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 44 years old and has four children, two of whom are adults. Lidia sells prepared meals and her husband, who is a security guard, supports her in this venture. She has been a member of the communal bank “Juntas hasta el final” (Together to the end) for three years. Her first loan was for 300 soles and she used it to buy a rice cooker. Now she needs a loan of 800 soles to buy tables and utensils in order to sell juices during the mornings. Lidia's goal is to have her own restaurant, as she currently makes her sales in front of her house or as a street vendor.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and utensils to sell juices

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is forty-nine years old. He is married and has given birth to four children. All of his children are still in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Axim in the Western Region of Ghana. Francis works hard to be able to provide for the family. 

Francis produces polythene (Polyethylene) bags. He owns a small device that cuts all types and sizes of rubber and polythene. He supplies to retailers and food vendors who use the bags to wrap products for their customers. Francis has been in the rubber production business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy rubber and polythene

loans.name: Olubumi

texts.en: Olubumi Y. is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. Her husband sells medicines and she also supports the family. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Olubumi sells cooking oil and eggs at retail prices to her customers to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Olubumi is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more cooking oil and eggs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil and eggs to sell

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: La señora Maria Eugenia tiene más de 3 años de trabajar con créditos, mostrando un buen record crediticio, su actividad económica se basa en la comercialización de telas y accesorios para costura y la confección de prendas de vestir, entre lo que se destacan uniformes escolares, pantalones azules cortos para escolares. Que es su mayor fuente de ingresos ella siempre se ha propuesto salir adelante ya que no tiene suficiente ingresos para su familia. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de materia prima. Ella sueña con mantener siempre el negocio estable ya que tiene muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Eugenia has been a loan recipient for more than three years and has demonstrated a good credit record. She sells fabrics, sewing accessories, and apparel. Maria mainly produces school uniforms, blue trousers, and shorts for students. These items generate her largest source of income. She is always looking to get ahead, but she does not make enough money for her family.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to purchase raw materials. Maria’s dream is to always maintain a stable business since she has many customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
María Margarita L. García tiene 53 años y vive en el barrio Claret de Bogotá, la ciudad  más poblada de Colombia  y su Centro Cultural y Económico más importante. En esta ciudad, llamada también "La Atenas Sudamericana”, residen personas provenientes de todo el país, que han venido contribuyendo con las antiguas  tradiciones culturales de Bogotá, introduciendo a sus nuevas generaciones  formas de ser y hacer las cosas;  este es el caso de María Margarita que proveniente de Cúcuta, su ciudad natal, perteneciente al Departamento de  Norte de Santander, llegó a Bogotá hace siete años, para estar cerca de sus hijos que venían buscando la oportunidad de educarse y formarse como oficiales de policía en la Capital de Colombia. María Margarita desde su ciudad de origen practicaba la actividad  comercial, la cual trasladó al barrio  Claret de Bogotá, ubicado cerca de la Escuela Militar y caracterizado por ser un sector comercial, donde se encuentran bancos, almacenes de ropa, librerías y que debe su nombre a la comunidad claretiana desde que fuè bendecido por sacerdotes pertenecientes a la misma.
