Esta fuè la Infraestructura poblacional encontrada y aprovechada por ella cuando  incursionó  en la venta de productos por catálogo en este barrio. Aunque dice, que no es fácil vivir en otra ciudad lejos de la familia donde no te conocen y que la dedicación en la educación de sus hijos, los costos de las carreras militares y el cambio de ciudad requieren de mucho dinero, lo cual parece ser su principal desafió.

En la actualidad está casada y tiene dos hijos de 27 y 25 años, que ya son policías; su negocio consiste en la venta por catálogo de joyería, jeans y bolsos; éste es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que ha participado en procesos formativos para adquirir y aumentar destrezas en el manejo del mercado y del crédito empresarial; María Margarita aplica a un crédito por valor de $1.500.000 para comprar dos mostrarios de  joyería que contienen aproximadamente dos docenas y media de aretes, seis anillos y seis cadenas. Su sueño relacionado con el negocio es afiliarse a la Cooperativa de la Policía Nacional y posicionar un stand. La meta de la familia es crear una empresa conjunta de electrotécnica, para la cual los hijos están estudiando al mismo tiempo que trabajan; con ese panorama, ella estaría disponiendo de su experiencia mercadológica y la capacidad emprendedora que la caracteriza.
texts.en:
María Margarita L. García, 53, lives in the Claret neighborhood in Bogotá. It is the most heavily populated area of Colombia, and it is its most important cultural and economic center. It is also called “The Athens of South America”. People from all over the country live here, and they have contributed the ancient cultural traditions of Bogotá. They are introducing new generations to ways of being and doing things. This is the case with María Margarita. She is from Cúcuta of the Norte de Santandar department, and she came to Bogotá seven years ago to be close to her children. Her children came looking for the opportunity to educate themselves and become police officials in the capital of Colombia. María Margarita had a commercial activity in her native city, and she moved it to the Claret neighborhood in Bogotá. It is located near the Military School. This is a commercial area where you can find banks, clothing shops, and book stores. The name comes from the Claretiana Community, which was blessed by priests who lived there. This was how the infrastructure was when she decided to sell her products by catalog in this neighborhood. They say that it is not easy to live in another city far from your family where people do not know you. Also, you need a lot of money to devote to the education of your children, the costs of military careers, and to change cities. This appears to be her biggest challenge. She is currently married, and she has two children; 27 and 25. They are now police officers. Her business consists of catalog sales of jewelry, jeans, and purses. This is her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She has participated with the organization in learning processes to increase her skills in managing the market and entrepreneurial loans. María Margarita is applying for a loan for 1,500,000 COP to buy two jewelry display packages that have approximately two and a half dozen earrings, six rings, and six chains. Her business dream is to affiliate herself with the National Police Cooperative and set up a stand. Her family goal is to create a business jointly with technical electronics. Her children are studying this at the same time as they are working. With this outlook, she will be using her marketing experience and her characteristic entrepreneurial capacity.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two jewelry display packages that have approximately two and a half dozen earrings, six rings, and six chains

loans.name: Roquita

texts.en:
Roquita, 55, is a resident of Surallah, South Cotabato. She started her business selling dried fish but now is a rice farmer. She manages a 4-hectare (10-acre) rice field which is her main source of living. She also operates a passenger bus.

Now, Roquita has six children to support. She lacks capital and that's why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and requested a loan of 12,000 Php. This loan will help her a lot in providing fertilizer for her rice field and maintenance for her bus.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm and wheels for her bus

loans.name: Maluku Cell A. Amunge Grace Group

texts.en: A. Grace is the group president of Maluku Cell A. She is 40 years old and a strong businesswoman. She is married with six children all in school and she has three dependents in school too. She operates a produce business that she has been carrying out for over six years. Therefore, she is using the loan to purchase produce (cassava) for sale. The loan is encouraging her to work very hard and she is hoping to change her standard of living. Her dreams are to obtain land and construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase produce (cassava) for sale.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas A. is married and has two children. She sells fabric and ladies wear such as panties and skirts. She moves from house to house to sell her goods at Elmina. Dorcas has received a senior high education.  Her husband is a teacher. She helps her husband with the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will serve as additional capital to purchase more fabric and ladies wear to sell. She hopes to use the new profits that will come as a result of the loan to educate her children who are still in school. Mrs. A. is getting ready to start her normal routine of moving from house to house.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric and ladies wear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional cloth for her business

loans.name: Azza

texts.en:
Azza is a mother and a wife of a retired school teacher.  She lives in Kufor Ne'me village of Ramallah City.  Azza has sons and daughters who are still college students. Because her husband's retirement salary doesn't cover all their expenses, she decided to start her own project.

Azza was married at a very young age and didn't receive a sufficient education or training to qualify her for a job; therefore she started buying chickens, preparing them for cooking and selling them to housewives of the neighborhood.  After two years, Azza became known for her good work, clean production and commitment, which increased her number of customers, so she thought of expanding the project.

Azza took a loan from FATEN to purchase a larger number of chickens and tools and to prepare a place in her house for selling chickens. She hopes to have her own shop soon where she can answer the demand of the whole village, preparing chickens for big meals and village parties and various events in addition to the work she currently does.

Azza appears in the pictures preparing a chicken to be sold.

loans.use: To expand her poultry-selling business

loans.name: Jason

texts.es: Jason C. F., tiene la edad de 34 años, está soltero, y vive con sus padres y hermanas. El crédito lo quiere para la reparación del local del taller mecánico y compra de un compresor. Desea mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y ser más eficiente en su trabajo. Él cuenta con una instalación donde realiza los trabajos de mecánica y soldadura. Tiene varios años de haber empezado con este negocio, y cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de ofrecer de mejores condiciones a sus clientes. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecido con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como mecánico.
texts.en:
Jason C. F., 34, is single and lives with his parents and sisters. He needs funds to repair his workshop and to buy a compressor. He wants to improve his working conditions so that he can be more efficient in his work. He has a shop where he performs auto mechanics and welding jobs. He has been in this line of work for several years and has several regular customers; this is why he wants to offer better conditions to his customers. This will be the first time he has negotiated a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very grateful with the loan terms offered. He hopes in the future to be able to provide his family with a better quality of life and increased economic stability and to continue growing both as a person and as a mechanic.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a compressor and for repairs to his workshop.

loans.name: Mujeres Organizadas Y Activas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujres Organizadas y Activas” se formó con la unión varias vecinas.
 Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, fotografía, cotillón y preparación de comidas rápidas.
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
 Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a varias actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa.
Una de  las madres es la señora Virginia, quien se dedica a la venta de lencería confeccionadas por ella.
Sus confecciones son muy solicitados por la buena calidad de sus productos y por ello quiere aumentar la cantidad confeccionada, y solicita el préstamo para la compra de encajes en carios colores, gomas, telas de sedas y licras.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Organizadas y Activas” ("Organized and Active Women") group was formed when various neighbors joined forces. All of the members make a living independently, for instance in sales, photography, party supplies or food preparation. They formed a united group very capable of working together for everyone's benefit. All of the group members are mothers who dedicate themselves to their work with the goal of strengthening their household finances. One of these mothers is Virginia, who makes a living selling lingerie that she makes herself. Her items are highly sought-after because of their high quality, and for this reason she wants to increase the quantity she produces. She is requesting the loan to purchase lace in various colors, elastic, silk fabrics and spandex.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various supplies for their businesses

loans.name: Adelito

texts.en:
Adelito M. is from the village of Brgy.Nangalisan,Bagabag,Nueva Vizcaya. He is 42 years old. Adelito is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Adelito raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Adelito has been engaged in his business for more than eight years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Adelito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Adelito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Adelito is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Adelito from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Chuyen's Group

texts.en:
Chuyen T. N. is 36 years old. She lives in Tien Kha village, Tien Duong commune, with her husband and two children. She is a farmer. She grows rice and vegetables and breeds pigs. She has a monthly income of about 2,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). 

She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and repaid punctually. She is the leader of five-member group loan with SEDA, a Kiva partner. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to grow vegetables.

 About the other borrowers in her group:
 Xuan T. P. is 48 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed pigs. Chu T. N. is 50 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for a small business. Toan T. T. is 57 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed poultry. Vu T. T. is 30 years old. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to breed poultry and for a small business.

loans.use: To grow vegetables

loans.name: Las Negras Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Negras está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas, emprendedoras y joviales. La coordinadora del grupo Elizabeth del Carmen  de 28 años quien vende desde cosméticos, dulces, ropa, calzado etc. de manera ambulante junto con su compañero de vida con el fin de que sus cuatro hijos de 10,9, 6 y 1 ½ tengan un mejor futuro.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Verónica Isabel P. es un joven alegre y optimista madre de una niña de 4 años y un bebe que viene en camino, ella se dedica al comercio de productos Avon y Zermat con la ayuda de su esposo y Yolanda Elizabeth P. B. es propietaria de una pequeña pulpería.
texts.en:
The members of Las Negras group are three strong, hardworking, tenacious and cheerful women. Elizabeth del Carmen is the coordinator of the group: she is 28 years old, she is a street vendor and she sells cosmetics, sweets, clothes, shoes and so on; she works with her live-in partner, and their goal is to grant a better future to their four children aged 10, 9, 6 and 1 ½. The other members of the group are Verónica Isabel P. and Yolanda Elizabeth P.. Verónica Isabel P. is a cheerful and optimistic young woman: she has a 4 year-old daughter and she is expecting her second child. She sells Avon and Zermat products, with the help of her husband. Yolanda Elizabeth P. owns a small corner shop.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different core products for their activities.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah S. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local Sudanese alcohol (siko) at home and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer to sell.

Sarah is 49 years old and is married to a retired police officer. She has seven children and three of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: To stock crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: El Señor Santiago nacio en Chuquisaca el 23 de mayo de 1983 hace 19 años que vive en la localidad de  Nueva Esperanza Municipio de El Torno se dedica a la agricultura y produce carbon, su hijos estan estudian en la comunidad donde vive junto a su esposa quien le ayuda a comercializar sus productos en el mercado de el Torno, tambien se dedica a la crianza de animales para despues poder venderlos, su deseo o sueño del Sr. es salir adelante en la agricultura comprar equipos para poder mantener mejor su cultivos, con el dinero del credito contratara mano de obra para la preparacion de la tierra para la siembra de Maiz, esta muy agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Santiago was born in Chuquisaca on May 23rd of 1983. He has lived in the town of Nueva Esperanza in the El Torno municipality for 19 years. He devotes himself to agriculture, and he makes charcoal. His children go to school in the community where he lives. He lives with his wife who helps him sell his products in the El Torno market. He also raises animals to later be able to sell them. His wish or dream is to get ahead in agriculture and buy equipment to be able to improve his crops. He will use the loan to hire workers to prepare the land for planting corn. He is very grateful to the institution for the support of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Prepare the land and plant corn

loans.name: Astherie

texts.en: Astherie is 50 years old and a widow with four children whose ages range from two to 13. All are in school. For the last 16 years, Astherie has made a living by renting out bridal outfits. She is applying for this loan in order to buy more bridal outfits to rent from her store, which is well known locally  because it has been in operation for so long.

loans.use: To buy more bridal outfits to rent out to her customers

loans.name: Esiquio

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la imagen es la esposa.
El señor Esiquio S. fuentes y su esposa se dedican a la venta de ropa usada en una de la colonia muy conocidas de la ciudad y que recurre mucha gente. Esta actividad la realizan desde hace 3 año; negocio por el cual ellos obtienen ingresos para sostener los gasto familiares. Para seguir vendiendo ropa, zapatos y más, en este momento requieren un préstamo para surtir el negocio para el cambio de temporada.
texts.en:
The person in the photo is his wife. Mr. Esiquio S. Fuentes and his wife sell used clothes in one of the city’s best known neighborhoods where many people come by. They have been doing his for 3 years and it produces income for them to support their family. In order to continue selling clothes, shoes and other items, they need a loan to stock the store with items for the new season. .

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en: Wilfreda S., from the town of Trinidad, is 61 years old, married to a fisherman and has a 38-year-old child. To make a living, Wilfreda owns and operates a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. She joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan  from CEVI, Wilfreda is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP to repair her fishing boat and buy fishnets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To repair fishing boat and buy fishnets

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
El señor Juan David R. tiene 40 años, vive en la zona de Mallco Rancho – Sipe Sipe, provincia Quillacollo del departamento de Cochabamba.

El señor R. es una persona sencilla y humilde, no ha podido estudiar porque la situación económica no se lo permitía, es soltero pero espera formar una familia en un futuro cercano. 
El se dedica a la agricultura, produce alimentos, como maíz, cebolla y zanahoria, en pequeña cantidad porque no tiene suficiente agua para sembrar mas plantas. Además que en estos últimos años no ha llovido mucho y necesita disponer de agua en forma segura, para que no se sequen sus plantas.
 
Tiene el objetivo de cambiar esta situación y en un futuro cercano  asegurar la provisión de agua. 
Es por esta razón que ha solicitado un crédito para ser socio de un pozo de agua que le permita regar sus plantas y mejorar su economía, y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan David R. is 40 years old, and lives in the Mallco Rancho zone – Sipe Sipe, province Quillacollo in the Cochabamba department.

Mr. R. is a simple and humble person who was not able to get an education because the financial situation would not allow it.  He dedicates himself to agricultural activities, and produces food such as corn, onions and carrots in small quantities because he doesn’t have enough water to establish more crops.  In addition, in the past few years, it has not rained much and he has to be cautious with his water use so his plants do not dry out.

His objective is to change this situation, and in the near future assure his access to a water source.  This is the reason why he is requesting a loan, so he can become a member of a well that would allow him to water his crops.  This, in turn, would improve his financial situation and, therefore, his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase access to a well to water his crops.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYNA PICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Marleny; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanías, ella tiene una tienda de artesanía que atiende desde las 9:00 hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda de artesanía como chompas, pantalones, chalinas y mantas.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marleny belongs to the “HUAYNA PICCHU” community bank. The bank is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Marleny is 28 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business where she sells handicrafts.  She has a handicraft store where she works from 9.00am to 10.00pm.  Through her business she manages to support her child.  She would like to expand her business.  She is requesting her loan to buy merchandise for her handicraft store such as sweaters, pants, scarves and blankets.

Marleny would like to thank those who will participate in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her handicraft store such as sweaters, pants, scarves and blankets

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina N. is 37 years old and sells potatoes at the Githurai 45 market. She is married to Peter Mwangi, who is a businessman; together, they have three children. Regina was introduced to Kadet by the credit officer in charge of the Thika Road office, and this will be her first loan with Kadet.

Regina has been running her potato business for four years, and her monthly income is 6,000 KES. With a loan of 10,000 KES, she plans to purchase more potatoes to sell. If the loan boosts business, she will increase her stock further and begin selling as a wholesaler.

Regina, who describes herself as hardworking, wants her business to raise her family's standard of living and wants to educate her children further.

loans.use: To increase stock of  potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Julio Felipe

texts.es:
Julio de 28 años, es taxista y recorre las calles de Guayaquil con una taifa muy económica dando un promedio de carrera entre $ 1.50 hasta $ 8.00. Vive con su esposa) en una zona periurbana ubicada a las afuera de Guayaquil llamada Duran y caracterizada por su ecología de disolución. 

Uno de los amigos de Julio le prestó un carro para que lo convierta en taxi hasta que el ahorre dinero para tener su propio taxi. Pasado el tiempo el pudo comprar un taxi y independizarse teniendo horarios desde la tarde hasta nocturnos ha trabajado para mantener a su esposa. 

Su casa no está bien construida porque no ha tenido posibilidad de mantenerla ya que su esposa es ama de casa quiere darle una mejo vida por eso el quiere el préstamo para compara cemento, arena y pinturas. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener un nuevo taxi.
texts.en:
Julio is 28 years old.  He is a taxi driver and works in the streets of Guayaquil, charging a very affordable fare.  On average, his journeys cost between $1.50 and $8.00.  He lives with his wife in a peri-urban area on the outskirts of Guayaquil called Duran which is noted for its deteriorating ecosystem.

One of Julio's friends lent him a car for him to convert into a taxi until he saved enough money to buy his own taxi.  Over time, he managed to buy his own taxi and start working independently.  He works from the afternoon into the night in order to support his wife.

Julio's house isn't well built because he hasn't managed to maintain it.  As his wife is a housewife, he would like to provide her with a better quality of life.  For this reason, he is taking this loan to buy cement, sand and paint.  In the future, he would like to finish building his house and to buy a new taxi.

loans.use: To buy cement and paint

loans.name: Wendy Steffany

texts.es: Wendy Steffany M. G. de 28 años de edad, es una persona muy responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y poder dar lo mejor de sí hacia las demás personas. Ella reside en Soyapango, y vive junto a su esposo, su pequeño hijo de 7 meses de edad, y su suegra quien le ayuda con los quehaceres del hogar. Wendy es una cosmetóloga, la cual de destaca por su excelente servicio, esto le ha permitido contar con varios clientes los cuales siempre visitan su sala de belleza ya sea para cortes de cabello, tintes, rayos, uñas acrílicas y otros trabajos que con mucho empeño Wendy realiza. Con el deseo de mejorar en la vida, ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda mejorar el salón de belleza, equipándolo con más productos como tintes, tijeras, capas, toallas, cosméticos y otros más. Con esto Wendy espera aumentar sus ventas en gran manera.
texts.en:
Wendy Steffany M. G., 28, is a very responsible person with a strong desire to get ahead in life and to give her best to others.  She lives in Soyapango with her husband, 7 month old son and her mother-in-law who helps her with the housework.

Wendy is a cosmetologist.  She stands out due to her excellent service.  This has created a considerable customer base that always come by her beauty salon for haircuts, dyes, highlights, acrylic nails and other services that Wendy provides very diligently.

Wanting to improve her life, she is asking for a loan through which she can improve the beauty salon stocking it with more products like hair dyes, scissors, capes, towels, cosmetics and many others.  Wendy hopes this will lead to significant increase in sales.

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Si

texts.en:
Si Y., 51, sells traditional cakes, earning an income of US $3 per day. Y. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. 

The family has to spend US $50 on food, $6 on electricity, and $55 on other necessary expenses every month. 

Y. is requesting a loan of US $500 to buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Julia Nora

texts.es:
Julia es una pequeña comerciante, que inicio hace varios años a trabajar para apoyar  a su familia. Tiene una pulpería con ochos años en ventas, comenzó ah invertir lo que logro el objetivo de atracción de clientela. 
Su esposo la apoya quien es vendedor de eskimo y acarreo, juntos han logrado ir construyendo su vivienda de concreto.
Para  la ampliación de su inventario, recurre al financiamiento y logra comprar más productos de consumo, logrando el objetivo.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en cuatro quintales de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, bidón de aceite, caja de jabón, maíz, entre otros productos como: cola, aro, brillo de labios, trabas entre otros para generar mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Julia is a small merchant.  She started out working several years ago to support her family.  She has had a grocery store for eight years.  She started to invest and this led to her acquiring a steady customer base.  Her husband helps her by selling ice cream and doing hauling.  Together they’ve managed to build their concrete house.

To expand her inventory she is requesting a loan to buy more products thus reaching her goal.

Today, with this new loan, she will buy four quintals of rice, beans, sugar, a large jug of oil, a case of soap and corn among other products like: glue, earrings, lipsticks and hair clips among others to generate higher profits.

loans.use: She will buy rice, beans, sugar, corn, a large jug of oil and costume trinkets to increase sales.

loans.name: Yuldosh

texts.ru: Эшкозиев Юлдош житель Яванского района. Ему 60 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. 15 лет как занимается животноводством. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота и корма.
texts.en: E. Yuldosh lives in the Yavan region. He's sixty years old, married and has five children. He has a high school level of education and for the past fifteen years has bred cattle. He fattens the animals and later sells them for a profit. He's asking for a loan to buy some cattle and the food they require.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and feed

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine, 50 years old, has five children, all of whom are in school. Her eldest child was born in 1992, while the youngest was born in 2002.  Her husband works in house construction. Valentine, who owns a bar in which she sells local beer, is requesting a loan to buy more local beer, and plans to renovate her house with the additional profits.

loans.use: To purchase more local beer to sell.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Ms. Esterlita R. is from the Barangay of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental.  She is 59 years old and single.  To make a living, she is presently engaged in the dressmaking business.  She’s been engaged in this kind business for 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from this business activity. 

In 2011, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita as an active member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program and she is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP as her first loan, which will be used as additional capital for her dressmaking business.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of their family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, possible product innovations, and business expansion.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité Primavera es de la zona de Pa'i Ñu de San Lorenzo. Varias señoras se dedican a la venta de comestibles, comidas rápidas y despensas. Son todas señoras con antigüedad en el negocio, que decidieron mantener el monto ya que no pagan bien su cuota por culpa de una integrante que no es responsable como las demás, pero esta vez tuvieron que excluirle por mal pago.
Dayana es hija de la tesorera, ella es la más joven y trabajadora, hace de todo, desde arreglar bicicletas, hasta cocinar, le encanta trabajar.
La sra. Lilian S. posee una despensa donde vende todo tipo de coemstibles y desea poder ampliar su variedad de productos con ayuda del crédito.
texts.en:
The Primavera group ("Spring") is from the Pa'i Ñu zone of San Lorenzo.  the group is made up of various women who sell food, fast food, and groceries. All the women are experienced businesswomen. They decided to pay their balance in full since they have not made payments well because of a member who is not as responsible as the other women.  For this line, they had to exclude the member because of bad credit.

Dayana is the daughter of the group's treasurer. She is the youngest member of the group. She is hard-working, doing everything from fixing bicycles to cooking. She loves to work.  Lilian S. has a pantry where she sells all type of food. She wants to increase the variety of products she sells with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy wheat, rice, pasta, sugar, maté, oil, salt, condiments, meat, tapioca, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Turdukan's Group

texts.en:
Turdukan K., 30, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of a small village, Bokonbaevo, and is married to a farmer. She is also a mother of three school-aged children, and together with her husband she runs a business of cattle reselling. Turdukan buys young calves, fattens them, and resells them at a higher price. The profits allow her to cover all the food costs and family expenses. The start-up capital was 3,000 soms four years ago, and now the profits from the business reach 10,000 soms monthly. She is applying for a loan from Kiva to purchase seeds and lubricating fluid for farming equipment, because she wants to start cultivating land. 


         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---


This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (remaining environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and lubricating fluid for farming equipment

loans.name: Saruni Ole

texts.en:
Saruni Ole Letoya M. is 24 years old. He is single and he supports his parents. For the past three years, Saruni has been a farmer. He learned about KADET LTD from marketing done by the KADET staff in his area. Saruni is applying for his first loan to purchase farm supplies. 

Saruni is an industrious man who will do well if he receives funds. He will use the returns from his loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm. Saruni’s dream is to become the best and most well-known farmer in the area.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two school-age children. He has owned a small grocery store for five years, selling cheese, juices, bread, daily use and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.  

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to increase his shop’s inventory. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: to increase his shop’s inventory.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 29 years old and married, with 3 children who all attend school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Josephine has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 21,000  through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat and other equipment.

Josephine has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for her fishing boat and other equipment

loans.name: Priscilla Mweru

texts.en:
Priscilla is 34 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom attend school.  Her husband is in the transport business. She does crop farming as well as livestock rearing, which she has been doing for the last 20 years.The business earns her a monthly income of 40,560 KES. 

Priscilla is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD.  She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this loan to buy a dairy cow for milk production, which she will sell to her customers. Priscilla hopes to expand her business and supply milk to other towns in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en: Darwin, age 19 and unmarried, is a farmer living and working in the Philippines. Darwin has been growing corn for five years. He is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 in order to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, as well as to buy corn seeds to be planted on 2.0 hectares of his farm. He wants to maintain and strengthen his business in the future, and wants to help lift his parents to a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, as well as to buy corn seeds for planting

loans.name: Luz Martina

texts.es:
Luz es una madre de familia de 45 años de edad, tiene un  hijo menor de edad, ella cuenta con casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande y en donde  cuenta con servicios básicos de agua y luz

Luz cuenta con una bodega, instalada en su domicilio  la cual e es atendida por ella misma, allí ella ofrece a sus  vecinos y amigos,  abarrotes, productos de primera necesidad, así como también frutas y verduras, Luz cuenta con  experiencia en el negocio  ubicado en su propio domicilio  cuenta con clientela fija, adicionalmente se dedica ala comercio y crianza de animales menores.

Luz desea invertir en su negocio comprando mas mercadería para ampliar su negocio con más productos novedosos para ofrecer a su clientes, por ello Luz a creído por conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para poder realizar dichas actividades.

Luz es una mujer de buen carácter , tranquila que desea poder superarse y poder brindarles a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz is a 45-year-old mother with one child who is not yet grown. She has her own house, which is located in the district of Tambogrande, where she has basic water and electricity services. 

Luz has a small grocery store which is set up in her home. She operates the store herself, and she offers basic products and groceries, as well as fruits and vegetables, to her neighbors and friends. Luz has experience with this business which is located in her own home, and she has a steady customer base. She also works raising and selling small livestock. 

Luz wants to invest in her business by purchasing more merchandise so that she can expand her business and offer more new products to her customers. For this reason, Luz has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2000 Peruvian new soles, so that she can achieve these goals. 

Luz is a calm woman of good character who wants to get ahead and provide her parents with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to expand her business.

loans.name: Ma. Mariza

texts.en: Ma. Mariza is 46 years old and married with four children. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Mariza requested a 18,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs. Ma. Mariza has been raising pigs for 2 years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Ma. Mariza would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.ru: Точинисо проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст, 37 лет. Она замужем, имеет троих детей. У нее среднее образование. Уже два года как она занимается торговлей. У себя дома она открыла магазин хозяйственных товаров. Она берет кредит для приобретения новых видов тарелок, чайников и бокалов. То есть она хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара, чтобы привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en: Tojiniso lives in Yavan. She is 37 years old, married, and has three children. She has a secondary education. She has worked in trade for two years. She opened a shop in her home selling household goods.  She is taking out a loan to buy new kinds of plates, teapots and glasses. She wants to increase the variety of goods she offers to attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of plates, teapots and glasses

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia tiene 49 años, esta casado con José D. 50 años, con quien tiene 6 hijos. Juntos residen en la comunidad D. Sta. Rosa Alta del distrito D. Sivia. Emilia, sabe lo difícil que es para una familia D. pocos recursos empezar un negocio desD. cero, es así que ella y su familia optó por emprender un negocio propio, y que es la producción D. cacao y café injertados. Considera que este negocio le es bastante rentable, ya que dentro D. su comuna son muchos los productores D. cacao por lo que debe procurar en tener una mejor producción que los demás. Ahora con las ganancias obtenidas le da más motivación para continuar intensificándose en este trabajo, con el fin D. ofrecer un mejor bienestar a su familia. En un futuro, piensa adquirir un terreno para luego construir su casa propia que tanto ella anhela. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en ser puntual con el pago D. sus cuotas. Con los 3.000 soles que solicita, desea invertir para la compra D. materiales e instalar un vivero.
texts.en:
Emilia is 49 years old.  She is married to 50 year-old José and the couple have six children.  They live together in the community of Santa Rosa Alta, in Sivia district.

Emilia knows how difficult it is for a family of limited economic means to start a business from scratch.  She and her family chose to set up their own business producing grafted cacao and coffee plants.  She considers this business to be quite profitable.  There are many cacao producers in her community and so she must try to have a better production than everybody else.  The profits she has obtained from her business have given her more motivation to continue intensifying her work in this field, with the goal of providing her family with a better level of well-being.  In the future, she plans to acquire a plot of land on which she will build the home that she so longs for.

This is Emilia's second loan from MFP and she pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments.  She would like to invest the 3,000 Peruvian soles that she has requested to buy the materials she needs to set up a plant nursery.

loans.use: to buy materials to set up a plant nursery

loans.name: Mouhamadou Lamine

texts.fr: Monsieur Mouhamadou Lamine est un jeune commerçant  de 34 ans qui habite au Sénégal. Il évolue depuis presque 7 ans dans la vente de  téléphones et d’accessoires. Il a hérité son activité de son frère  qui gérait un boutique. Il est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis 2ans et a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de téléphones portables et d’accessoires  à revendre. Ce financement lui permettra d’augmenter son fond, de développer son activité et d’augmenter ses bénéfices afin de pouvoir continuer a  gérer les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Mouhamadou Lamine is a young, 34-year-old merchant who lives in Senegal. He started selling phones and accessories nearly seven years ago, having inherited the business from his brother who used to run a store. He became a member of the U-IMCEC branch two years ago and has already obtained and repaid one previous loan. 


He is now seeking a loan of 200,000 francs to purchase mobile phones and accessories for resale. This funding will enable him to bolster his capital, expand his business, and increase his profits in order to continue to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories for resale

loans.name: Dina Marina

texts.es: La señora Dina Marina desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de tacos, gorditas y dulces en una escuela primaria de la ciudad. Ofreciendo por paquetes de tres  de diversos guisos a un precio accesible para los niños y maestros. Dina Marina solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima como lo es la harina y demás ingredientes para la elaboración de su producto ya que esta próxima la entrada al nuevo ciclo escolar y así de esta manera podrá estar preparada.
texts.en: Mrs. Dina Marina has been selling tacos, gorditas and sweets in an elementary school in the city for 20 years.  She offers a bundle of three assorted items at a price that the students and teachers can afford.  Dina Marina is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials, such as flour and other ingredients for the making of her products since the beginning of the new school year is approaching and this way she can be ready.

loans.use: to purchase raw material.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man with three children all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, he has been operating a retail shop, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major problem due to delayed payments by debtors. He dreams of expanding his business to educate his children. 

With the KES 10,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and tea leaves. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and tea leaves.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SILKINCHANY” el banco se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Angostura, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia Fortunata; la socia tiene 54 años de edad, y es casada, la socia tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya son todos independientes, la socia se dedica  a la crianza de cuyes, ella tiene un espacio destinado para el cuarto de los cuyes que son ahora un números de 180 cuyes, la socia trabaja de manera formal  estando inscrita en la asociación de criadores de cuyes en su región, ella muestra muy orgullosa la labor que realiza diario con la crianza, alimentación, reproducción y venta autorizada de sus cuyes. La socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de 100 cuyes para criarlos y desarrollarlos. La socia es una mujer muy activa y le gusta lo que hace, ella desea incrementar el número de sus cuyes para la segunda etapa de reproducción, la socia acaba de vender un lote de cuyes de 100 unidades, motivo por el cual ella está en la búsqueda de nuevo grupo de cuyes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cuyes en un total de 100 unidades.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Fortunata is a member of the "Silkinchany" community bank which is located in Angostura community, in Cusco province and department.

Fortunata is 54 years old, married, and has four children who all live independently.  Her business is raising guinea pigs.  She has a space in her home which is set aside for the animals.  She currently has 180 guinea pigs.  Fortunata works as an official seller and is registered with the Association of Guinea Pig Breeders in her region.  She is very proud of the work that she does every day raising, feeding and breeding her guinea pigs, and selling them as an authorized vendor.  She would like this loan to invest in buying 100 guinea pigs to raise and develop.  Fortunata is a very active woman and she enjoys what she does.  She would like to increase her number of guinea pigs for the second breeding stage.  She has just sold a lot of 100 guinea pigs which is why she is looking for a new group of guinea pigs.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying 100 guinea pigs.

Fortunata is grateful for the support that she is receiving and pledges to make her loan repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying 100 guinea pigs

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy, tiene 64 años y 12 hijos, es socia D. FINCA Peru desD. hace 4 años. 
Ysabel lleva ropa a las ferias, recuerda que con su primer crédito compró ropa, siempre trabajo en ese rubro, pero antes trabajaba con poco capital, ahora gracias a los préstamos que ha recibido ha podido crecer y aumentar su capital. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado comprará ropa para la feria D. Huano Huano, le encanta las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal porque se distrae y recibe muchas capacitaciones D. cómo poder mejorar su negocio. Su meta es poder terminar el segundo piso D. su casa.
texts.en: Ysabel is a member of the “Tarpuy” communal bank.  She’s 64 years old and has 12 children.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for the last four years.  Ysabel takes clothes to the markets.  She recalls that she used her first loan to buy clothes; she’s always been in this line of work.  But she used to work with very little capital and now, thanks to the loans she’s gotten, she’s been able to grow and increase her capital.  She will use this requested loan to buy clothes at the Huano Huano market.  She loves the meetings of her communal bank because she districts herself and receives much training, like on how to improve her business.  Her goal is to finish the second story on her house.

loans.use: to buy assorted seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Balentina

texts.es: La Sra. Balentina, D. 50 años D. edad viuda hace mas D. 30 años, tiene 5 hijos que ya tienen sus vidas independientes, ya hicieron su familia, la Sra. Balentina vive en casa propia, se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en una tienda D. barrio que tiene en su propio domicilio, ya lleva con esta actividad hace 10 años,  La clienta solicito un préstamo para financiamiento D. compra D. heladera y mercadería como dulces y galletas para surtir su tienda. La clienta agradeció a la institución por la rapidez que fueron atendidos y el buen trato que se le dio.
texts.en:
Sra. Balentina, age 50, has been a widow for more than 30 years. She has 5 children who already have independent lives and their own families. Sra. Balentina lives in her own home. She sells groceries at a neighborhood store located in her house. Balentina has been in business for 10 years.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy frozen treats and merchandise, such as candies and cookies, to restock her store. Balentina is grateful to Emprender for the quick response and the good treatment she has received.

loans.use: to buy frozen treats, candies, and cookies.

loans.name: Enkhsukh

texts.en:
Enkhsukh is a 22-year-old auto designer. He lives with his daughter and wife in a ger, a nomadic Mongolian traditional tent located in the Ger district of Mongolia, the capital city of Mongolia. Enkhsukh is very hardworking young man who is trying to build his life.

Recently, he decided to start a taxi business and expects his designer job to allow him to save more money to buy an apartment. He needs 2,000,000 MNT to buy a car for his taxi business.

loans.use: to buy his a car for his taxi business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is married and works hard to support her family.  She sells home products in the Philippines and has been in business for 33 years.

Concepcion requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional merchandise to sell.

In the future, Concepcion would like to expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her business.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is 46 and married with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a business selling clothes door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation, which makes it difficult for her to sell clothes door-to-door year round. Mwanalima dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en:
Chhim is 30 years old, a factory worker who comes from Ang Snoul district. 

His work schedule starts at 7 a.m. and finishes at 5 p.m.. This type of work is extremely related to his physical state. Anyway, he has to do it for his living. From this business, he is able to generate an income $8 per day. Chhim has a life partner in his wife, who is on a sewing staff, and he is blessed with two children. Both of his children are attending a local school. 

With the sum of $1,200, he will build a small brick house and cover the roof with zinc. This house will provide a comfortable living for his family. He would like to say thanks to all lenders who lend him money to build this shelter.

loans.use: to a build a small brick house and cover the roof with zinc.

loans.name: El Lirio Group

texts.es:
El Grupo el Lirio está integrado por diez personas cada una con una diferente actividad económica. Este grupo esta ubicado en una región cañera y la colonia donde viven esta rodeada por sembradíos de caña de azúcar.

Hugo es uno de los integrantes de este grupo, el tiene la edad de 25 años, estudio hasta el tercer año de preparatoria y esta casado con  Damaris, ellos aun no tienen hijos. Hugo es un joven muy trabajador platica que hace un año decidió rentar un local en el cual vende ropa para dama y caballero para ganarse la vida y gracias a Dios su negocio a tenido exito y las ventas que ha realizado han sido buenas, poco a poco ha ido surtiendo mas su negocio con sus ganancias, él y su esposa atienden personalmente el negocio y dan a los clientes un buen trato para que regresen con gusto a volver a comprarles.

Él solicitó este credito porque quiere surtirse de mas camisas, blusas, playeras, pantalones, short, ropa interior y también un poco de ropa de frio ya que ha iniciado la temporada del frió y sus clientes se lo han estado pidiendo mucho.

Él espera que con esta inversión su negocio crezca mas y atraiga mas clientes ya que desea ahorrar para cuando decida ser papá poder tener un hogar donde recibir a sus hijos y poder darle una buena calidad de vida. 

los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Laura venta de catalago 
Felipa venta de decoraciones 
Irma venta de dulces 
Maria del Carmen venta de antojitos mexicanos 
Maria santa venta de abarrotes
Emmanuel venta de refacciones 
Yessica venta de abarrotes 
Ernesto venta de ropa 
Cecilia venta de ropa
texts.en:
The group "El Lirio" is made up of 10 people who each work in different businesses.  This group is located in a sugar cane region, and the neighborhood where they live is surrounded by sugar cane crops.

Hugo is one of the members of this group.  He is 25 years old, and completed the third year of high school.  He is married to Damaris, and they do not yet have children.  Hugo is a hardworking youth, who says that a year ago he decided to rent a shop where he could sell clothing for women and men to support himself.  Thanks to God his business has been successful and sales have been good.  He has been using his profits to gradually stock up  his business.  He and his wife personally attend to the business and they give their customers good service so that they will be happy to buy from them again.  

He is requesting this loan because he wants to stock up on more shirts, blouses, T-shirts, pants, shorts, underwear and also some cold weather clothing, since the cold season has begun and his customers are asking him for this.

He hopes that with this investment his business will grow and he will attract more customers.  He wants to save money so that when he decides to become a father he will be able to have a house for his children, and provide them with a good quality of life.

The other members of this group are:

Laura, who sells from a catalog
Felipa, who sells decorations
Irma, who sells sweets
Maria del Carmen, who sells Mexican snacks
Maria Santa, who sells groceries
Emmanuel, who sells spare parts
Yessica, who sells groceries
Ernesto, who sells clothing
Cecilia, who sells clothing

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, T-shirts, pants, shorts, and underwear

loans.name: Asana

texts.en: Asana is a fishmonger at Efutu. In front of her in the photo is the fried fish she sells. She has been in this business for the past 4 years. She is married to a driver and has 4 children. Asana uses her income to assist her husband in providing for their family. She will use her loan to purchase more fresh fish  to fry for sale. With the new profits, Asana will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish  to fry  for sale.

loans.name: Doralisa Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal  22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Doralisa, tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre, tiene 5 hijos de 16, 13, 8, 6 y 3 años, sus hijos estudian dos en colegio y dos en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella además de ser una gran madre para que a sus hijos no les falte nada se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también  se desplaza a otros cantones donde tiene clientes a los que les deja sus productos, ella aprovecha los días de feria en estos lugares. Trabaja todos los días en las  tardes y noches y los fines de semana todo el día, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería la compra en  Guayaquil cada vez que necesite. Lleva más de 10 años dedicada al comercio y le va muy bien.

La señora Doralisa está repitiendo el crédito ya que el anterior le dejo buenas ganancias, con las cuales mejoró su situación económica y familiar. Este nuevo crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños para aprovechar esta época que es cuando más vende. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cuatro años y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos en relación a otros Bancos. 

Sus sueños son que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the '22 de Julio' community bank meet in Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for being very commercial.  It is also known for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo celebrations and the cheerfulness of its people.

This is where Doralisa lives.  She is 35 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  She has five children who are 16, 13, 8, 6 and 3.  Two of her children are in high school and two are in elementary school.  Her husband is a salesman.

In addition to being a great mother, Doralisa also sells all kinds of clothes so that her children don't want for anything.  She makes her sales door to door and also travels to other cantons where she has customers who she leaves her products with.  She makes the most of market days in these places.  Doralisa works every afternoon and evening and works all day on weekends.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs to.  She has been in the business for more than 10 years and it is doing very well.

Doralisa is requesting a new loan as her previous loan made her good profits. She was able to use her profits to improve her financial and family situation.  She will use this new loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.  She will take advantage of the time of year as it is when she sells the most.  She has been a member of her community bank for four years and she likes it because the interest rates are lower than they are with other banks.

Doralisa's dreams are for her children to never want for anything, and to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 29 years old and single.  He owns a general store in Voi, which he has been doing for one year. 

Joel is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more brake fluids, car tires, and steering wheels. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase a piece of land to construct a business premises. He hopes to have a bigger and more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more brake fluids, tires, and steering wheels.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMAN III sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Zagnanabougou, un des villages de la commune de Guegneka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil, l’arachide et le fonio. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MANI première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare d’arachide.
La production est vendue au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85.000F CFA environs par campagne.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Lassine

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama est né vers1975 à BAMAKO. Père de 2enfants il vit dans une famille nucléaire à Noumousso - Kadiolo (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
 Il mène les activités de commercialisation de céréales depuis maintenant six ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et il réçoit  beaucoup de commandes de céréales, notamment du maïs. Ainsi pour avoir les réssources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il collabora avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.Adama est à son 7 eme prêt et les 6 prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter 5 tonnes de maïs et 2 tonne d’arachide. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants de Kadiolo. Les produits sont stockés dans son magasin. Il  les revend au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes venant des grandes villes telles Sikasso, Bamako, etc. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 165.000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Pour acheter de céréales

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: On September 1 1965, Daniel was discharged from the Guatemalan Army. On that day, when his platoon and he where traveling via military truck, they were ambushed by the guerrillas using incendiary grenades causing severe burn burns. Mr. Daniel received primary care in the army, but was left with residual burn deformity that limits the function and movement of his neck, lower lip and hand due to  burn contractures. This loan will be used for corrective plastic reconstructive surgery to improve his mobility.

loans.use: to improve the motion of his neck, lip and hand

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa se encuentra soltera, no tiene hijos, vive junto a su mamá y hermanos, para poder cubrir sus gastos personales ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, ya tiene una experiencia de cinco años en esta actividad y por tal motivo es reconocida en su comunidad.
Está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar ganado, ya que así incrementara el inventario de su negocio y cubrirá las demandas de sus clientes, pretende aumentar las ventas e ingresos para poder cubrir sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia económicamente.
Su aspiración es mantenerse trabajando, ofrecer a sus clientes ganado robusto y sano, también desea ser una persona ejemplar en su comunidad.

loans.use: comprar ganado, ya que así incrementara el inventario de su negocio y cubrirá las demandas de sus clientes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is an active member of Mercury Women Group. She has been a member of this group for the last four years. She is married and has five children, one in college and others in secondary school. She grows and sells tea Leaves and coffee. She earns $57 from the sale of tealeaves and $23 per month. She has a dairy cow, which gives her milk for sale and home consumption. She gets between10 to 15 litres of milk every day; this gives her on average $3.5 a day. With this income, she will not be in a position of sending her children to college and this is why she is striving to increase her milk production and consequently her income.

loans.use: She would like to improve on cattle feeds to increase milk production.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with four children, two of them in primary school. She started her shop business two years ago after selling her tobacco harvest. She started the shop in order to supplement her husband’s income. The shop is doing well and with the loan of US$150 from PEMCI she intends to build up her stock and improve profitability. She wants to quit the tobacco growing business due to its health hazards.

loans.use: To boost her stock

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela C. J. is the mother of two children and the owner of a small food stand in her rural neighborhood. Carmela travels to the Dominican capital to purchase products at resale value and sells them to the residents of her community. Her respected reputation among her neighbors and the essential products that she supplies have established her business as a mainstay in the small community market. Carmela is asking for this loan to expand her inventory from mainly household products and nonpreishable food items, to include fresh produce and poultry from, which she can purchase from the same markets that she currently buys from for her other items.

NOTE: Carmela is a member of a Bank of Hope solidarity group - made up of five micro-entrepreneurs who have gone through Esperanza's business training program and have proven to be in need of a loan as well as able to pay it back. Each member will receive a share of this $750 loan to develop their respective businesses and are responsible for making each loan repayment together, which fosters accountability as well as social support.

loans.use: Purchase food and beverages to stock her small grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her assorted pepper business

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.en: I have a small business of zapateria (shoe store), where I repair and make leather and rubber sandals. This business I have been having it for 9 years. Thanks to you I have been able to improve. Now for my shoe store I need to buy leather, rubber, threads, nails etc. With the utilities that the business gives me I help my family.

loans.use: To buy leather, glue, threads, etc

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim P., age 25, works at a garment factory, earning around $2 per day. Her one child is too young to attend school. In order to increase her family’s income and save for her child’s education, she would like to request a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike, so that her husband can start his own business and earn about $2 per day.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to start a moto-taxi business.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en: "I am Ishrat B. from a small town, Arifwala, Pakistan. I am a mother of two children, both of whom are too young to attend school at the present. When they are of the school-going age I plan to enroll them in a good school, which is relatively expensive.  I have been stitching clothes on order for last seven years, whereas my husband has a small store where he sells candies, spices and snacks. He needs to buy a few additional items for his store for which we request a loan of $175. My husband is a hardworking guy and a confident  father to offer wellbeing to the light of our eyes, our kids."

loans.use: Buy items for the store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add to her stock of used clothing

loans.name: Gulu D 2002 (Ii) Group

texts.en:
Faridah and Annet are poultry farmers. With the extra profits, Annet wants to pay school fees for her children and also provide more support for her family. Vero and Sarah sell used clothes and want to use the loan to expand their businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To introduce new poultry breeds

loans.name: Parween's Group

texts.en:
I am the group leader for two other women: Basheera B. and Khalida B.. Basheera B. will invest her share of our loan in their sack trading business and Khalida B. needs this loan for their cloth manufacturing business.

I have lived all my life in Multan, a city famous for its pottery. I am married and the mother of four boys. All my kids are above 14. One of my sons operates a video game shop. He started this shop two years ago by borrowing from Asasah, a microfinance institution. Now he has also added sales of cold drinks to his shop. This year my son wants to buy an additional video game for his shop. With the extra profits, I plan to help my son marry next year.

loans.use: Buy an additional video game for my son's video game centre

loans.name: Rita Maria

texts.en:
Mrs. Rita has two children, a 22 yr old son and a 19 yr old daughter. Her son works hard to help support the family and her daughter is a single mother. Mrs. Rita works as a factory worker and this job has enabled her to build her home. She’s requesting a loan to tile her house floor.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Rita, siempre preocupada por el bienestar de su familia y tener una casa bonita la que ha mejorado poco a poco a su gusto, vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte solamente con sus dos hijos de 22 y 19 años de edad, es su hijo mayor quien ya trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, su hija de 19 años es madre soltera y aun no trabaja por lo que es su madre quien la apoya. Doña Rita trabaja en una Zona Franca como operaria y su jornada de trabajo aunque es cansada le da gracias a Dios por tener un trabajo que le ha ayudado a sustentar a sus hijos y a ella misma ya que no cuenta con el apoyo de un esposo. Con la ilusión de ver su humilde hogar mas cómodo y bonito solicita un préstamo para poner ladrillos en el piso de su vivienda.

loans.use: Requesting a loan to buy tile for her house floor

loans.name: Rosa Josefa

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa is a person of great importance and very humble; she lives in a home that has still not been fully built. Together with her husband, they work sales in order to support their children. She works selling shoes in the city of El Alto, which is one of the poorest cities of our country. During the time that Mrs. Rosa has worked with us, she has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with respect to her payments. In addition to being a very charismatic person, full of self confidence, she is also very entrepenourial with many hopes of succeeding.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Rosa es una persona D. procedencia muy humilD., ella vive en una casa que aun no se encuentra muy bien construida. Junto a su esposo ambos se dedican al comercio para mantener a sus hijos, ella trabaja vendiendo zapatos en la ciudad D. El Alto que es una D. las ciudades mas pobres D. nuestro pais. En el tiempo que la señora trabaja con nosotros ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos, ademas D. ser una persona muy carismatica y llena D. confianza en si misma, es tambien una persona muy emprendedora y con muchos deseos D. superacion.

loans.use: Will purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa A. is forty-five years old, married, and has six children. She is very resourceful and supportive of her husband, helping him finance their children’s education and provide them with opportunities in the future. Three of Yaa's children have already completed senior high school and could start studies at a university. Yaa earns a living selling cooked food - rice with stew - as well as ground nuts, beans, and yams in the community market. She currently needs a loan to buy more rice, beans, and yams to increase the stock of goods in her store. She belongs to the community group called Nyame kye Trust Group, whose members provide a guarantee for one another as social collateral to help access and repay loans.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, beans, and yams

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr:
Angèle A. was born on May 4, 1974 in the department of Mono. Married to Gérard Edah, a driver with the National Water Company of Benin, she is the mother of four children, all of whom are at school. For more than 12 years she has been selling mattresses and pillows, which she makes herself, outside the Post Office. She has been living in Yagbe, a busy neighborhood of Cotonou, for eight years and commutes between Parakou and Kpanhouignan to buy supplies of raw material to make these mattresses. For her first loan in 2006 she obtained the sum of CFA 30,000 and so far she has proved to be reliable. Given the growing number of requests for mattresses, she wants to increase production. To do so, she wants to buy 20 bags of cotton fiber and have a reserve of CFA 20,000. However, Mrs. A. lacks the financial means to achieve her goals and is asking for her fourth loan in an amount of CFA 120,000.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

A. Angèle est née le 04 mai 1974 à ADJAHA dans le département de Mono. Mariée à EDAH Gérard, chauffeur à la Société Nationale des Eaux du Bénin, elle est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Depuis une douzaine d’années, elle vend aux abords de la clôture des Postes et Télécommunications des matelas et des oreillers qu’elle fabrique elle-même. Elle réside depuis huit ans à YAGBE, un quartier populaire de Cotonou et fait la navette entre PARAKOU et KPANHOUIGNAN pour s’approvisionner en matière première pour la fabrication de ces matelas. Elle avait obtenu pour son premier crédit en 2006 un montant de 30.000fcfa et s’est jusqu’ici montrée crédible. Vu le nombre croissant de demandes en matelas, elle veut accroître sa production. Pour ce faire, elle veut acheter vingt sacs de coton fibre et de la couverture pour 20.000fcfa. Mais dame A. Angèle manque de moyens financiers pour atteindre son objectif et sollicite pour son 4ème crédit d'un montant de 120 000fcfa.

loans.use: To buy 100 50-kg bags of cotton and have a reserve of CFA 20,000

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhun Y., 55, sells fruits and vegetables, including banana, coconut, and corn in the market. She buys from farmers and resells for profit, earning around $2.5 per day. Her husband, 51, is a construction worker and earns around $2 per day. They have five children, all of whom are young and in school. They live in PealnhekI Village, Pursat Province. In order to expand her business and improve her family’s income, she now is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more fruits to sell and to purchase a few pigs to raise.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits to sell and to purchase a few pig to raise

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia was born in in a place called Ayupaica in Mazocruz. She is 41 years old and has 3 children who still depend on her. Julia is a member and funder of the Julia Jiménez communal bank. She has always been good at business, starting at 16 years old when she began selling food. During her school years, she sold school supplies. Today her daughter helps her out by selling CDs and by helping to run her small hotel on holidays.

With the loan of 1,500.00 soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will purchase 20 packs of CDs and with 200.00 soles she will purchase vegetables, potatoes and meat for her restaurant.

Julia's dream is to set up a business for internet and office supplies on the first floor of her house and to start a restaurant on the second floor. She would also like to continue her work at the bank. In the coming city elections she is thinking of running as a candidate.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva volunteer.

Julia nació en la parcialidad de Ayupalca – Mazocruz, tiene 41 años de edad, madre de tres hijos que aún dependen de ella, vive en el Jr. Ejercito s/n.

Socia fundadora del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez, ella manifiesta que siempre le gustó hacer negocio, a los 16 años empezó a vender comida, en época escolar vende útiles escolares, actualmente su hija le apoya con la venta de CDS; ella atienda en su pensión, los días de feria – Mazocruz.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual pagará en 04 cuotas, tiene planificado comprar 20 conos de CDS y un promedio de S/. 200.00 Nuevos Soles comprará verduras, papa, carne para su restaurante. Su mayor sueño es poner en su casa que está ubicada frente al mercado un Internet, librería en el primer piso y en el segundo piso instalar su restaurante y seguir trabajando con el Banco Comunal, en la próximas elecciones municipales piensa participar como candidata..

loans.use: To purchase CDs, vegetables, potatoes and meat for her restaurant

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr: Âgée de 35 ans et née à Cotonou, elle est mariée à SOKENOU Daniel architecte de profession. Mère de 02 enfants, elle arrive à joindre les deux bouts grâce aux revenus de son activité.
