Elle est vendeuse de produits divers. Activité qu'elle exerce depuis 10 ans après avoir abandonné la vente de poissons frais qui entre temps n’était plus une activité rentable pour elle. Résidant depuis 05 ans à Sodjéatinmè où son activité a commencé par prendre un essor considérable, elle sollicite un crédit de 120000 F CFA pour constituer son propre stock afin de lui éviter de prendre les choses en détails ou à crédit. Ceci lui permettra de réaliser un bénéfice important. Notons au passage qu’elle est à son troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Jeanette K., 35, was born in Cotonou and is married to Daniel Sokenou, an architect. The mother of two children, she manages to make ends meet thanks to the income from her business. She sells general merchandise. She has been in this business for 10 years, after having given up selling fresh fish, which was no longer remunerative for her.

She has been living for 5 years in Sodjéatinmè where her business has begun to be well-known, and she is requesting a loan of 120,000 F CFA to establish her own inventory so as to avoid buying what she re-sells retail or on credit. This should allow her to make a good deal more profit. This is, by the way, her third loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of palm oil, peanut oil, tinned tomatoes and various condiments

loans.name: Silvia Eugenia

texts.es: La Señorita Silvia P. C., solicita este crédito para aumentar su capital de trabajo, ella es relativamente nueva en el negocio, ya que tiempo atrás ayudaba a su mamá en otro negocio, actualmente ella se independizó y tiene su propio negocio de venta de frutas en un mercado de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia, por ser muy responsable, se acepta la solicitúd de crédito al demostrar su aptitúd emprendedora. Silvia Eugenia además de ocuparse de la venta de fruta; estudia por las tardes en un Instituto de formación profesional.
texts.en:
Silvia P. C. is seeking a loan to increase her working capital. Her business is relatively new since she used to help her mother operate another business. She is now independent and has her own fruit sales business in a market in La Paz, Bolivia. Her loan request has been accepted due to her demonstration of responsibility and an enterprising attitude. Silvia Eugenia, apart from her work in fruit sales, studies in the afternoons in a professional institute.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Lin

texts.en: Mrs. Lin K. was born in 1975 and now she lives in Trapeang Kok village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Prum Teth, are sellers who make ice cream by themselves for selling. They face an obstacle because they do not have much money to support themselves. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Lin K. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ice cream box for her business. She hopes to increase income and improve her living condition with this loan. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy an ice cream box for her business.

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Svay P. S., 18, is single and is part of a poor farming family in Bathambong province, Cambodia. When he was 16, he decided to drop out of school because his family didn’t have enough money to support him, and he was committed to generating additional income to supplement his family's income.

In 2007, he started a business as a motor-taxi driver. Now he is able to generate on average around $2.50 per day of income. Svay P. has recently requested a loan to fix his motor-bike to make it more comfortable for his customers. (He is pictured with his client).

loans.use: To fix his motor-bike to make his clients more comfortable

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 32 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos menores de edad. Es agricultora, pero también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores en su casa desde hace 10 años, actividad con la cual se siente muy comprometida, ya que gracias a ella puede tener el dinero suficiente para cubrir la alimentación de sus seres queridos, además le agrada levantarse muy de mañana y estar ocupada, porque el trabajo le alegra la vida, y la hace sentirse útil y beneficiosa para su familia. Pero sin duda, lo que más le gusta es estar junto a sus seres queridos, quienes le brindan el apoyo necesario para seguir esforzándose como hasta hoy, sobre todo, lo más gratificante es ver sus animales muy gorditos, porque así puede obtener mejores ganancias. Nancy está iniciando su crédito con MFP, es una mujer muy trabajadora, lo cual garantiza la devolución del dinero de manera  favorable y oportuna. La cantidad que solicita será usada en la compra de animales de raza para mejorar su calidad y su costo.
texts.en:
Nancy, 32, is married. She lives with her husband and their 3 young children. She's a farmer but she also raises livestock, something that she's done for 10 years. It's work to which she's dedicated because thanks to the business, she's had the money to better feed and clothe her loved ones. She also likes getting up very early and staying busy during the day because work for her is one of life's pleasures and makes her feel that she's doing something useful for her family. Without a doubt, though, the thing that Nancy likes best is being with her family who provide the support necessary for her to keep striving. What gratifies her most is seeing her animals get fatter so that she can ultimately sell them. Nancy is just starting at MFP. She's a hard-working woman, a sure guarantee that her loan will be repaid. The loan will be used to buy animals with good blood lines to improve the quality of her stock and the price they fetch.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy animals for livestock business.

loans.name: Maggie Nabakka ‘S Group

texts.en: Maggie is a leader of 5members of a group.  She is a 30 year married with 4 children aged between 5 and 14 years. All her children go to school.  She takes care of additional family members (two orphans of her late brother). She resides and  rents a two roomed house, which serves as the home for 8 people. The home is equipped with electricity but no  piped water. She works in a semi urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala.   She sells charcoal at her home in Makerere near Kampala city. Maggie works 7 days a week. Maggie has an average of 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people.  Maggie has been in this business for the five years and has an MCDT for one month servicing her first loan. Maggie's monthly expenses include rent for accommodation. She wants to use this loan of $275 to stock more sacks of charcoal .

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Nut

texts.en:
Nut K. A., 42, is married and sells cakes and candies in the Kampong Cham province. She typically makes US$3.60 per day. She has owned this business since 2005. Before 2005 she was a farmer. Her husband, pictured here, is a motor-taxi driver and earns about US$4.50 every day. The couple has three children, one of whom is a student.

Mrs. Nut K. A. would like to take out a loA. to purchase cashew nuts in bulk and then resell them as a wholesaler to retail customers.

loans.use: To purchase bulk cashews to sell at the market

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is an entrepreneur from Kamenka. She sells bedding, towels, terrycloth robes and other bath accessories in one of the city markets. Yelena started this venture with the help of her friends who lent her the amount she needed to get going. Yelena has been in business for eight years. Currently, her turnover capital is about 10,000 Grivnas. Monthly net profit is about 3,000 Grivnas. 

Yelena loves what she is doing and is looking forward to the future. She is grateful for the opportunity this business has given, not only to provide for herself, but also to help her children. It has always been hard to provide for her family after she lost her husband and became a widow. Today she raises her younger son on her own. Her elder son lives separately. We are hoping the current loan of 7,000 Grivnas will help Yelena’s business stay stable in this spring season when crisis has affected many small businessmen all around the Ukraine. Yelena has promptly repaid 37 loans to Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies.

loans.use: To open an additional vending facility

loans.name: Petrona Del Rosario

texts.es:
Actualmente en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Petrona P. ha iniciado a mejorar su vivienda por medio de la reconstrucción de esta ya que su construcción tiene muchos años y hoy en día ha requerido mejorarla.

Ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito porque requiere un crédito lo más pronto posible para comprar los materiales de construcción para continuar con su obra y por razones de que el invierno pronto entrará y no quiere atravesar el riesgo de que el agua atraviese sus cuartos y sala. Por esto espera muy confiadamente sabiendo que su crédito será otorgado satisfactoriamente y así saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Today, in the municipality of Somotillo of the city of Chinandega, Petrona P. has stated to make home improvements for her home that is already in construction. The house is very old and it’s time to rebuild. She went to Ceprodel to obtain a loan because she needs the money as soon as possible to purchase construction materials to continue with the works and because it will be winter soon and she doesn’t want to take a risk that water would filter into the house. For this reason, she is confident she will successfully get this loan, so she can move on.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Ejiro

texts.en: Ejiro is 31 years old and married with 4 children. She sells bunches of plantains in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She has run this business for a long time. Ejiro is requesting the loan amount of 140,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more plantains to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plantains to sell

loans.name: Ashrafjon

texts.en:
The agriculture business takes a great deal of effort, requiring as it does exposure to the sun, the physical exertion of moving animals from one place to another and the hard work of tending to various crops. M. Ashrafjon has dedicated himself to cattle-raising for eight years now to support his humble family which so relies on him.

Currently, Ashrafjon is requesting of IMON International a loan of $700 to purchase calves that he can raise. It’s important to note that the granting of this loan will not only benefit him, but also his children and wife, the family he greatly loves.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle.

loans.name: Suhrobchon

texts.ru: Сухробчон молодой мужчина 1983 года рождения. Женат и имеет 1-го ребенка. У него среднее образование. Сухробчон занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Сухробчон пришел брать кредит в первый раз. У него пока малое количество скота. Сухробчон надеется увеличить количество мелко рогатого скота с помощью кредита. У его жены только одна дойная корова. Сухробчон планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Born in 1983, Suhrobchon is married and has one child. He has a secondary education. Suhrobchon is involved in livestock feeding and sales, and his wife is involved in milk processing and sales. This is Suhrobchon’s first loan request. He currently owns a small quantity of livestock. He hopes to increase his livestock headcount with the help of this loan. His wife owns only one dairy cow. Suhrobchon plans to purchase another dairy cow with a calf for his wife. He is grateful to our creditors for helping him achieve his goals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing livestock headcount

loans.name: Levi

texts.en: Levi C. is from the village of Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 37 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Levi owns and operates a business buying and selling raw bananas, selling both to tourists and to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Levi joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Levi is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business by buying more bananas and therefore earning more, also. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and for the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business by buying more bananas

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Isfandiyor

texts.en:
S. Isfandiyor, 24, is married and has a small child. He is the sole breadwinner for his family, which also includes his parents. His only income comes from cultivation and sale of large livestock at the local market. Every year, he buys young heifers from the farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with help from his wife and children and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. Isfandiyor is thinking of expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase one additional young cattle and this may need an additional investment of USD 600 in his business. Hence, Isfandiyor has applied for a loan from IMON International, a partner of Kiva.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase cattle to expand the business and improve the family's living conditions

loans.name: Noreen Faqeer Hussain Group

texts.en:
Noreen baji has been a citizen of Borewala, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband’s name is F. H. and he runs a business selling fruit-salad. Noreen baji helps him by making the fruit salad and sauces. His business is going well. He treks to different communities and sells his products from a cart.

Noreen baji is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits to advance her husband’s fruit-salad business. In the photo, Noreen baji is seated in a middle of the baji’s.
 
This loan group consists of four additional people: 

Saima baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

Kosar parveen baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine.

Rani baji wants a loan to buy paint boxes to sell.

Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: To buy fruit for their fruit-salad business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann B.'s main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. She owns and operates a sari-sari or general store. Mary Ann is just starting this business. She is 20 years old, married and has one small child. They are from the village of Capucao, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental.

In 2009, Mary Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mary Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business and for daily needs.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Divorced with four children, Augustina is a 30-year-old businesswoman. She believes that hard work and dedication are a way of minimizing poverty, and, for that reason, she is very serious with her business. She trades in cassava and plantain. She has been trading for the past five years, and has since been very resourceful to her family. She treks to the farming communities in the eastern region and supplies to the market women at Agbobloshie. 

She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of cassava and plantain to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She is a member of the trust group called Galilea. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support for themselves to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy a large stock of cassava and plantain

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying foodstuffs such as rice, tinned tomatoes, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Three Sisters Group

texts.en:
Here are Fatmata L., Marian K. and Edeline B.. They call their group Three Sisters. Members of the Three Sisters group are small scale businesswomen in Makeni city. They have been very fortunate to receive several Kiva loans. These loans have improved the businesses and living standards of these entrepreneurs. The previous loan they received was for Le 1,000,000.00 each. Having repaid that successfully, they are again requesting a new loan of Le 1,200,000 for each to further improve their businesses. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata L. on the right. Fatmata was born in Freetown. She is now forty-three years old, married to a police officer and they have five children. Fatmata’s children are attending primary and secondary schools. Fatmata sells drinks and locally dyed clothes called gara lappers. She has been in this business for many years now. With this loan, she will be able to further expand her business, make enough profit to cater for her children especially in meeting their educational needs.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Savut

texts.en: Mr. Savut K. lives in Kampong Chrey village in Takeo province. He is a motorbike taxi driver. His wife, Mrs. Kiev Chantha, is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. Aside from this farm, she is a pig breeder. Since her pig breeding business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Savut K. decided to ask for a loan to buy ten more piglets and pig food. He hopes to increase income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. He is 28 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is attending the local school, while the other is just three years old. His wife is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy piglets and livestock feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase natural products

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Luz Angélica, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Inmaculada”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Divorciada, tiene 66 años y 02 hijos, todos independientes.

Luz Angélica, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de mercadería de ropas, posteriormente por iniciativa de ella misma, decidió implementar su propio negocio de Veterinaria, ubicada en el Centro de la Ciudad, un local alquilado muy bien acondicionado, donde con su carisma y amabilidad, atiende a sus clientes día a día. Luz Angélica, nos cuenta que esta muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, ya que no le es muy trabajoso y a su edad, aun sigue con fuerzas, para seguir adelante en su negocio.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1000.00, comprará productos veterinarios como:    Alimentos para animales como: pedigree y vitaminas en líquidos. Accesorios como: collares, bosales, shampoos, cremas y polvos.

Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Señora Luz Angélica belongs to the communal bank "Virgen de la Inmaculada," in the Tarapoto district of San Martin province, in the San Martin region. She is divorced, 66 years old, and has 2 children who are independent. Luz Angélica used to sell clothing. Later, on her own initiative she decided to establish her own veterinary/pet shop business located in the City Center, in a rented location that is very well-equipped. Here, with friendliness and charisma, she attends to her clients daily. Luz Angélica tells us that she is very content with the work that she does since it is not too laborious, and at her age she is still strong enough to move ahead with her business. With this loan of S/ 1000.00, she will buy veterinary products such as: pet food (Pedigree), liquid vitamins, and accessories such as collars, muzzles, shampoos, creams and powders. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela organization for helping her to start her own business, and for helping other women to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for pets

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Doña Lucia tiene 46 años de edad, se casó a los 24 años y es madre de 03 hijos (02 varones, 01 mujer), estudió primaria completa, vive en el Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno.

Desde hace 02 años integra el Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazaret” con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles, aumentó a su capital y compró 01 ganado vacuno, ella se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno conjuntamente con su esposo, adquiere el ganado en las ferias de Ilave y vende en el Centro Poblado de López.

Para seguir aumentando más capital, solicitará un nuevo crédito de 2,500.00 nuevos soles, tiene planificado comprar 01 ganado vacuno mejorado.

Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien y que su negocio pueda crecer más.
texts.en:
Doña Lucia is 46 years old and has been married for 24 years. She is the mother of three children, two sons and a daughter. Lucia has an elementary school education and lives in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno.

She became a member of the Jesus of Nazareth Communal Bank two years ago. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to increase her capital so that she could buy one head of cattle. She buys and sells livestock along with her husband. Lucia acquires her animals at the fairs in Ilave and sells them in the central village of López.

To continue increasing her capital, she is requesting a new loan of 2500 soles and plans to purchase one head of cattle that is of much better breed.

Lucia hopes that her children will continue their studies and that her business grows even more.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle of better breed

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people. Agnes is a hairdresser by profession. She has some apprentices under training. She has her shop by the roadside in her community. Agnes has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy more working materials to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas M. is 29 years old. He is married and he has two children. His wife is still in school and they hope that their two children will get a good education some day.

His business is located in Gikomba-Nairobi, where he sells sofa set materials. Nicholas needs a loan to buy more stock for his business. He hopes that in the future, his business will be able to supply large quantities of materials, thereby satisfying his current customers and expanding his client base.

He is hardworking, smart and handsome.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for his business

loans.name: Rosa Etelvina

texts.es:
El banco comunal Porvenir está conformado por un grupo de mujeres que buscan la manera de adelante y brindarles  una vida mejor a sus familias, todas  viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, localidad que  se caracteriza por ser la tercera  más importante del país y por la hermosura de su paisaje andino.

Rosa Guamán es socia del banco comunal Porvenir, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sector del cementerio, tiene 61 años de edad y es casada, su esposo es jubilado de la empresa eléctrica, junto a él han procreado 2 hijos que se encuentran de 30 y 28 años de edad, son solteros y le ayudan económicamente en su hogar, con  en el esfuerzo conyugal de muchos años  están logrando terminar su casa pero aun les hace falta las ventanas y algunas cosas más.

Rosa trabaja en su  restaurant desde  hace 9 años y nos comenta que le va bien ya que su puesto tiene en su casa y no tiene que pagar arriendo, su horario es 6 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m. y fue una tía quien le enseño a  preparar sus productos y también a prendió de libros y revistas de gastronomía y la experiencia.
 Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo trabajando con los prestamos de la fundación, y fue su hermana quien le incentivo a que sea parte de este grupo muy alegre, con el nuevo préstamo que realiza en la fundación  va a comprar productos como arroz, aceite, azúcar, sal y muchos más productos que necesita para su restaurant.

Su meta es  incrementar su negocio y  tener más clientes.
texts.en:
The Porvenir communal bank is comprised of a group of women who are looking for a way to progress and provide a better life for their families. All of them live in Cuenca, a city which is the third most important in the country and known for the beauty of its Andean landscape. Rosa Guamán is a member of the Porvenir communal bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca near the cemetary. She is 61 years old and married. Her husband is retired from the electric company and together they have 2 children, 30 and 28 years old, who are single and who help the household financially. Through their efforts over the years, this couple is managing to finish building their house although they still need to do the windows and a few other things. Rosa has been working in her restaurant for the past 9 years and tells us that it is going well, as her she has it in her house and does not have to pay any rent. Her working hours are from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m.. One of her aunts taught her how to prepare her products and she also learned from books and cooking magazines as well as from experience. This is her second loan cycle with the foundation, and it was her sister who encouraged her to become part of this very happy group. With this new loan she is going to buy rice, oil, sugar, salt and many other goods that she needs for the restaurant. Her goal is to grow her business and to have more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, salt, oil, etc.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es: Hortencia, es una mujer muy honrada, vive en el Distrito de Calleria, región Ucayali, tiene 55 años, es madre de tres hijos, uno es menor de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y chupetes, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja como tractorista. Hortencia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias”, desde hace seis años,  el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de gaseosas y chupetes, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1500 soles, que será destinado a la adquisición de gaseosas e insumos y materiales para la elaboración de los chupetes. La meta de Hortencia es, ampliar su casa y su negocio para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hortencia is an honorable woman, who lives in the district of Calleria, region of Ucayali, is 55 years old, mother of three children, one of whom is minor in age. She sells soft drinks and lollies from her house and she has the support of her husband, who is a tractor worker. Hortencia has been a member of the commune bank “Mujeres Solidarias” (Solidarity Women) for six years. She used her first loan of 300 soles to buy soft drinks and lollies and now she is requesting a loan of 1500 soles to buy more soft drinks and ingredients to produce lollies. Her goal is to enlarge her house and her business, in order to provide a better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase soft drinks and ingredients to produce lollies.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty is a LAPO client with good repayment record. (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and else where in Africa. She sells groceries and foodstuffs like beans, rice, melon, tomatoes, milk. Beauty hopes for business expansion and she is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell and to increase her profit. Beauty is happily married with 7 children. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports the home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Nike

texts.en:
Nike is a friendly and a hard-working woman. She has a good relationship with LAPO. Nike sells medicines at retail prices in Ibadan. She hopes to expand her business. Nike is hoping for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She is 38 years old and married. She has a 15-year-old child who attends school. Her husband works and supports their home. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

About LAPO:
LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es:
Evelin pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sacsayhuaman” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 27 años y es casada. Elba tiene una hija llamada Daira que tiene 06 años.

Evelin es una mujer emprendedora trabajadora que se las ingenio para trabajar, ella y su esposo abrieron un pequeño taller de confección  de artesanía de tipo muñequería en su domicilio. Evelin también se dedica a la enseñanza de artesanía en dos lugares en el colegio “Pukllaysunchis” y en la “Dirección Regional de Turismo”, ella enseña a construir artesanía de tipo muñequería con materiales de cera de papa y tecnopor. Evelin usará el crédito para comprar materiales como por ejemplo tecnopor, silicona, lanas, mantas, hilos, fibra y mantas. Ella actualmente no esta estudiando pero con las ganancias que logre de su negocio podrá estudiar antropología. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Evelin belongs to the “Sacsayhuaman” Community Bank in the Arariwa Association. She is 27 years old and is married. She has a daughter named Daira who is six years old. Evelin is an enterprising, hardworking woman who is clever with her work. She and her husband opened a small workshop in their home where they make folk-art such as dolls. Evelin also teaches folk-art in two schools: “Pukllaysunchis” and the “Dirección Regional de Turismo”. She teaches how to make folk-art dolls with materials such as paper mache and styrofoam. Evelin will use this loan to buy materials such as styrofoam, silicone, wool, blankets, thread and string. Actually, she is not studying now, but with the earnings from her business she hopes to study Anthropology. This member of the cooperative is thankful for the opportunity offered through the bank and she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Evelin will use her loan to buy materials such as styrofoam, silicone, wool, thread, and yarn.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly C. is from the village of North Poblacion, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old, is single, and has one infant child. Beverly owns and operates a clothing business, selling used-clothing to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Beverly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Beverly is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Cristodia

texts.en:
Cristodia D. is from Lower Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 37 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Cristodia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector selling crops. The main source of income for the business comes from buying crops like bananas, cassava and copra from neighboring villages, and then transporting them to the city, where she sells them. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cristodia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. Cristodia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan Cristodia has taken from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Lower Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Danny Jesús

texts.es: Danny Jesús A. F., tiene la edad de 24 años, está soltero, y no tiene hijos. Vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros de engorde y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Danny tiene varios años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Danny Jesús A. F., 24, is single and has no children; he lives with his parents. He wants the loan to buy some calves and feed for them. He wants to provide proper care for them so that he will get the highest possible sale price. He also wants to increase his herd size and keep them in better conditions; he has an ideal space for cattle-raising. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he’s very happy with the terms offered. Danny has raised cattle for several years. He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of life and increased economic stability and to continue developing both as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calves and feed for them.

loans.name: Tchotchovi

texts.en: Madame Tchotchovi A. is 41 years old and lives in Lomé, Togo. She is married and has three children. She sells oil, rice, beans and other products at her food stall. Madame A. has requested a loan of 500,000 CFA to purchase general products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase products for sale

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes A. is from the village of Polo. She is 53 years old. Mercedes is married and has one adult child. Mercedes owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from making & selling nipa huts to local businesses and community members. Mercedes has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2007, Mercedes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from PMPC, which was for 6,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional raw materials and to use as working capital.

Mercedes is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be her sixth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase additional inventory & working capital.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel T. is from the village of  Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old. Maricel is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Maricel owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Using their motorcycle, Maricel and her husband peddle their fish around the village and nearby places. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maricel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Maricel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mario Eleno

texts.es:
El Sr.Mario Eleno vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá, está acompañado con la Sra. Irma Jara, juntos tienen una hija en edad escolar, la Sra. trabaja en Asunción como empleada doméstica con varios años de experiencia.

Don Mario se dedica a la venta de celulares y accesorios, y comenta que vende muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes, su zona de venta es por la ciudad de Ybycuì y Carapeguà.

Solicita el préstamo con nuestra entidad para la compra de  celulares ya que tiene varios pedidos y le conviene comprar al por mayor.
texts.en:
Mario Eleno lives in the city of Carapeguá. His life partner is Irma Jara and they have a school aged daughter together. Irma has worked as a domestic employee in Asunción for several years. Mario sells cell phones and cell phone accessories. He tells us that his sales are good because he has many customers. His sales area is in the cities of Ybycui and Carapeguà. He is asking us for a loan to buy cell phones because he has several pending orders and it’s advantageous to buy them at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cell phones and cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es cusqueña y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo que se encuentra ubicado a 1 hora y 20 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Las vendedoras actuales del mercado “Virgen de Asunta de Ollantaytambo” vendían sus productos de forma ambulatoria porque no habia mercado y no tenían puestos de venta. 

Actualmente cada vendedora cuenta con sus propios puestos de venta y Francisca también. Francisca en el puesto de venta vende comestibles y también se dedica  a la venta de artesanía y pertenece a la asociación de artesanos “Señor de Choque Quilca”. La pueden encontrar en su puesto cada tres veces a la semana desde las 8am hasta las 11am. 

Francisca desprende  una imagen de responsabilidad y amabilidad. Un flujo de turistas visitan el mercado y el negocio se anima bastante por las mañanas a la llega de los turistas que se dirigen a visitar las ciudadela inca de Machu Picchu. Ella vende artesanía de calidad como por ejemplo mantas, chulos, sombreros  y bordados. Hace 15 años que se dedica a la venta de artesanía y le va muy excelente.
  
Con su próximo préstamo, Francisca espera recibir $ 300 UDS. Por el momento, su tienda esta modestamente equipado con mercadería necesaria. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo  en comprar mercadería como por ejemplo gaseosas, arroz, azúcar, muchos productos más. 

Francisca pertenece al banco comunal “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo”, y es una de las fundadoras. Hace 4 años atrás un grupo de vecinas se juntaron para formar el banco comunal y vieron en la Asociación Arariwa una alternativa de ayuda con los préstamos.
texts.en:
Francisca is from Cusco, but now lives in the city of Ollantaytambo which is located about one hour and 20 minutes from the city of Cusco. The vendors of the market "Virgin of Ollantaytambo" used to sell their merchandise door to door and around the city, since there was no market nor any stalls from which they could operate. Today, each vendor counts on his own stand, Francisca as well. From her stand, Francisca sells food, snacks and grocery items. She also sells handicrafts from the group of artists called "Senor de Choue Quilca". You will find Francisca at her stand 3 times a week from 8 in the morning until 11 in the morning.

Francisco exudes the qualities of a responsible and friendly person. A constant flow of tourists visit the market and the environment is very animated in the mornings when the tourists headed for Machu Picchu arrive. Francisca sells quality handicrafts, for example table cloths, hats and embroidery. She has been selling handicrafts for 15 years now and the business has gone well. With her next loan, Francisco will receive $300US. For the moment, her stand is modestly stocked with the merchandise she needs. She would like to use the money from this loan to puchase sodas, rice, sugar and other products.

Francisco is a member of the communal bank "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo", or "The Friendship of Ollantaytambo" and she is one of the founders. 4 years ago a group of neighbors got together to form the communal bank and saw in the Association Arariwa an alternative way to get help with the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase products for her small business such as sodas, rice, sugar and other ingredients she uses to prepare the snacks she sells

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El Señor Silvio C. de 32 años de edad trabaja como Vendedor Ambulante, el misma cuenta con un puesto de ventas al costado de la terminal de Villarrica.
Su cónyuge Crispina Almada de 27 años de edad es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras por la zona de Villarrica, ambos solicitaron dicho préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para el negocio (compra de frutas y verduras), ya que los mismos manifestaron que hay mucha venta y necesitan de capital para más mercaderías.
texts.en:
Silvio C. is 32 years old and works as a street vendor, with a stall next to the Villarrica terminal. His wife, Crispina Almada, is 27 years old and a merchant. He dedicates himself to selling fruits and vegetables in the Villarrica zone. They requested this loan in order to buy products for the business (fruits and vegetables). They both state that sales are brisk, and they need capital to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is proud to be able to care for children and support families in her Oakland neighborhood through her in-home childcare center.  “This is something I have wanted to do since I was a little girl. I was raised in an in-home daycare!”
 
Before opening her business, Jessica studied early childhood education at a local college and earned her teaching credential while working at a large preschool. Although she appreciates the experience she gained at the preschool, she didn’t always agree with the way programs were run. By opening her own business, she is able to run her center according to her own childcare philosophy.
 
Jessica heard about Opportunity Fund through a friend, but admits, “It took me a couple months before I even called. I thought they’d never give me a loan because I didn’t have any credit.”
 
With the help of two interns, Jessica currently cares for eight children, although at full capacity she could care for 14. Enrollment has dropped due to the recession, but she is working hard to attract new clients through word-of-mouth references and by improving her facilities.
 
With a $5,000 loan, her third with Opportunity Fund, Jessica will transform her run-down yard into an outdoor play space complete with a protective fence, large lawn, and a vegetable garden where the kids can begin to learn about good nutrition.

loans.use: To pay for landscaping an outdoor play area

loans.name: Señor Nazareno Group

texts.es:
ALCOM: SEÑOR NAZARENO.

Alcancía Comunal creada hace 04 meses, conformadas por nueve socios emprendedores, nos cuentan que esta Alcancía se formó gracias al incentivo e influencia de una socia quien pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “ Mi Amigo Jesús”.

Veamos el caso de María Mercedes Z., integrante de la ALCOM: “Señor Nazareno” con 37 años de edad, conviviente con una hija, ella se dedica al comercio, con las ventas de sandwichs, gaseosas, habitas fritas, chifles, chicharrón de pollo, agua de manzana,etc, que ofrece a los viajeros que llegan de diferentes lugares del interior del País, relata que desde muy jovencita ella aprendió hacer este tipo de negocios, ayudando a su mami vendiendo sandwichs (pollo, carne), y así fué esmerándose a diario,  hoy en dia cuenta con un negocio propio, ese esfuerzo la llevó a generar mayores ganancias; en la que las invierte para la educación de su menor hija, quien lleva cursando estudios primarios, y los gastos necesarios que se requiere; para ello solicitó su crédito a EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, con el fin de terminar con la construcción de su nuevo kiosko, como también para implementar sus mercaderías, así mismo nos cuenta que los gastos también lo asume su pareja, que ambos aportan para el beneficio y la comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
SEÑOR NAZARENO COMMUNAL BANK A communal bank created four months ago with nine enterprising members. They tell us that this bank was formed thanks to the incentive and influence of a member who is part of the “Mi Amigo Jesús” communal bank. Let’s take a look at the case of María Mercedes Z., a member of “Señor Nazareno” communal bank. She is 37 years old, has a live-in partner and a daughter. She is a merchant selling sandwiches, soft drinks, fried lima beans, fried plantain, fried chicken, apple juice, etc. to travelers who arrive from the interior of the country. She relates that she learned this type of business while still very young helping her mother sell meat and chicken sandwiches. Every day she’d try harder. Today she has her own business and her efforts have led to greater profits that she uses to pay for expenses and her young daughter’s education; she is in elementary school. She asked EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for a loan to finish building a new kiosk and to stock it with merchandise. She told us that her partner helps pay for household expenses and both contribute to the family’s wellbeing and comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a new kiosk and set up her merchandise.

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es:
Oscar C.  es un joven dedicado  al comercio de Colonias americanas y a la venta de artesanías  como bolsos y sandalias que trae de San Juan Nepomuceno y de San Jacinto, ambos poblaciones ubicadas en el departamento de Bolívar. A sus 21 años sus padres le dieron su primer capital semilla y empezó vendiendo colonias americanas  y le fue bien con esta primera experiencia, así fue que empezó a atraerle la venta de las bellas artesanías traídas de San Jacinto y San Juan Nepomuceno y logro con una buena administración de su dinero, incursionar e impactar su mercado con estos nuevos productos: sandalias y bolsos elaborados a mano. Oscar aunque  joven es muy emprendedor y tiene  muchas aspiraciones y sueños hacia los que se dirige,  por eso planea continuar sus estudios y en el futuro ser un exitoso empresario profesional, exportador de las artesanías de Colombia, que mucho valora y sabe que son muy apreciadas por los extranjeros que han visitado a su bonita e histórica Cartagena de Indias.  Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará bolsos y sandalias que tiene encargados y otras artesanías como pulseras y colonias americanas que ya la gente reconoce por la calidad de sus aromas y son muy acogidas.
Oscar es un muchacho alegre e  inspira confianza a  cualquiera que llega a conocerlo, por eso se le facilita el acceso a muchos mercados en todos los niveles sociales y cuenta con una clientela inigualable;  así mismo también sus padres han depositado toda su confianza en sus capacidades , lo han impulsado para que gestione su propio porvenir y lo apoyan en todo lo que le represente una vida llena de éxitos.
texts.en:
Oscar C. is a young man who works as a merchant of American colognes, but he also sells handcrafted products such as purses and sandals that are brought in from San Juan Nepomuceno and San Jacinto. Both of these towns are located in the Department of Bolívar. At the age of 21, his parents gave him seed capital so that he could begin selling American colognes and he did very well with his first experience. Later he began bringing in beautiful handicrafts produced in San Jacinto and San Juan Nepomuceno. As a result of managing his money well, Oscar was able to venture into new markets and expand his inventory with new products such as handmade sandals and purses.

Even though he is young, Oscar is enterprising and has many aspirations and dreams to fulfill. He plans to continue his studies and become a successful business professional in the future. Oscar wants to export Colombian handicrafts since they are treasured and well-known among foreigners who have visited the beautiful and historic city of Cartegena de Indias. With his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Oscar will purchase purses and sandals that he has on order as well as bracelets and popular American colognes that are known for the quality of their scents.

Oscar is a happy young man who inspires confidence in everyone he meets. This quality helps him gain access to many markets across all social levels, thereby accruing a unique customer base. At the same time, his parents have great confidence in his abilities. They continue to encourage and support everything he does so that he can have a successful life.

loans.use: Purchase American colognes, handcrafted purses, sandals, and bracelets

loans.name: Paulo Cesar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “SEÑOR DE HUANCA ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Paulo;   él tiene 33 años de edad, es casado y tiene 1 hijo,  El socio es natural de Calca,  Él socio trabajaba como obrero en la carretera interoceánica, terminando de ejecutar el tramo Cusco Puerto Maldonado ruta a Brasil; El socio ahora con lo que ahorro compro sus primeras 4 motos para la venta el ahora solicita el préstamo para comprar pintura y aceites para mantener las motos y venderlas, de este modo el socio se dedicara a este negocio de manera permanente. Él socio solicita el préstamo para comprar aceites y otros para el mantenimiento de las motos para la venta.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Paulo belongs to the Señor de Huanca Communal Bank.  This communal bank is located in the Calca district, Calca province, Cusco department.

Paulo, age 33, is married and has one child.  Paulo is a native of Calca.  He worked as a laborer on the inter-oceanic highway, finishing the section of the Cusco Puerto Madonado route to Brazil.

Now, with his savings, he has purchased his first four motorcycles to sell.  He is requesting the loan to buy paint and oil to service the motorcycles and sell them.  This way he will work in this business in a steadfast way.  Paulo is requesting the loan to buy oil and other things for maintenance on the motorcycles in order to sell them.

He is grateful to those who are making this dream possible, and he pledges to make his payments on time.

loans.use: To buy paint and oil to service motorcycles and sell them

loans.name: David Ernesto

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Divinas.

En este sitio encontramos a David, el tiene 35 años de edad, en la actualidad está soltero y tiene una hija de 15 años que se encuentra en el colegio estudiando, vive con su hija en casa de sus padres, es Arquitecto de profesión pero se ha dedicado al comercio.

Vende ropa de todo tipo en su casa donde tiene un local, hasta allí legan muchos clientes todos los días ya que trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 18h00 hora. La mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil y también le traen ropa desde Panamá y Colombia, lo cual atrae a muchos clientes ya que sus productos son de muy buena calidad y  vende a un precio razonable.

Este crédito es  para comprar más mercadería para tener un buen stock de mercadería para la época navideña  que es muy buena y vende bastante. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus metas son tener su propia casa y su propio local.
texts.en:
Members of the Las Divinas (The Divine Ones) communal bank meet every two weeks in the La California neighborhood of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí province, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

We find David, 35, here.  He is single and has a 15 year old daughter who is in school studying.  He lives with his daughter in his parents’ house.  He is an Architect by profession but works as a merchant.

He sells all sorts of clothes at home where he has a space set aside for this.  Many customers come by daily and he’s open for business every day from 8am until 6pm.  He goes to Guayaquil to buy his merchandise and also has clothes brought to him from Panamá and Colombia which attracts a lot of customers because his products are of very good quality and he sells for reasonable prices.

This loan is to buy more merchandise so that he can have good stock available for the Christmas season which is very good and he sells quite a bit. This is his second cycle in the bank and he likes it because of the ease in getting loans.

His dream is to own his own house and his own store.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Joseph Maina

texts.en:
Joseph Maina K. is 32 years old. He is married to Lucy and together they have one son. Joseph has been operating a farm for about two years and earns an income of 8000 KES. Lucy helps on their farm as well.

He is taking his first loan with Kadet to buy fertilizer and dairy feeds. In the future, he hopes to buy land and build rental houses with the hopes of improving his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and dairy feeds

loans.name: Cecilia Daysi

texts.es:
Cecilia tiene una lavandería y cobra por canasta de ropa. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Cuando se quedo sin trabajo empezó a utilizar la lavadora de su casa para lavar la ropa de los vecinos y obtener dinero por sus servicios de lavandería. Poco a poco vio que era rentable el negocio  y decidió que con sus ahorros compraría otra lavadora. En la actualidad tiene su lavandería en la parte delantera de la casa de la hermana, trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta el anochecer. Ella cobra cada canasta de ropa $ 5.00, y media canasta $ 2.50 eso incluye detergente, desinfectante, lavado y secado. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar detergente, suavizante, jabón para tener posibilidades de lavar mas ropa. En el futuro quiere tener una clientela muy grande.
texts.en:
Cecilia has a laundromat and she charges per basket of clothes. She lives in a suburb of “Paraiso de la Flor” (the flower paradise) characterized by its dirt roads and mountains. 
When she was out of work she started using the washing machine in her house to wash her neighbor’s clothes and earn money for her services as a laundromat. Little by little she saw that her business was profitable. She decided to buy another washing machine. Actually she has her laundromat in her sister’s house. She works from 9am until the evening. She charges $5.00 per basket of clothes and $2.50 per half basket. This includes detergent, disinfectant, softener, soap and drying the clothes. With this loan she would like to buy detergent, softener, and soap in order to be able to wash more clothes. She would like to have more customers in the future.

loans.use: detergent, softener

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim S., 45, is a village woman living in Kompong Cham Province. She is a local crop farmer. She currently grows rice crop, vegetables, and some fruit on her own farmland. To help meet the family's daily expense needs, her husband helps her in the same business. This family can earn an income of at least $10 per day. They have five children, and all of them are single, still living under their roof. In the past time, Sim S. hired a plowing machine from her neighbor for plowing her farmland.  Now it is the time for paying for plowing her saving account is not enough to pay for. To solve this problem, Sim S. would like to borrow some fund from Kiva to pay for plowing cost and to buy some seeds for planting. Note: Sim S. and her husband are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To pay for plowing cost and to buy some seeds for planting.

loans.name: Raikan's Group

texts.en:
Raikan A. is the leader of this group. She is the resident ok Kerben, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  Raikan, age 23, is married to a taxi driver.  She has a newborn daughter. Two years ago with an initial investment of 20000 soms, the family started to breed livestock. By reselling livestock after fattening, they earn 9000 soms per month. This profit made it possible for them to save money and purchase a vehicle. 

With the money from this loan, Raikan wants to purchase animals so she can expand her business. In the future, she plans to make house repairs. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: La Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
Sandra es del grupo “LA FORTALEZA”  ella es la presidenta , todas viven en laderas de chillón al norte de Lima, Sandra es divorciada y tiene 03 hijos es con su trabajo que ella puede  brindarles una buena educación y mejor calidad de vida, durante mucho tiempo ella alquilaba un puesto de comida allí trabajaba junto a su madre debido al fallecimiento de ella dejo el negocio que  además era costoso por el pago del alquiler y las ganancias no eran suficientes, por eso traslado su negocio a su propia casa además de atender clientes ahí  también  una hermana que trabaja en una fabrica la contacto para vender menú ( almuerzos) a los trabajadores del lugar,  es así que diariamente reparte aproximadamente 20 raciones de comida, su trabajo la ayuda  a pagar la academia de una de sus hijas ahora ella esta pensando buscar un mejor lugar donde la fluidez de gente sea mayor para abrir su negocio o mejor aun poner un restaurante en su propia casa es para eso que usara su préstamo para avanzar la construcción de su casa y concretar su proyecto muy pronto.
 
* Sandra C. es la sexta de las paradas
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the “LA FORTALEZA”  (Strength) group.  She is the group's president.  All the members of this group live on the hillsides of Chillón, to the north of Lima.  Sandra is divorced and has 3 children.  Through her work she is able to provide her children with a good education and a better quality of life.

For a long time, Sandra used to rent a food stall.  She worked there together with her mom but when her mom died she left the business.  The business was very expensive because of the high rent and her profits weren't sufficient.  For this reason, she moved her business to her own home.  As well as serving customers in her home, her sister, who works in a factory, contacted her about selling meals (lunches) to the workers in her factory.  Every day Sandra delivers approximately 20 meals.  Her work helps her to pay one of her daughter's school fees.  She is now thinking of looking for a better place where the flow of people is greater to open her business or, better still, set up a restaurant in her own home.  For this reason, Sandra will use her loan to make progress in building her home and will fulfil her project very soon.

* Sandra is the sixth person along amongst the people standing up

loans.use: To finish building her future restaurant

loans.name: Kobuljon

texts.en:
S. Kobuljon is married and he is 26 years old. He sells women’s purses and different accessories at the local market. Kobuljon has been in this business for 6 years. During this time he has learned that having a large assortment of goods on display all the time is the key to success in this kind of business. Kobuljon's prices are not high, making the goods more attractive to his customers. 

Kobuljon would like to borrow 7000 Somoni to expand his inventory. He hopes to develop this business further and increase his sales. 

                                                                  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new goods to sell

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a married man with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a clothing sales business (Khanga’s) for the past five years; he sells at the market and door too door to his neighbours. Suleiman faces a major challenge in high transportation costs. He hopes to expand his business and sell more products.

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase a bundle of clothes to start and stock a retail shop business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business and eradicate poverty.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to start a retail shop.

loans.name: Kean

texts.en: Kean S. is a married woman who is good at cooking many kinds of meals for sale. Currently, she sells breakfast food to students in the local school. She can earn a profit of approximately $5 per day to support her family. Her husband works as a soldier, and he always contributes his monthly salary to Kean S.. In order to increase her revenue, Kean S. is asking for a loan to invest more capital in expanding her food-selling business. She has two single children, who still live under her roof.

loans.use: To expand her food-selling business.

loans.name: Lester Antonio

texts.es:
Lester casado, su esposa ama de casa, sus hijos estudian, desde hace tiempo trabaja como chofer de ruta urbana, su proyecto mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, su meta que sus hijos se profesionalicen. 
Poco  a poco ha ido mejorando la vivienda con el ciclo anterior construyo una tapia en los costado del terreno. Con este préstamo comprara llama, perlines, cementos, piedrín, hierro, barias de soldar, alambre de marre, zinc, pernos punta de broca entre otros materiales para cambiar el techo. 
Agradece a la financiera por su apoyo a su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Lester is married and his wife is a housewife. Their children are in school. He has been public transport driver for a long time. His goal is to improve the infrastructure of his house and to see his kids grow up to have a career.

He has gradually been improving their house. With the past loan cycle he built a wall along the back end of their land. With this loan he will purchase beams, cement, gravel, iron, solder, wiring, zinc, drill bits and other materials that he needs to replace the roof. 

He is thankful to the financial organization for the support provided.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes M. is 37 years old and is married with two children. Her husband, Antony Karita, is 38 and works with BHC. Their oldest child, Leri, is 10 years old and attends lower school and their youngest, Leon, is four years old and in pre-school.

Agnes runs a clothing boutique that is located in the town center. Her business provides a monthly profit of 25,000 KES.  Agnes was introduced to KADET by a group that was already registered. This is her first loan with KADET and she will use it to purchase men’s suits, shirts and ties. 

Agnes describes herself hardworking and honest. If this loan boosts her business, she plans to purchase a plot of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase men’s suits, shirts and ties

loans.name: Gasparin Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento "GASPARIN " se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro de la Institución, compuesto por 8 personas en la cual todas son mujeres,  sus actividades están entre venta de comida, de bebidas,  venta de cosméticos y venta de zapatos, son de la zona del Plan 3000. El grupo se fundo por la iniciativa de tres socias: La Sra. Mery, que se dedica a la venta de comida , vendiendo en su domicilio ella tiene su casa propia  vive en ella hace 10 años , los ingresos que generan sustenta el gasto de su hogar y la educación de sus 2 hijas, con el dinero del crédito comprara insumos y abarrotes para la elaboración de sus platillos, la Sra. Eidy se dedica a la venta de productos  cosméticos por catalogo, los ingresos que generan sustenta los estudios que ella realiza en la Universidad con el dinero del crédito comprar cosmético que se encuentran en promoción para luego venderlos a un precio mas alto y tener mas utilidad , Todas las socias están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
The GASPARIN Undertaking Bank is now in its 1st loan cycle within the Institution. The bank is composed of 8 persons, all of whom are women. Their activities vary: they may sell meals, drinks,  cosmetics, or shoes. The members all live in the zone called Plan 3000,

The group was founded on the initiative of 3 members. Mery, who sells meals from her own home. She has lived there for 10 years. The income she generates provides for her household expenses and the education of her 2 children. With this loan she will buy supplies and groceries for preparing her dishes.

Eidy sells cosmetic products by catalog. The income she generates covers her studies in the university. With her loan, Eidy will purchase cosmetics currently on sale, then, sell them at a higher price to earn more profit.

All the members are grateful to the Institution for the help offered by granting the loan.

loans.use: TO BUY GROCERIES AND SUPPLIES FOR PREPARING MEALS AND FOR COSMETICS TO SELL

loans.name: Mchakato Group

texts.en:
Happy C. is in her late thirtes and is a widow with four children.  She has two business, selling charcoal and a beauty salon, which she has owned since 2007.  She works from 6.00am to 9.00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Happy's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the salon's equipment and start selling charcoal, household expenses and school fees. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase the salon equipments and to buy more sacks of charcoal.

Happy will share this loan with her loan group "Mchakato" which has a total of 16 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Happy is second from left 1st row.

loans.use: To increase salon equipment and buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a forty-one-year-old married man with eight children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For six years he has been running a drug shop after resigning from being a government security officer.  With the income generated, he has been able to provide the basics for his family.

He has a challenge of limited funds to buy the necessary drugs and his dream is to own a pharmacy.  John intends to use the credit facility to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell

loans.name: Sabokhon

texts.ru: Сабохон жительница района Рудаки. Ей 44 года. Она замужем, имеет троих детей. У нее среднее - специальное образование, продавец. Она арендует торговую точку на рынке «Шохмансур», где продает помидоры. Этим видом бизнеса занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для покупки огурцов и помидоров.
texts.en: Sabokhon lives in the Rudaki region. She's forty-four years old, married and has three children. She's had vocational training and, for the past fifteen years, has worked as a salesperson in the "Shopmansur" market selling tomatoes. Sabokhon is asking for a loan in order to buy tomatoes and cucumbers.

loans.use: to purchase cucumbers and tomatoes

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is selling and setting up heating systems. He works from a rented shop. Armen's shop provides services to a large number of customer groups, so he constantly needs to refresh his product variety. He would like to enlarge his business and increase his working capital.

With the requested loan, he plans to increase the variety of his products. Armen lives together with his wife, father and one child, and the business profit sustains the whole family.
