loans.name: Abdull Monir Group

texts.en:
Zahira , who is the leader of Abdull Monir group, is 47 years old. She is married, having 4 children and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan.
she is a tailor and has been involved in this business since 1999. She has much experince in this business and can sew different kinds of clothes.
She needs this loan to buy a new machine with the other needed materials of her business.
She hopes that if her business grows she will be able to suport her childern and can have a small tailoring shop as well.

loans.use: purchasing a machine and materials

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en:
Fidele is 29 years old and is married with one child who is 3 years of age. Fidele lives in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda. His wife is a full-time housewife.

This butcher shop business chosen by Fidele is profitable because he has good marketing skills and has many years of experience in this field. Since 2001 his business has been open from eight in the morning to eight in the evening every day except Sunday.

Fidele is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to grow his business through purchasing great quantities of meat for sale. This will allow him to earn more profits.

Fidele, above all, plans to provide all the needs of his family, to save money for his child’s school fees, and to create another business activity for his wife; these are his targets.

loans.use: To purchasing great quantities of cow meat to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad.
Irene es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Irene viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, papa, productos que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Irene necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa.
Los sueños de Irene son tener casa propia e implementar su negocio en su casa.
texts.en:
Irene is a member of the Communal Bank “Solidaridad” (Solidarity). She is 30 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Irene travels to different fairs in the region to buy grains, potatoes, and other products that she sells at the local food market.

She needs a loan of 1600 PEN in order to buy potatoes. Irene dreams of having her own house and starting a home business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoes

loans.name: Sara Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Sara Patricia H. Alemán. Se desempeña como asistente de tesorería en una alcaldía del municipio tiene mas de veintidós años de experiencia en dicha actividad es madre de un hijo en edad escolar los créditos le han ayudados para mejorar su nivel de vida este crédito lo solicito para construir un cuarto de habitación y lleva varios créditos con CEPRODEL y espera que siempre existan estas instituciones que beneficien a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Sara Patricia H. Alemán works as an assistant treasurer in a city hall. She has more than 22 years of experience in this activity. She is the mother of a son who is school-aged. The loans have helped her to improve her living standard. The loan she requests will be used to build a room in her home. She has had a number of loans with CEPRODEL, and she hopes that these institutions that benefit low-income people will always exist.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, concrete blocks, cement, support beams and other materials

loans.name: Algen

texts.en: Algen B. is from the village of Comon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Algen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail business, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Algen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Algen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income and support her children’s education. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: 02 Thieu Toan _ Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Hien T. T. (47) is a 61-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thieu Hoa _ Thieu Toan. Hien is the leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02 Thieu Toan _ Thieu Hoa (02 Thieu Toan _ Thieu Hoa).

Hien is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To making a living, Hien operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattL. for saL.. Hien has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, Hien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hien has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and then sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hien plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

  1. P. T. Thoa (43) is a 45-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
  2. N. T. Men (44) is a 47-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
  3. P. T. Lan (45) is a 62-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
  4. N. T. Hien (46) is a 45-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
  5. L. T. Hoa (10) is a 42-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector selling home products.
About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Hien T. T. (47) là 61 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở Thieu Hoa _ Thieu Toan. Hien là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02 Thieu Toan _ Thieu Hoa (02 Thieu Toan _ Thieu Hoa). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Hien thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hien kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND. Vào 2006, Hien đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hien đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. P. T. Thoa (43) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. N. T. Men (44) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. P. T. Lan (45) là 62 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. N. T. Hien (46) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 5. L. T. Hoa (10) là 42 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng gia dụng. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and then sell

loans.name: Isabelita's Group

texts.en: Isabelita M. is from Sinili, Santiago. She is 58 years old and is the group leader of this eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Isabelita M.'s Group. Isabelita is married and has nine school-aged children. She owns and operates a transportation business, providing motorcycle transport to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Isabelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. Isabelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will again be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy palm nuts

loans.name: Song

texts.en:
Mrs. Song S. is 58 years old and is a villager who lives in Preal village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Bo Kun, are farmers who own 1.5 hectare of land where they cultivate rice for a living. Aside from being a farmer, Mr. Bo Kun is also an agriculture laborer, who earns a small revenue to support his family.

For this farm, Mrs. Song S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a plowing machine to support her farming.

The couple has five children; one is a laborer and one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the other three are students and also help their parents with farming.

loans.use: To purchase a plowing machine.

loans.name: Merry

texts.en:
Merry T. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 49 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Merry owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for more than 9 years now.

Merry joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Merry has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise and also fertilizers. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Merry from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise and also to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: El Señor Walter solía vivir en casa en alquiler,  pero actualmente tiene su casita que se compro viendo la necesidad de el y su familia ya que tiene 2 hijitos y una esposa que mantener.  El Señor Walter trabajaba con un tráiler  transportaba abarrotes y otros pero este no le permitía estar cerca de su familia ya que tenia que viajar constantemente. Pensando en el y su familia compro un taxi  de segunda mano  que estaba bien cuando lo compro ahora tubo fallas mecánicas y necesita nuevas llantas y el arreglo del mismo  para que el logre trabajar bien es por ese motivo que saco el préstamo de "Emprender" quien ahora esta feliz por haberle dado una oportunidad dándole la taza preferencial de kiva.
texts.en:
Walter used to be a renter. He now owns his own house. He has a wife and two children to support. Walter used to work as a grocery distribution truck driver. However, this work did not allow him to spend time with his family because he had to travel constantly. Thinking of himself and his family, he bought a second-hand taxi which was OK when he bought it but now needs new tires and service so that he can continue to work. This is the reason behind his request for funds from “Emprender” and he is happy because he has been given the opportunity to have KIVA’s preferential rate.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and for vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Flor Andina Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Flor Andina” actualmente se encuentra en el I ciclo y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina central D. la Asociación Arariwa. 

Las actividades económicas D. los algunos D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo, venta D. productos D. belleza, venta D. frutas, venta D. perfumes, venta D. comida y venta D. relojes. Otros socios brindan servicios D. viajes turísticos, alquiler D. carros y empleada D. una ONG. 

Justina, tiene 62 años, es viuda y tiene seis hijos (2 mujeres y 4 varones), ella nació y vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Hace varios años que abrió un pequeño restaurante en su domicilio donD. sirve almuerzo. Hace varios atrás su esposo falleció, y Justina se quedo sola al cuidado D. sus hijos. 

Decidida a continuar su vida, Justina se dedico D. completo al negocio. Utilizo sus ahorros para implementar el restaurante, donD. aproximadamente atienD. a más 20 D. clientes todos los días. Le pueden encontrar en su restaurante, que está equipado con sillas y mesas, D. lunes a sábados, desD. las 9 D. la mañana hasta bastante tarD., o hasta que se agote la comida y los domingos venD. platos especiales extras como por ejemplo chicharon y caldo D. cabeza. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Justina  espera recibir S/. 500 soles. Por el momento, su restaurante esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero  D. este préstamo en comprar más gaseosas, arroz y azúcar.
texts.en:
The “Flor Andina” (Andean Flower) communal bank is currently in its first loan cycle and is maD. up of hard-working, enterprising people who constantly seek opportunities to get ahead and, with their daily efforts, to give their children a better future. The communal bank's meetings are held every 30 days at Asociación Arariwa's central office. Some of the members' economic activities are, for example, sales of beauty products, fruit sales, perfume sales, food sales and watch sales. Other members offer their services as tour guides, renting cars, and a member is employed by a non-governmental organization (NGO). Justina is 62 years old. She is a widow and has six children (two women and four men). She was born and lives in the city of Cusco. Several years ago, Justina opened a small restaurant in her house, where she serves lunch. Several years ago, her husband passed away, and Justina was left to take care of her children alone. Deciding to continue with her life, Justina dedicated herself completely to her business. She used her savings to start the restaurant, where she attends to approximately 20 customers everyday. They can find her in her restaurant, which is equipped with chairs and tables, Monday through Saturday from 9 in the morning until quite late, or until the food runs out. On Sundays she also sells special dishes like, for example, chicharrón [fried pork rinds] and caldo D. cabeza [sheep's head soup]. With her next loan, Justina hopes to receive 500 new soles. For the moment, her restaurant is modestly equipped with the most basic necessities. She would like to use the money from this loan to buy more sodas, rice and sugar.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soda, rice and sugar

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es: Fanny tiene  38 años, vive con su esposo  y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 20 años trabaja vendiendo hamburguesas, en su carrito, lugar donde prepara estos platillos, todas las tardes y las noches. Le agrada trabajar en su negocio porque le permite acomodar sus horarios con las demás actividades que realiza entre ellas como la crianza de animales y la agricultura, además de que disfruta cocinar porque es su pasatiempo. Para el futuro planea tener mejores herramientas para sus trabajos como mesas y sillas nuevas. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes, como: aceite, envases descartables, entre ellas, platos y cubiertos.
texts.en:
Fanny, 38, lives with her husband and four children in her own home. For over 20 years she has worked selling hamburgers from her cart where she prepares these dishes every afternoon and evening. She enjoys her business because it allows her to arrange her work schedule in harmony with her other duties like raising animals and farming. Besides, she enjoys cooking because that’s her hobby. For the future, she’d like to have better work tools like tables and new chairs. This is her 7th loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she can count on financial support for she has always been punctual with her repayments. In addition, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all its members are responsible and mutually supportive. She is grateful to all the people who will fund the loan she is requesting which will be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the requested funds to buy ingredients like: cooking oil, disposable containers such as plates and cutlery.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and cutlery.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres Unidas”,  están en el Quinto ciclo con  18 integrantes y sus respectivas actividades productivas.
Ellas se encuentran trabajando muy unidas realizando actividades para pagar las cuotas del préstamo así como para contar con ahorros para cualquier necesidad.
La señora Felipa es una de las integrantes del comité y se dedica a la fabricación, y venta de productos de limpieza.
Ella semanalmente de acuerdo a los pedidos que ella recibe compra materia prima y prepara los productos de limpieza como detergentes, lanvandinas, jabones para lavar ropa y otros.
Esta actividad le ayuda a ella y su marido para mantener a su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima para fabricar productos de limpieza y también envases de plásticos para una mejor presentación y distribución  de sus productos.
texts.en:
The committee named “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) is in its fifth loan cycle with 18 members who engage in productive business activities. They work closely together in various events so that they can make their loan payments and save enough money to meet any need.

Sra. Felipa is one of the committee members who earns her living by making and selling cleaning products. Every week she receives orders, so she must buy the materials needed to prepare cleaning products such as detergents, laundry soaps, and bath soaps. This business helps her and her husband support their family. She is requesting a loan to buy the materials needed to make cleaning products and plastic containers for better presentation and distribution of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making cleaning products & plastic containers

loans.name: Katiusca Dolores

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida por su clima cálido y  agradable encontramos el Banco Comunal Los Jazmines  que se reúnen cada quince días en esta linda ciudad.

La señora katiuska tiene 33 años, está casada hace 15 años y fruto de esta relación ha tenido tres hermosos niños que estudian en la escuela y en el colegio. El esposo se dedica a la  albañilería.

Se dedica al comercio de ropa de todo tipo, tiene muchos clientes que le realizan pedidos  y entrega sus productos en su casa. Ella deja sus productos a créditos y cobra semanalmente lo cual es una ventaja ya que a la vez que realiza sus cobros también utiliza nuevas ventas. Compra sus productos en Portoviejo, trabaja todos los días y realiza los cobros los días sábados, dice que tiene muchos clientes porque es muy paciente con ellos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar mercadería para incrementar su negocio. Es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le agrada por sus facilidades de pago.
 
Su sueño es tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
The Los Jazmines (The Jasmines) communal bank meets in Portoviejo, Manabí department capital, a beautiful city known for its warm, pleasant climate, every two weeks. Katiuska, 33, has been married for 15 years and has three beautiful children who are in school. Her husband is a bricklayer. She is a clothing merchant. She has many customers who place orders with her and she home delivers their goods. She sells at credit and collects weekly payments which is an advantage because at the moment of making her collections she secures new sales. She buys her goods in Portoviejo, works every day, and does her collecting on Saturdays. She says she has many customers because she’s very patient with them. She will use this loan to buy merchandise to increase her stock. It is her second cycle in the communal bank and she likes the ease of payment terms. Her dream is to have a store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, undershirts, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
This is Melita D., 56, a widow who is now providing for herself and her family. She is a resident of Caloocan City just north of Manila on the island of Luzon. Melita maintains a direct sales business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct sales brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct sales brands. She also sells beauty products to salon, beauty shops and barber shops.

The way in which a direct sales business works is that a customer’s order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, so these are the profits that dealers count on as their income.

Melita’s regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every week. To help her continue operations, she is requesting a 34,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans. Melita faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

loans.use: To buy orders for her customers

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel y su espoa L. señora Iris, son unmatrimonio muy joven D. apenas 4 años D. casados, tienen un pequeño hijo D. dos años, poco a poco le han hecho mejoras a su vivienda, para darle una mejor calidad D. vida al pequeño y para que sus futuros hijos esten comodos en su hogar, en L. caque que ahora avitan no cuenta con piso, y es por eso que solicitan este credito para colocar el piso y L. banqueta D. su casa.
texts.en: Abel and his wife Iris are a very young married couple who have been married for barely 4 years. They have a little son of 4 years old. Little by little they have been making improvements to their home so they can give their little one a better quality of life and so that their future children will be comfortable in their home. They don't currently have a finished floor, and so they are requesting this loan to put in a floor and sidewalk.

loans.use: Construction of a floor and sidewalk.

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Mrs. Han T. is a 35 year old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Tom Province. She has three children, all of whom are single. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow crops and vegetable crops in her farmland.

She has a life partner in her husband, who sells rattan beds, which he makes from raw materials to sell at the market. Mrs. Han T.’s husband thinks that it is time to sustain his investment's growth and look for extra revenue. He wants to pick up his materials in a large amount, but he doesn’t have a big enough vehicle to transport more products. To achieve her husband's goal, Mrs. Han T. has decided to seek a loan in order to purchase a trailer for her husband to connect to his motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for her husband to connect with to his motorbike.

loans.name: Glarah Chepkemoi

texts.en:
Glarah S. is 52, married, and has eight children. Some of the children have finished school while others are still in school. Glarah began her business five years ago in her village where she collects tea leaves from farmers, transports them to the factory, and sells them at a profit.

Glarah learned about KADET through a friend who is also a KADET client. With this first loan, she plans to expand her business and acquire more tea leaves from farmers so that she can increase her supply to the factory resulting in higher profits.  Her future plan is to own a lorry to transport her tea leaves to the factory; which will boost her business.

loans.use: To expand her business of buying and selling tea leaves

loans.name: Kusikoyllor Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KUSIKOYLLOR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irma Aurora; ella tiene 57 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la venta D. artesanías, ella hace tejidos como chompas, pantalones, chalinas y guantes, la socia venD. también mantas, llaveros y muñecas todos son artesanía, al socia trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor. 

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta D. comida, restaurant, enfermera, artesanía, transporte y  cuidado D. niños.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank "Kusikoyllor", which is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. The member's name is Irma Aurora, she is 57 years old, married and has two children. She is in the business of selling handicrafts; she makes knit work such as sweaters, pants, ties, and gloves. She also sells blankets, key rings, and dolls, all of which are artesanal. She works from 8am until 6pm, and wants to expand and improve her handicraft business. She is requesting the loan to buy handicrafts wholesale.

The other members are in the businesses of: selling food, restaurant, nursing, handicrafts, transport, and caring for children. Irma is thankful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she commits to making the payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to buy handicrafts wholesale.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn has been dedicated since she’s obtained working capital to engage in  a hog-fattening business. Presently, she relies on this activity to cover her personal costs and help sustain her family. Jocelyn buys piglets from her neighbors, raises them, and when they have reached a good point of development, she sells them to business people who visit the village, either alive or slaughtered for their meat to be sold per kilo. This activity is very common in their place and many entrepreneurs do this.

Jocelyn wishes to expand her business by buying more piglets, vitamins, and feed for piglets, in order to forge ahead with her business and be able to help her family to get ahead. For this reason, she is, for the second time approaching KIVA lenders through ASHI, for a loan amounting to 20,000 Php to help her reach her goal.

Jocelyn is a hard-working woman dedicated to her home. Her dream is to care for her seven children and offer them a better quality of life, out of poverty. Jocelyn’s neighbors, friends and even her group mates consider her respectful person.

Her dreams are to provide a better future for her family, sustain the profitability of her hog-raising business, start a savings account for her children and support them to finish their studies until they complete college to get better careers someday.

With hard work and determination, Jocelyn is focused on improving her quality of life through her business efforts and support from ASHI and Kiva lenders across the world.

loans.use: To support her hog-raising business

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay V., age 49, sells groceries and is a tailor, earning an income of USD $6.00 per day. V. is married and live with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Her husband works at a Christian church, earning an income of USD $3.00 per day. The family has to spend USD $66.00 on food, USD $3.00 on electricity, and USD $50.00 on other necessary expenses every month. 

V. is requesting a loan of USD $1200 to purchase more groceries to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Mario Alexander

texts.es:
Mario es soltero, tiene 21 años y vive en la provincia de Anta distrito de Anta departamento del Cusco.  Anta se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Mario se dedica a la agricultura, él se dedica a la compra y venta de productos agrícolas como por ejemplo papas, maíz, trigo, cebada y muchos más, él vende en la feria de la comunidad de Inquilpata llamada “Tablada”. La comunidad de Inquilpata se encuentra ubicada a 15 minutos de ciudad principal de Anta.  Mario que espera recibir de S/. 1500 nuevos soles de crédito y va comprar semillas y muchos productos más. 

Mario pertenece al banco comunal “LLankaq Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene un año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Mario is 21, single, and lives in Anta province, Anta department of Cusco, about 45 minutes from the city of Cusco.

He works in agriculture, buying and selling products such as potatoes, corn, wheat, barley and much more.  He sells them in the community market  “Tablada”, in Inquilpata which is 15 minutes from the main city of Anta.  He hopes to receive 1500 new sols with this loan and with them he will buy seeds and many other products.

Mario belongs to the Llankaq Maqui communal bank of the Arariwa Association.  The communal bank has been functioning for a year and is well administered by the board.

loans.use: To buy seeds and many other products.

loans.name: Waraba

texts.fr:
Madame Waraba D. est une femme âgée de 29 ans qui vit avec ses 7 enfants et son époux dans une famille nucléaire à N’Tentou, un des quartiers de la ville de Ouelessebougou, préfecture de Kati,  Région de Koulikoro.
Waraba n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école,  alors très tôt elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et à la vente d’habits et de condiments alimentaires.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les deux premiers prêts, Waraba est à son troisième prêt individuel, qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, des douzaines d’habits pour enfants et pour femmes, auprès des grossistes à Bamako et quelques fois au marché de Ouelessebougou auprès de forains. Elle effectue sa vente à la maison et aux marchés de Ouelesseboubou, Tièlé, Sido et Sélingué, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Madame Waraba D. espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, aider le mari à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans les activités. 
Waraba ambitionne diversifier davantage ses activités et devenir grossiste  en habillements pour enfants à Ouelessebougou
texts.en:
Mrs. Waraba D. is a 29-year old woman who lives with her 7 children and her husband in a nuclear family in N'Tentou, a quarter in the city of Ouelessebougou, of the Kati prefecture, in the Region of Koulikoro. 

Waraba did not have the opportunity to go to school, so at a very young age she became interested in revenue-generating activities, notably the buying and selling of clothing and condiments.  After she successfully repaid the first two loans, Waraba is on her third individual loan. She will use it to purchase dozens of articles of children's and ladies’ clothing from the wholesalers in Bamako and, on occasion, in the Ouelessebougou market fairgrounds. She carries out her sales from her house and in the markets of Ouelessebougou, in Tiele, Sido, and Selingue, completing her sales in cash and credit to a clientele made up of women and men. 

Waraba D. expects to earn a monthly income of 40.000 FCFA which will be used to repay this loan, to support her husband in meeting the family's expenses, and to reinvest the remaining portion in the business. 

Waraba endeavors to further diversify her business and to become a children's clothing wholesaler in Ouelessebougou.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Elida Elvecia

texts.es:
Elida de 25 años de edad., reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y perfumería, el negocio lo inicio hace un año y medio, tiene una hermana que le ayuda en algunos momentos a vender.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, cosméticos y perfumes, esta inversión le ayudara a mantener a disposición de los clientes buena cantidad de mercadería, teniendo mejores oportunidades de venta.
Su objetivo es que a través del trabajo que realiza un día poder tener su propio local, amplio donde pueda atender a la clientela y desarrollarse como una comerciante.
texts.en:
Elida, 25, lives with her husband in Jiquilisco, Usulután department and she sells cosmetics and perfume.  She started the business a year and a half ago with a sister who occasionally helps her sell.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, cosmetics and perfumes.  This will help her keep  a good quantity of merchandise for her customers so that she has more opportunity to sell.
Through this work her aim is to some day have her own business location large enough that she can take care of her customers, and that she can develop into a businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and perfume

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca A. is from the village of Gusa, Calatunan. She is 55 years old. Francisca is married and has ten children. To make a living, Francisca owns & operates a sari-sari store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from vending food items. Francisca has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Francisca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to add to her working capital. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Francisca from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Gaudance

texts.en: Gaudance is 32 years old, and has 4 children between 3 and 11 years old. Gaudance’s husband is a doctor, and Gaudance is a pharmacist. Gaudance would like a loan to buy additional strong medications to sell. Gaudance has had this business for 6 years, and it has enabled her to buy whatever she needs. With the profits she hopes to realize, Gaudance plans to pay for her children's school fees as well as renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy additional medications to sell

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Seam V. resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. V. is a weaver, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of about USD 1.50 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 55 on other necessary expenses. 

V. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products for sale. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more raw silk to produce silk products.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en: Alphonse is 39, married and has two children who are 4 and 6 years old.  He makes a living by running a small store where he sells various items, including biscuits, lotions and braids. He has been in this business for three years and works every day from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. With the profits made possible by this loan, Alphonse will continue to expand his business and save for his family's future.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: María Inés

texts.es: María Inés M., habita en casa alquilada junto con su compañero de vida. Doña María es una mujer luchadora y por mucho tiempo ha trabajado para ganarse el pan de cada día. Ella posee una pequeña tienda en el que ofrece diversidad de dulces y galletas. Su negocio se encuentra  ubicado en el mercado Municipal de San Vicente del  Departamento del mismo nombre, zona muy transitada, en especial el negocio de Doña María ya que siempre atiende a sus clientes con una sonrisa y con mucha amabilidad.  Su sueño es contar con la capacidad económica que le permita invertir en su pequeño negocio con el fin de tener una mejor gama de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL  ya que no puede realizar su sueño por sus propios medios. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de variedad de galletas: de  diferentes sabores, precio,  tamaño, etc.), Así como para la compra de variedad de dulces. De esta manera espera obtener un mejor nivel de ingresos que le ayuden a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mará Inés M. lives in a rented house with her partner. María is a hardworking woman and she has worked to earn a living for a long time. She has a small store where she sells a variety of sweets and cookies. Her business is located in the municipal market of San Vicente, in the department of the same name. The area sees a lot of traffic, especially María’s business because she always serves her customers with a smile and a lot of friendliness. Her dream is to have the economic capacity to invest in her small business so that she can have a greater variety of products to offer her customers, since they prefer more and more variety. For this reason she has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL, because she can’t achieve her dream otherwise. The loan will be used to buy a variety of sweets. In this way she hopes to achieve a higher level of income, which will help her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cookies in different flavors, prices, sizes, etc., and also sweets.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar U. is from the village of La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 46 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Oscar owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating tricycle transport services. Oscar is just starting this business.
In 2009, Oscar joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Oscar is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be his fourth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories.

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: (cisailles, signole, etc.) to buy welding materials (shears,, hand drills etc.)

loans.name: Stanislas

texts.en:
Stanislas, age 29 and married, has owned a motorcycle transport business for the past year. His business is well-organized and open daily from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. 

Stanislas has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy essential materials like tires and an engine for his motorcycle transport. With his profits, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: To buy essential materials like tires and an engine.

loans.name: Molikob

texts.ru: Моликоб проживает в районе Дангара. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем, имеет 2 детей. Ее муж, пенсионер. А старший сын находится на заработках в России. Сама Моликоб более пяти лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она имеет торговую точку, где продает женские национальные платья, платки и ткани. Целью кредита является покупка тканей и детской одежды.
texts.en: Molikob lives in Dangara. She is 48 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is retired. Her eldest son is working in Russia. Molikob has been trading in the market for more than five years.  She has a shop where she sells women’s traditional dresses, scarves, and fabric. She is taking out a loan to buy fabric and children's clothes.

loans.use: to buy fabric and children's clothes.

loans.name: Concepta

texts.en:
Concepta has been operating a bar for the last 8 years. She supplements what she gets from this business by engaging in farming. She is a honest, hardworking, and independent 42-year-old business lady. She is a single mother of two children; Kennedy and Denis Ngunu. 
Her dream is to educate her children and to support the needy and give them hope. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for inculcating in her the art of saving. She wants 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more crates of sodas.

loans.use: To buy crates of sodas for her bar.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 26 years old, married and blessed with a one-year-old child. He operates a motorbike transport business to earn a living. He has been in this business for three years. He was able to buy a motorbike with his previous loan from Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. Daniel hopes to grow his business for more income generation. He has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.en: Maria is 72 years old and married with five children, all of whom are professionals and have moved out of the house. She is the owner of a small restaurant that sells typical Peruvian food such as "arroz con pollo", "lomo saltado", and "sopas". She is asking for a loan in order to expand her kitchen and purchase another oven. She plans to buy cement and other construction materials to expand her kitchen. She has had her restaurant for 16 years and has been very successful. She is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cement and other materials to expand her restaurant kitchen and to purchase another oven.

loans.name: Adalgiza

texts.es: Adalgiza  D. 52 años se dedica a la comercialización D. artículos D. la canasta familiar, como víveres abarrotes, enlatados, refrescos y mercancías variadas, desD. hace 8 años, en los que ha ganado mucho reconocimiento entre los miembros D. su comunidad especialmente D. las amas D. casa quienes son sus principales clientes.  Ella es separada  y tiene 3 hijos en las edades D. 27 a 31 año con quienes sueña ver siempre exitosos. Adalgiza inició su negocio después D. quedar desempleada, y requerir ingresos para sostener su familia. En su negocio venD. D. contado y a crédito, rota sus cuentas por cobrar cada 7 días  y sus inventarios cada 23; Adalgiza cuenta con una acreditada clientela y un importante volumen D. ventas, que se ajusta a las necesidades D. sus clientela, a quienes ofrece en las unidades D. medidas  que ellos requieren y los productos  que necesitan y pueden comprar. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, con el cual adicionará un surtido variado D. mercancías que rota rápidamente y necesita tener un stock para disminuir los costos D. transporte y aumentar un poco sus ganancias por las compras D. contado D. estos productos, como abarrotes, víveres y enlatados. Su sueño más adelante es adquirir su vivienda y aumentar sus utilidades para continuar generando ingresos por muchos años más.
texts.en:
Adalgiza is 52 years old and sells everyday food products such as groceries, canned goods, soft drinks, and a variety of other items. She has been in business for eight years and has gained a great deal of recognition from the members of her community, especially among housewives who are her main customers. Adalgiza is separated from her husband and has three children between the ages of 27 and 31. She always dreams of seeing them become successful.

Adalgiza started her business after she became unemployed because she needed income to support her family. In her business, she sells for cash or on credit. Her accounts payable period covers seven days and her inventory turnover period is 23 days. Adalgiza has a credit-worthy customer base that makes up an important percentage of her sales. She makes adjustments according to the needs of her customers by offering them half-size units of the products that they use so that they will buy them.

At the moment, Adalgiza is applying for a Kiva loan that she will use to acquire a varied stock of merchandise that rotates quickly. By paying cash for such products as groceries, provisions, and canned goods, she will able to lower her transportation costs and generate a slightly better profit. Her dreams going forward incluD. acquiring a home, increasing her revenues, and continuing to generate income for many years to come.

loans.use: to buy grocery products, provisions, and canned goods.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a father of two children, the older of whom is five years. He is a Rwandan rice farmer and he has been doing rice farming for the past eight years.
He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor which will work on his rice farm during this season.

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en:
Elisha is a married man with two school-going children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills.

For the past 11 years, he has operated a retail shop business selling to his neighboring community. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. Elisha dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and detergents. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and detergents.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long is 50 years old. She is married and currently lives with her husband, her in-laws and her two lovely children, who are of school age. 

Currently, Long is a rice farmer. From this business, she can gain around 1.25 USD per day. Since it is farming season, she would like to request some funds from HKL and Kiva. She will use the loan to pay for plowing her fields. 

This is her first loan with Kiva and her third with HKL. She had not received a loan though another bank before, but HKL gave her loans with much better conditions at a much lower interest rate. 

She is very thankful to all kind lenders that always help her family.

loans.use: to pay for plowing her fields.

loans.name: Cecilia Antonia

texts.es:
Cecilia, de 43 años de edad, originara de la ciudad de León, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, ella es comerciante se dedica a la  venta de mercadería  en general. Antes de dedicarse a este negocio ella trabajaba de limpieza en un colegio de secundaria, después trabajo atendiendo una panadería era vendedora. Pero después decidió tener su propio negocio que le permitiera movilizarse por varios lugares fue entonces que comenzó a vender ropa ,zapatos, cosmético , bisuterías de manera ambulante lleva 8 años con este negocio, en ocasiones cuando no esta vendiendo se dedica a trabajar como ayundante de cocina es restaurantes. 
Realizo el préstamo para comprar mercadería tales como ropa, zapato,cosméticos, artículos del hogar. Pues necesita mercadería nueva y variada para ofrecer y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Le gustaría poner una tienda grande de venta de mercadería en general. Seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
43-year-old Cecilia is from the city of León.  She is a single mother and has one child.  She is a trader who sells general merchandise.  Before she started working in this business, she used to work cleaning a high school and then serving in a bakery.  However, she decided to start her own business which would allow her to get around different places.  She started selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics and costume jewelry as an itinerant vendor and has been in this business for eight years now.  Sometimes, when she isn't selling her products, she works as an assistant cook in restaurants.

Cecilia took out this loan to buy merchandise such as clothes, shoes, cosmetics and household items as she needs new and varied merchandise to sell to her customers and meet her customer demand.  She would like to set up a large store selling general merchandise and to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothes, shoes, cosmetics and household items

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: Lilia tiene 58 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos ya son mayores e independientes, solo vive con uno de ellos que aun depende de ella. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. Su trabajo consiste en la venta de bebidas alcohólicas a personas mayores de edad, tiene una fuente de soda en su casa en donde lo utiliza para vender gaseosas y bebidas para el consumo de personas mayores de edad. Tiene cinco años realizando esta actividad y lo hace con su hijo quien le ayuda en todo lo que puede. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene trabajo e ingresos todos los días, además tiene tiempo para realizar múltiples actividades, le esta yendo regular ya que las ventas bajaron por falta de variedad de productos, por ello espera aumentar la variedad y así volver a tener los ingresos que tenía antes. Este será el crédito número doce con MFP, y por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más bebidas para su venta, además que quiere aprovechar las promociones que cuando compra en mayor cantidad le dan a menor precio.
texts.en: Lilia, 58, is a cheerful, hard-working lady who has a common-law husband and three children.  Her two oldest are grown and live independently and the youngest one still lives at home with the family which has its own house.  Her work consists of selling alcoholic beverages to adults.  She has a soda fountain in her house and sells sodas and alcohol to adults.  She has been in business for five years and her son helps out when he can.  What she enjoys most about her work is that she is busy and earns an income every day.  She also has time to carry out other activities.  Sales have dropped a bit for lack of product variety but she wants to add products and get back to the income she was earning previously.  This is her twelfth loan through MFP and she is counting on support from each of you.  She plans to use the loan to buy more beverages and take advantage of the discounts offered for volume purchases.

loans.use: To buy beverages.

loans.name: Zaripa's Group

texts.en:
Zaripa, 34, is the leader of this group. She is married with three young children and is involved in livestock breeding and retail of milk products, while her husband, along with thousands of fellow countrymen, is abroad in search of a better source of income. 

Zaripa devotes all her time to taking care of her  livestock by taking it to pastures early in the morning, and watering and feeding it throughout the day. She seeks much support from her mother in taking care of the children while Zaripa is at work. Currently she owns a cow and calf and is actively involved in generating milk worth 200 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS) per day. The target customers are small grocery stores located nearby and confectioner’s shops. In fact, Zaripa’s business is a continuation of long-cherished family heritage of livestock that is highly valued in local culture.

Her monthly income is 3,000 soms, with the additional income of 10,000 soms received by her husband, which has helped to make house improvements like renewing all rooms. Zaripa hopes to further develop her business successfully with the help of this loan from Kiva lenders, which she plans to spend on a purchase of food for livestock.

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase feed for livestock.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en: Leonardo is a married man with three children. Leonardo is 56 years old and resides at Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Leonardo is operating a service-based business providing transportation services to the local community members to earn a living. He's been doing this business for 30 years. Each month he earns PHP 13,550 doing this type of business. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Leonardo has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Leonardo wants to build a house and to finish the studies of his children.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle

loans.name: Margaret Wanjiru

texts.en:
Margaret used the second loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm during the planting season. She planted and harvested and it was very profitable.

She paid the loan well and in good time.

This will be her third loan and she plans to use the loan amount to  buy seeds and fertilizer as well as spraying chemicals for use during this planting season.

In the future, Margaret hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida, age 56, a resident of the Silang municipality in Cavite Province in the Philippines. She is married to Rodante, a farmer, and she has four children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Zenaida operates a pineapple farm. She grows pineapples and some bananas in their farm located in Cavite Province. The farm is in the highlands, where it is suitable to grow pineapples and bananas. She sells her product to markets and fruit stores that she regularly supplies, as well as to the local community. She earns a minimum of 7,000 PHP in monthly sales.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Zenaida dreams of being able to give her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, allowing her to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her business.

loans.name: Sànt Yàlla Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée le 28/03/2008. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui sont toutes issues de la même localité. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou Dame  debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 28 ans. Elle est mariée mère d'un enfant. 

Elle dispose d'une table où elle vend tous les matins le petit déjeuner. Elle dispose d'une forte expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années.

Ce crédit lui permettra de s'approvisionner en lait, sucre, café, beurre pain etc pour mener à bien son activité de vente de petit déjeuné.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne dans le Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
This group was created on 28 March 2008. It has 11 members who all come from the same area. They all run small businesses as their main activity. Fatou Dame (holding up her hand at the far right of the photo) is the group leader. She is 28 years old, married and the mother of one child.

She has a stall where she sells breakfast every morning. She has a lot of experience in this business as she has been doing this for several years. This loan will allow her to buy milk, sugar, coffee, butter, bread and other supplies to make her breakfast business a success.

Her aim is to help her husband support the family while increasing his savings in the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, coffee, bread, and other supplies.

loans.name: Irma Trifonia

texts.es: La  Sra. Irma, ella vive en la localidad de San Luis por mas de 8 años se dedica a la  compra  y  venta  de animales y también a la venta  de  huevo criollos,  ella entrega  huevo   a distintas tiendas de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  los animales  lo saca a vender en la feria de animales los días sábado y domingo en la localidad de el Torno,  los otros días realiza entrega en su domicilio. El crédito lo esta solicitando para la compra de mas animales ya que tiene pedidos para estas fiestas navideñas y lo necesita comprar con tiempo para engorde ya que también es mas barato,  Convive con el señor Máximo  el se dedica al transporte,   ya que por el trabajo para siempre viajando por lugares alejado  actualmente se encuentra trabajando en la localidad  cañada 2, la Sra. Irma se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Sra. Irma lives in the settlement of San Luis. For more than eight years she has bought and sold animals and she also sells Creole eggs. She provides the eggs to different stores in the city of Santa Cruz. She takes the animals to sell in the animal street fairs on Saturdays and Sundays in El Torno settlement. Other days she makes her sales from home.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more animals since she already has orders for the Christmas holidays and she needs to buy them in time to fatten them since it is also cheaper to fatten them herself. 

She lives with Sr. Máximo who works in transportation and due to his job is always traveling to faraway places. Currently he is working in the settlement of Cañada 2. Irene is very grateful for the help provided her.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs and eggs.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Akoua est une femme âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée å un géomètre. Elle a 5 enfants. Le premier a 33 ans et le dernier a 22 ans.
Akoua travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1981. Elle vend des poissons frits et des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule.  Au moment, n’a pas de difficulté.
Akoua a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de l’huile végétale et des poissons congelés. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Akoua voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akoua is a 49-year-old woman. She is married to a surveyor. She has five children. The first-born is 33 and the last-born is 22 years old.

Akoua has been working as a reseller since 1981. She sells fried fish and general food products to all types of customers from her home. She buys her products in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, she has no difficulties.

Akoua has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy vegetable oil and frozen fish. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Akoua would like to increase the size of her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to ensure her family's self-fulfillment.

loans.use: to buy vegetable oil and frozen fish.

loans.name: Veatriz

texts.es: La señora Veatriz de 69 años es casada y vive únicamente con su esposo en una casa que mientras fueron jóvenes construyeron con ahorros propios y con créditos, desde hace 18 años ella se dedica a la venta de accesorios como los son; aretes, collares, pulceras, pinturas, relojes, cintos para dama y caballero, diademas, broches para el cabello, esmaltes para unas, donas para el cabello y mas productos que ella compra en estados unidos para revender en Mexico desde hace casi diez ellos Veatriz ha sido la única fuente de ingresos para ella y su esposo ellos solventan los gastos de su hogar de este negocio y solicitan el apoyo para compra de mercancía y asi poder ofrecer a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos a sus clientes y al mismo tiempo obtener un ingreso mayor para solventar los gastos de su hogar
texts.en:
Veatriz is 69 years old, married, and lives with her husband alone in a house they constructed with their savings and loans while they were young. For the last 18 years, Veatriz has sold accessories such as earrings, necklaces, bracelets, paintings, watches, ladies and mens' belts, diadems, hair clasps, nail polish, hair decorations, and other products that she bought in the United States to resell in Mexico. 

For some 10 years, Veatriz has been the only source of income for the couple. They cover their household expenses from the business, and solicit assistance in buying merchandise, so they can offer their customers a greater variety of products, and at the same time, obtain a larger income to help cover those household expenses.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, artesan goods and more to sell.

loans.name: Karim

texts.es: Karim, de 32 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser muy amable y social. Está casada con Grober, quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de sus dos hijas de 08 y 2 años de edad. Juntos habitan en casa de sus padres, en compañía de su mama, hermana y  sobrina.  La actividad que realiza Karim es la venta de zapatos para damas,  asimismo ropa de damas y caballeros y productos de belleza. Todos estos productos son adquiridos por catálogos y son vendidos a familiares, vecinos y amistades,  a quienes atiende de manera cordial y amable, logrando ganarse su preferencia, de esa manera ellos la recomiendan con otras personas, que al cabo de un tiempo se vuelven también sus  clientes habituales. Tiene más de 01 año dedicándose  a éste negocio, y hasta el momento su esposo es quien más la apoya, consiguiéndole nuevos clientes. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico y le permite tener una ocupación y sentirse una persona productiva, teniendo los deseos de convertirse en una prospera empresaria,. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, y por tanto desea incrementar su stock de productos, así logrará crecer su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP. Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se siente a gusto con su banco comunal, pues  considera un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de un mayor número de mercadería, entre zapatos, ropa y cosméticos,  para tener un stock disponible para la venta, por lo que espera conseguirlos a precios más bajos por comprar en mayor volumen.
texts.en: Karim, who is 32 years old, is an industrious and hardworking woman.  She is also very kind and social.  She is married to Grober, who works in transpiration, and is the father of their two daughters who are 8 and 2 years old.  They live together in their parents' house, along with their mom, sister, and niece.  Karim sells ladies' shoes as well as women's and men's clothing and beauty products.  All of these products are acquired through catalogs, and they are sold to relatives, neighbors, and friends.  She assists them in a cordial and kind manner, earning her place.  In this way, they recommend her to other people, who after one time become her regular customers as well.  She has more than one year of experience in this business.  Her husband is the one who supports her the most, getting new clients.  She likes her business because it provides economic support and allows her to have an occupation.  She feels like a productive person and she has the desire to turn herself into a prosperous business-woman.  She thinks that her business is fairly profitable because of the good earnings that it gives her, so she wants to increase her stock of products so that she will grow her business.  This will be her 2nd loan with the MFP institution.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support, so that she will therefore feel secure to advance with her business.  At the same time, she is pleased with her communal bank, a group that she thinks is tight and supportive.  With the total that she has asked for, 1500 nuevos soles, she will buy a large amount of merchandise including shoes, clothes, and cosmetics so as to have an available stock to sell.  She hopes to get them at lower prices for buying them in larger volume.

loans.use: buy more shoe, clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Melisa Teresa

texts.es:
Melisa es una mujer de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su pareja y su pequeño hijo, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora  entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente Melisa no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con su pequeño.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace tres años Melisa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de confección y costura de ropa, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Melisa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una pequeña maquina remalladora semi industrial; de esta manera Melisa podrá realizar todo tipo de costuras, con ello espera poder aumentar sus servicios e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que poco a poco pueda ir logrando su sueño de tener su casa propia y darle una buena educación a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Melisa is a 20 year old woman who lives in the city of Pisco with her partner and small child, who she loves and considers to be her primary reason for living.  She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed.  Sadly, Melisa was not able to study at the university level, but she would have really liked to do so.  In her free time, she really enjoys playing with her little one.

By her own initiative, and with a great deal of effort and dedication, for the past three years, Melisa has had a small business sewing and tailoring clothing.  Every day, she begins work early in the morning, and she works for about 8 hours a day and thinks it is going well because of her dedication and the good treatment that she provides to her customers.

Melisa is very thankful for the lenders at Kiva, since it is thanks to their help that she will be able to make the purchase of a small semi-industrial serging machine.  In this way, Melisa will be able to make all kinds of seams, and with this, she hopes to be able to expand her services and increase her income, which will serve her greatly in moving little by little toward achieving her dream of having her own house and giving a good education to her young son.

loans.use: to buy a semi-industrial serger (sewing machine).

loans.name: Raúl Alejandro

texts.es:
Raúl es un hombre luchador y emprendedor que se rebusca la vida a costa de todo.
El es soltero y vive con su madre y hermanos menores a los cuales debe sostener y sacar adelante. Por esta razón trabaja incansablemente en su video tienda, la cual tiene acreditada cerca su casa. Desde allí reproduce y copia películas que descarga desde internet ya que cuenta con el código y usuario para realizar esta acción.
Sus películas son de buena calidad y sus clientes siempre están satisfechos con el producto que él les vende.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de frituras y bebidas gaseosas, así podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio y hacer más agradable la visita de sus clientes.
Su principal desafío es la manutención de su familia pues desde siempre ha sido responsable de los ingresos en su hogar.
El sueña con tener otro establecimiento de videos y así generar mayores ganancias, además de poder ofrecer empleo.
texts.en:
Raúl is a hardworking and enterprising man who manages to get by at all costs.  He is single and lives with his mother and younger siblings, whom he is obligated to support and take care of.  For this reason, he works tirelessly in his video store, which he has set up near his home.  From there, he reproduces and copies movies that he downloads from the internet, because he has the code and the username to do so.

His movies are of high quality, and his customers are always satisfied with the product he sells them.

He is asking for a loan to stock up on fried snacks and soda pop.  In this way he will be able to offer better service and make his customers’ visits more agreeable.

His main challenge is supporting his family because he has always been responsible for the household income.  He dreams of having another video store and, in this way, making better earnings.  He would also be able to offer jobs.

loans.use: to buy fried food and soda pop

loans.name: Cruz Edilma

texts.es:
A sus 47 años de edad Cruz logró consolidar un negocio de confección a terceros y línea propia de ropa gracias a la experiencia que obtuvo trabajando en varios talleres, trabaja de lunes a sábado entre 9 y 11 horas diarias dependiendo la cantidad de trabajo y sabe que gracias a sus clientes tiene un buen negocio.
