Quiere ampliar sus horizontes y lograr ofrecer trabajo a las personas más necesitadas por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de una máquina de confeccion e insumos como tela con lo que podrá mejorar su producción, expandirse a nuevas empresas, y aumentar  su volumen de trabajo; dándole así, la oportunidad a una persona de trabajar. 

Su sueño es seguir creciendo y conformar un taller y así, contar la historia de que gracias a los colaboradores y prestadores del portal Kiva y a la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar pudo montar un gran negocio.

loans.use: compra de una máquina de confeccion e insumos como tela con lo que podrá mejorar su producción

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is an active member of Kabuta ladies in action. Nancy is 32 years old married and has 3 children. Her first loan was USD100 and she paid it very well.

Nancy has a dairy cow, which produces10 litres of milk daily. Currently, the cow is about to give birth and the milk will increase to 20 litres per day. She is also a teacher at Kambwe primary school. She sells her milk to a cooperative society at $28 cents per litre and this will give her $5 per day.

loans.use: Nancy intends to pay school fees for her 2 sons who are in college.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Dorcas would like to pay school fees for her daughter

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.en:
Since she was a kid, Mrs Maria de Jesus was involved with sales – her parents had a grocery store. When she got married, her husband’s income was not enough to cover all household expenses and she decided to start selling clothes and stationary. Maria’s husband passed away 2 years ago. She has seven children, all of them married, and lives with one of her grandsons, who is 18 years old and helps her in her business.

Maria needs $775 to buy merchandise and prepare for children’s day, mother’s day and the end of school break, when sales increase. Maria needs your support to grow her business and is grateful for any help you can give.

Translated from Spanish by Virgilio Russi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria de Jesús desde niña estaba relacionada con las ventas, sus papás tenían una tienda de abarrotes, ya casada, el ingreso que recibía su esposo era insuficiente para solventar los gastos del hogar, por lo que decidió iniciar con la venta de mercería y papelería. Hace dos años Maria quedó viuda, tiene siete hijos, ya todos están casados, actualmente vive con uno de sus nietos, de 18 años, que le ayuda a atender su negocio.

En estos momentos Maria necesita de un préstamo por $ 775 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio y prepararse para las fechas del día del niño, de las madres y el regreso a clases que es cuando se incrementan las ventas. Ella necesita de tu ayuda para sacar adelante su negocio, y te agradece cualquier apoyo que puedas brindarle.

loans.use: surtir el negocio

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en: Yeabu C. is thirty-two years old and married with four children.  Her husband migrated to a mining area in Kono, in Eastern Sierra Leone with the hope of getting employed in the mining business, leaving the sole responsibility of the family care to Yeabu.   She runs a small stall business of selling food items like salt, beans, coconut and tomato paste.  With the absence of her husband Yeabu is able to earn enough income to feed her four children.   She is requesting the loan funds to expand her business for better profit. She is determined to keep providing for her family.

loans.use: Increase inventory and diversity of food items for sale in the market

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is 29 years old and is married to Benjamin, who is 34 years old. Their 9 year old son attends primary school. Benjamin works in agriculture and contributes to the household costs with his earnings from the produce sales. Hilda has a small shop in the municipal market where she also sells used clothing She has been doing this for 7 years. They do not have their own house. They live in their parents house and dream about building their own one day.

Hilda did not have the opportunity to study because her family has few resources. That's why she sacrifices so much day after day so that her son lacks nothing, and has the opportunity to get a university education. She manages an average of 20 clients she attends to daily, as well as occassional clients. She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock the store, such as rice, sugar, noodles, flour, cheese, cooking oil, etc. This will allow her to improve her shop and be able to attract a greater number of customers.

Hilda tiene 29 años, está casada desde hace 3 años con Benjamín que tiene 34 años. Ambos tienen un hijo de 9 años que está estudiando el 4to. Año de la primaria. El esposo de Hilda es agricultor y aporta a los ingresos del hogar con las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de los productos que saca de sus cultivos. Hilda posee una pequeña despensa que funciona en el mercado municipal de Itá y además vende ropas usadas. Hace 7 años que se dedica a la misma actividad. Aún no posee casa propia, vive en la de sus padres y sueña con construirla algún día. Comenta que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a que provenía de una familia de escasos recursos, es por eso que día a día se sacrifica para que a su hijo no le falte nada y tenga la oportunidad de acceder a una educación universitaria. Maneja un promedio de 20 clientes que atiende por día que son fijos y otros tantos ocasionales. Desea acceder a un préstamo para comprar mercaderías como: arroz, azúcar, fideo, harina, queso, aceite, etc. para surtir mejor su despensa y así poder atraer una mayor cantidad de clientela a la misma.

loans.use: To buy oil, sugar, cheese, noodles, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Najmiddin

texts.ru:
Najmiddin’s business runs smoothly – he sells household goods at the central market in Kanibadam. Najmiddin is 25 years old and got married recently. His parents and his younger brother help him with his business. 6 months ago Najmiddin received a loan from MicroInvest and rented another shop where his brother sells goods. Najmiddin travels to buy goods. In his newly open shop Najmiddin added new types of goods: gift sets. They are very popular items and bring good profit. Currently, he is planning to add to his assortment kitchenware and is requesting a new loan.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

У Начмиддина хорошо поставленный бизнес – он продает хозяйственные товары на центральном рынке г. Канибадама. Начмиддину 25 лет и недавно он женился. В его бизнесе ему помогают отец с матерью, а также его младший брат. Получив полгода назад займ в Микроинвест он арендовал еще один магазинчик где торгует его брат. За товаром ездит сам Начмиддин. В новом магазинчике он внедрил новые виды товаров – подарочные наборы. Все это пользуется спросом, и прибыль остается хорошая. Сейчас он собирается добавить в ассортимент штучную посуду и поэтому хочет получить новый займ.

loans.use: To purchase kitchenware.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
We find Roxana doing her daily work of making jackets and gloves; she learned the beautiful art thanks to her older sister Norma's teaching her, and since then, with much creativity and patience she makes her beautiful items of clothing in her small shop, beneath her watchful eyes and support of her dear mother and sister. After five years of craftsmanship she acquired two weaving machines, but it is still insufficient to meet the large number of orders that she receives daily.

This 27 year old young mother is asking for a loan in order to be able to purchase a large quantity and variety of raw material (wool) in order ot make her beautiful garments. The wish of this hard-working mother of a 10 month old baby is to be able to export her creations to neighboring countries, and above all, to increase her income in order to be able to remodel her humble home which she bought recently with the help of her husband José, who works as a messenger for the Banco del Trabajo. We support this enthusiastic mother who with talent and effort, wishes to improve her family's future.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Encontramos a Roxana realizando su trabajo cotidiano de confección de chompas y guantes; ella aprendió este bello arte gracias a la enseñanza de su hermana mayor Norma y desde entonces con mucho creatividad y paciencia confeccionan sus hermosas prendas de vestir en su pequeño taller bajo las atentas miradas y apoyo de su querida madre y hermana.Después de cinco años de haberse dedicado permanentemente a este oficio ha adquirido dos máquinas de tejer, pero aún es insuficiente para cumplir con la gran cantidad de pedidos que recibe diariamente.

La solicitud de esta joven madre de 27 años de edad servirá para que pueda adquirir mayor cantidad y variedad de materia prima (lana) para la confección de sus hermosas prendas. El deseo de esta laboriosa madre de un bebé de diez meses es porque desea exportar sus confecciones a los países vecinos y sobre todo para incrementar sus ingresos a fin de poder refaccionar su humilde casita que compró hace poco con ayuda de su esposo José, quien se desempeña como mensajero en el Banco del Trabajo.Apoyemos a esta madre entusiasta que con talento y esfuerzo desea salir adelante con su familia.

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity and variety of raw materials to make her clothing items

loans.name: Irada

texts.en: Irada (her brother is pictured) was born in 1967. She and her brother sell apples and dates. They have been in this business for 4 years. Now Irada needs a loan of $850 to buy additional fruits for to increase their  sales.

loans.use: To buy fruits to sell

loans.name: Nasuti C(Ii) Group

texts.en:
Joyce, Beatrice, Jennifer and Christine are poultry farmers. With the extra business profits, Joyce wants to pay school fees for her children and improve her home. Cissy has a retail shop and wants to use the loan to increase stock in her shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry feeds.

loans.name: Yam

texts.en:
Mrs. Yam L. and her husband have been married since 1993. They have six children; four sons and two daughters. Four of their children are studying in the local school and the youngest two stay at home. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. L. has been raising pigs and growing a vegetable garden for over ten years. She grows papayas, eggplant and tomatoes on her farm. Her husband, Mr. Khem You, is a construction worker and a part time fisherman.

She is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $400 to reconstruct the stairs of her home.

loans.use: To reconstruct stairs in the home

loans.name: Huklla Llamkasun Group

texts.en:
“Huklla Llamkasun” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari-project which provides its credit with educational services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and has many limitations, being a very mountainous area (altituD. ranges from 6,000 – 17,000 ft above sea level). People who live there also face the cold, difficulty growing crops, and the lack of an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

BCR “Huklla Llamkasun” is located in the community of Añancusi in the district of Acoria, province of Huancavelica. The translation of the Quechua-name of the group is “Let´s work as if we were one”. The main activities of the population are growing tropical fruits at lower altitudes and corn, potatoes and wheat at higher altitudes. At still higher altitudes, the people are dedicated to raising bulls and cows, with alpacas and lamas at the highest altitudes. But the size of the community and its (limited) access to public transport has brought more commerce to the village; every Tuesday there is a local market where people sell and buy most of what they need.

This bank has been formed recently by 17 female borrowers and therefore has no history yet…. It has only just started to create history in its community! The expectations working with FINCA Peru are very clear: increase business and save. For all members, the main use of the savings they will be generating from now on is for investing in their business or for the education of their children, whether it is buying school uniforms, supplies, books or even to pay the fees for entering primary or secondary school.

Although many women dedicate their time to similar businesses, they require different loan amounts because of the differences in the size of the business they run …. The loans range from 200 soles, 300 soles, up to 500 soles; the total of the loans of the 17 members is 5,400 soles (US$ 1925).

One of the group members, Lucila R. Nolberta, sells fruit at local markets. Another business she runs is raising small cattle. As is the case in most families, besides her business, she dedicates most of her time to the cultivation of potatoes, wheat, and oca (a root vegetable), which she uses for home consumption. With her 200 soles loan she will be able to buy more fruits. When asked about her future, she tells us that her dream is the education of her children so they can be professionals and go on studying. She simply wants to make her life and that of her family better. With her (future) savings she plans to buy more chickens and pigs, to sell when they have grown big.

Juliana D. Marín, who sells clothes and shoes in her small shop, tells us a slightly different story. Like Lucila, Juliana grows potatoes, wheat, and other crops for home consumption. With her loan of 500 soles, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business. With more merchandise, she will be able to earn a little more and therefore save more. Her dream for the future is to live a good life with her family and her children. Her expectations in working with FINCA Peru are to learn to work harder and be more responsible.

loans.use: expanding their various small businesses

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira is a popular and admired woman in her family, with a lot of insistence and effort she has successfully concluded her Masters studies, but because of work opportunities in her country she could not practice her profession, because of this she has decided to seek another method of generating her own income and support her husband with the expenses of their home and the education of their 2 adorable children that she diligently cares for by selling clothing. The desire of Elvira and her husband Hermenegildo who works as a professor in a modest school that is far away from the city of Juliaca is to finish renovations on their house; this will give them security and peacefulness; but now Elvira seeing the movement that exists in her business, she hopes to generate more earnings with this investment and bring tranquility to her family. With your contribution you will allow her family to live in an environment full of tranquility and wellbeing.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Elvira es una dama muy popular, querida y admirada en su entorno familiar y laboral, con mucho empeño y esfuerzo ha concluido con mucho éxito sus estudios supriores de maestra, pero por falta de oportunidades laborales en su país no puede ejercer su profesión, por esa razón decidió buscar la manera de generar sus propios ingresos económicos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus 2 adorables hijos que a pesar de su corta edad la apoyan diligentemente en su negocio de venta de ropa.El deseo de Elvira y su esposo Hermenegildo quien trabaja como profesor en una humilde y lejana escuelita de la ciudad de Juliaca es terminar de refaccionar su casita, pequeña morada que hicieron construir con muchas ilusiones de acoger, brindarles seguridad y tranquilidad a sus retoños; pero ahora doña Elvira viendo el movimiento que existe en su negocio desea aumentar el monto de inversión con el fin de generar mayores ingresos para la tranquilidad de su familia.“Con tu contribución permitirás que esta familia viva en un ambiente lleno de tranquilidad y bienestar”

loans.use: An increase of capital for her work to offer a better quantity of clothing

loans.name: Corazon De Oro I Group

texts.es:
The women that make up the Corazon de Oro I group are from a town called El Jaibalito located on the shores of Atitlan Lake. El Jaibalito is a small town located on a very steep hill. Almost all homes are located on the mountain slope. This small town is not connected to other neighboring towns by any roads due to the mountainous terrain and the volcanoes, which make it difficult to build a road. You can only reach the town by boat.

Usually when a town is isolated the local culture remains intact and this is the case with El Jaibalito. The women mainly speak Maya-Tzutujil, and as you can see in the photo they wear their traditional garb. The lack of exposure to other cultures inhibits the townspeople when they encounter a “foreigner.” The meeting between the women and myself was very funny. They spend the entire interview laughing and it was a very entertaining moment.

All the women that belong to this group are weavers. They are going to invest their loan in the purchase of raw materials and different colored threads. With this thread they are gong to make beautiful traditional costumes using ancient waist loom techniques. The women in the region of Atitlan are taught how to weaved by their mothers at the age of nine years old.

The women believe the loan is useful because it will help them buy a large quantity of thread and with this they will be able to make more huipiles (embroidered blouses), whether their clients pay them on time or not.

This group of women is always smiling and they deserve an opportunity to succeed as entrepreneurs. Through this loan they can get this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Las señoras que conforman el grupo Corazón de Oro I vienen de un pueblo llamado “el Jaibalito” ubicado a las orillas del Lago Atitlán. El Jaibalito es un pueblo muy pequeño que está ubicado en una cuesta muy, pero muy, empinada. Casi todas las casas están ubicadas en las laderas de una montaña. Este pequeño pueblo no está conectado por carreteras con los otros pueblos vecinos ya que la complicada geografía de las montañas y volcanes no permite que una carretera sea construida. Solo se puede llegar al pueblo por medio de lanchas.

Usualmente cuando un pueblo esta aislado, la cultura del lugar permanece intacta, y el Jaibalito no es la excepción. Las mujeres hablan mayormente el Maya-Tzutujil y, como se ve en la foto, ellas visten sus bellos trajes tradicionales. La falta de exposición a otras culturas inhibe a la gente cuando ellas ven a un “extranjero”. El encuentro entre las señoras y mi persona fue muy gracioso. Las mujeres se pasaron toda la entrevista riéndose. Ese momento fue muy ameno.

Todas las señoras que pertenecen a este grupo son tejedoras. Ellas van a invertir su crédito en la compra de materia prima, hilos de distintos colores. Con estos hilos, ellas van a elaborar bellos trajes tradicionales utilizando la técnica antigua de telar de cintura. Las mujeres en la región de Atitlán aprenden, de sus madres, a tejer desde que tienen nueve años de edad.

Las mujeres piensan que el crédito si les sirve porque les ayuda a comprar mayor cantidad de hilo y con este poder elaborar más huipiles, independientemente si sus clientes le pagan o no a tiempo.

Este grupo de señoras que cargan una bella sonrisa todos lados merecen una oportunidad de salir adelante como empresarias. Por medio de este crédito esta oportunidad se les puede brindar.

loans.use: To purchase thread for making traditional costumes
